original: blo ldan rnams kyi las dang ni //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyi las dang ni //
translated: The wise are born by the power of karma,

original: gzhan yang smon lam dag dang ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang smon lam dag dang ni //
translated: by the power of their vows,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang dbang 'byor ba'i //üîΩdbang gis skye bar 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang dbang 'byor ba'i // dbang gis skye bar 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: by the power of concentration, and by the power of mastery.

original: de la las kyi dbang gis skye ba ni mos pas spyod @126a * //
analyzed: de la las kyi dbang gis skye ba ni mos pas spyod @126a * //
translated: The wise are born by the power of karma, by the power of their vows, by the power of concentration, and by the power of mastery.

original: pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams bsod nams kyi las kyis gang 'dod pa'i gnas su skye ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams bsod nams kyi las kyis gang 'dod pa'i gnas su skye ba'o //
translated: Birth by the power of karma is the birth of those on the stage of action in faith, wherever they wish, by the power of their meritorious karma.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba ni sa la zhugs pa rnams smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩdud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas dman par yang skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba ni sa la zhugs pa rnams smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir / dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas dman par yang skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Birth by the power of vows is the birth of those who have entered the stages, wherever they wish, by the power of their vows, in order to develop living beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis skye ba ni bsam gtan bsgom yang de'i dbang gis bsam gtan gyi lha'i skye ba mi 'dzin par sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis skye ba ni bsam gtan bsgom yang de'i dbang gis bsam gtan gyi lha'i skye ba mi 'dzin par sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
translated: Birth by the power of concentration is the birth of bodhisattvas in the desire realm, by the power of their concentration, in order to benefit living beings, even though they have attained the concentrations, without taking birth in the worldly realms of the Brahma gods.üîΩBirth by the power of mastery is the birth of bodhisattvas in the worldly realms of the Brahma gods, by the power of their mastery, in order to benefit living beings, even though they have attained the mastery of being able to remain for an aeon or the remainder of an aeon.

original: dbang 'byor ba'i dbang gis skye ba ni sprul pa dag gis dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par skye ba kun du ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba'i dbang gis skye ba ni sprul pa dag gis dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par skye ba kun du ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Birth through mastery is the birth of emanations, such as the display of birth in the abode of Tushita.

original: de la 'dir ni srid par smon lam dang thabs sngon du btang bas zhes pas te /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni srid par smon lam dang thabs sngon du btang bas zhes pas te /
translated: Here, the verse refers to birth through prayer and skillful means.

original: smon lam gyi skye ba la sogs pa gsum po rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi skye ba la sogs pa gsum po rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the three types of birth through prayer and so on.

original: de yang sems can gyi don du srid par skye ba nyid du smon lam btab pa dang / bden pa gnyis kyi thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan bsgom yang /
analyzed: de yang sems can gyi don du srid par skye ba nyid du smon lam btab pa dang / bden pa gnyis kyi thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan bsgom yang /
translated: Moreover, it is the prayer for birth in existence for the sake of sentient beings, the cultivation of concentration through skill in the two truths,

original: don dam par de dag gi yul dang / bde ba'i ro la mi chags te /
analyzed: don dam par de dag gi yul dang / bde ba'i ro la mi chags te /
translated: and the nonattachment to the taste of bliss as the object of those concentrations.

original: stong pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su skyes kyang de dag gi rang bzhin stong par rtogs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis mi gos shing kun rdzob tu snang ba dang bcas pa'i blos de dag gi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su skyes kyang de dag gi rang bzhin stong par rtogs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis mi gos shing kun rdzob tu snang ba dang bcas pa'i blos de dag gi don byed pa ste /
translated: The realization of emptiness and the birth in the desire realm, the nondefilement by desire through the realization of the nature of those as empty, and the performance of their benefit with a mind that has the appearance of the relative.

original: 'di'i don ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of this has been explained above.

original: gzhan yang thabs la mkhas pa gdul bya ji ltar 'dul bar gyur ba'i skur sprul nas kyang sems can gyi don byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thabs la mkhas pa gdul bya ji ltar 'dul bar gyur ba'i skur sprul nas kyang sems can gyi don byed ces pa'o //
translated: Moreover, through skillful means, he manifests bodies in whatever way is necessary to train disciples and thereby benefits sentient beings.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid dang / ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid dang / ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the entity that possesses the identity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshul rab tu thob pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshul rab tu thob pa ste //
translated: Therefore, he has attained the method of that,

original: de'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and he possesses that attribute.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chen po ni don dam par chos thams cad thog ma nas mya ngan las 'das par shes shing //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chen po ni don dam par chos thams cad thog ma nas mya ngan las 'das par shes shing //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva's great desire is to know that ultimately all things are originally in a state of nirvana,

original: gzod mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la sogs pa'i chos ma mthong nas shin du mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing /
analyzed: gzod mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la sogs pa'i chos ma mthong nas shin du mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing /
translated: and not to attain nirvana quickly, etc., because he does not see any dharma that is to be attained in nirvana.

original: kun rdzob tu yang sems can gyi don la mngon par zhen pas mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang sems can gyi don la mngon par zhen pas mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes pa'o //
translated: And he does not attain nirvana even conventionally, because he is intent on the benefit of sentient beings.

original: gal te de lta na sems can gyi don ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta na sems can gyi don ni /
translated: If that is so, then the benefit of sentient beings

original: sangs rgyas nas chos kyi sku'i ye shes spros pa dang bral ba mngon du byas pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas chos kyi sku'i ye shes spros pa dang bral ba mngon du byas pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though the buddhas have attained the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya free from conceptual elaborations,

original: rjes thob la @126b gzugs sku gnyis su snang ba la sogs pas byed par ji ste mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩbden mod kyi sems can gyi don la mngon par zhen pas sprul pa 'ba' zhig gis dman pa rnams kyi don byas kyang yid ches par mi 'gyur bas de dang de dag tu skye ba len pa'am /
analyzed: rjes thob la @126b gzugs sku gnyis su snang ba la sogs pas byed par ji ste mi 'gyur zhe na / bden mod kyi sems can gyi don la mngon par zhen pas sprul pa 'ba' zhig gis dman pa rnams kyi don byas kyang yid ches par mi 'gyur bas de dang de dag tu skye ba len pa'am /
translated: why would they not act in postmeditation by appearing as the two form kƒÅyas?

original: gzhan yang rung ste dngos su rang nyid kyis don byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste dngos su rang nyid kyis don byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is true, but since they are not fixated on the benefit of sentient beings, even though they benefit those of lesser capacity solely through emanations, they will not be believed. Therefore, they take birth in those places or else they themselves directly benefit others.

original: brgya la gal te na zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: brgya la gal te na zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand, they do‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yod cing /
analyzed: de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yod cing /
translated: Even in those realms, the essence of the tathƒÅgatas, which is the nature of the all-base consciousness, exists.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon yod pa cung zad sad pa'i dus la bab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs tshogs pas /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon yod pa cung zad sad pa'i dus la bab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs tshogs pas /
translated: When the time has come for the seeds of the roots of virtue to be slightly awakened, and when the blessings of the compassion of the Tathagata and so forth are assembled,

original: de'i dri ma sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dri ma sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the stains of the beings are purified.üîΩBy these topics of the present section, one should also apply the answer to the previous question:

original: skabs kyi don 'di rnams kyis kyang sngar gyi dri ba ji ltar theg pa gsum du 'gyur /
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di rnams kyis kyang sngar gyi dri ba ji ltar theg pa gsum du 'gyur /
translated: How can there be three vehicles?

original: rigs dang rigs med ji ltar cis //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs med ji ltar cis //
translated: How can there be those with potential and those without?

original: 'dod chen por yang ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chen por yang ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can there be one of great desire?

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: How can there be one who is unborn and unceasing?

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog 'dra //üîΩzhes pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya ste //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog 'dra // zhes pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya ste //
translated: How can there be one like a sky-flower?

original: spyir shes par bya ba'i tshul du gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: spyir shes par bya ba'i tshul du gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: This is the general way of understanding and determining.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: Moreover, beginning with ‚ÄúMahamati, those bodhisattvas, great beings,‚ÄùüîΩthe answer to the questions beginning withüîΩ‚Äúselflessness, the five dharmas,

original: bdag med pa dang chos lnga dang // rang bzhin rtogs dang brtag pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang chos lnga dang // rang bzhin rtogs dang brtag pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du /
translated: realizing the nature, and investigation,‚Äù

original: shes par bya ba'i gnas theg pa chen po'i don bsdus pa snga ma las tshul gzhan du gyur ba nyid ston te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i gnas theg pa chen po'i don bsdus pa snga ma las tshul gzhan du gyur ba nyid ston te /
translated: It shows that the basis of knowledge, the meaning of the Mahayana, is different from the former summary.

original: de la sngar bstan pa ltar rtog pa'i gzung bar gyur ba'i kun brtags pa /
analyzed: de la sngar bstan pa ltar rtog pa'i gzung bar gyur ba'i kun brtags pa /
translated: As previously taught, the imagined is the object of conceptualization.

original: rtogs pa'i blo nyid du gyur ba'i bdag nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma las byung ba'o //üîΩgal te brtags pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i blo nyid du gyur ba'i bdag nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan ma las byung ba'o // gal te brtags pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: The nature of the mind that conceptualizes arises from the signs of the dependent.

original: ji ltar mtshan ma las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan ma las 'byung zhe na /
translated: If the imagined is unreal, how does it arise from signs?

original: 'di ltar kun brtags pa de 'dra ba ni rnam grangs kyis gzhan gyi dbang nyid du yang 'gyur bas 'gal ba med ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun brtags pa de 'dra ba ni rnam grangs kyis gzhan gyi dbang nyid du yang 'gyur bas 'gal ba med ces pa'o //
translated: Since the imagined is a synonym for the dependent, there is no contradiction.

original: de las gzhan gyi dbang ni dngos po'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid du snang ba 'am zhen pa blo'i ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi dbang ni dngos po'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid du snang ba 'am zhen pa blo'i ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The dependent is the appearance or conception of the characteristics of things, which is the nature of the mind.

original: de ltar zhen pa yang rnam par gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar zhen pa yang rnam par gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Conception is twofold:

original: zhen pa'i yul dang / blo'i bdag nyid do /
analyzed: zhen pa'i yul dang / blo'i bdag nyid do /
translated: the object of conception and the nature of the mind.

original: yul ni kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: yul ni kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: The object is only the imagined.üîΩAnd that is twofold:

original: de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: 'di ni gzugs so @127a * //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so @127a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is form,‚Äù etc.üîΩThe characteristic of attachment to names, and the characteristic of attachment to the sign of the thing, the universal image of the object, form, etc.,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ming la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de 'dra ba'i brda mi shes pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ming la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de 'dra ba'i brda mi shes pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: by those who do not know the convention.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don spyi'i dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dang / da ltar rtog cing zhen pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don spyi'i dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dang / da ltar rtog cing zhen pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The imagined nature is twofold, in terms of those two characteristics. The other-dependent is the present conceptualization and attachment.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su 'jog ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su 'jog ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be applied in terms of those two aspects.

original: nang dang phyi'i chos ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i chos ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams so //
translated: The internal and external phenomena are the internal and external sense bases.

original: yongs su shes shing khong du chud zhes pa yang zhen pa dang bcas pa'i blos spyi'i tshul du sgo 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes shing khong du chud zhes pa yang zhen pa dang bcas pa'i blos spyi'i tshul du sgo 'dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnderstanding and comprehending‚Äù means superimposing the door in the manner of a universal.

original: gal te de lta na dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa gnyis tshul tha dad pas de'i dbye ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa gnyis tshul tha dad pas de'i dbye ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If one says this, since the mode of the two, the characteristic of manifest clinging to the sign of an entity and the characteristic of the sign, is different, it is not tenable that they are its divisions.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: ji ltar shing dang sha pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra yang /
analyzed: ji ltar shing dang sha pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra yang /
translated: Just as a tree and a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ are not similar in their characteristics,

original: sha pa shing gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par yin pas de'i dbye bar 'thad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: sha pa shing gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par yin pas de'i dbye bar 'thad pa bzhin du /
translated: since a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ is a particular that is of the nature of a tree, it is tenable that it is its division.

original: dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa yang mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhan pas khyab cing de'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i dbye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa yang mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhan pas khyab cing de'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i dbye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, since manifest clinging to the sign of an entity is necessarily manifest clinging to the characteristic of the sign and is of its nature, it is taught to be its division.

original: gal te ba lang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud cing mngon par zhen pa med pas kyang ba lang gi dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te ba lang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud cing mngon par zhen pa med pas kyang ba lang gi dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa bzhin du /
translated: If one says that just as one clings to the sign of the entity of an ox without understanding and without manifest clinging to its characteristics,

original: nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyi mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud cing mngon par zhen pa med kyang /üîΩchos de dag gi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pas de ltar zhen pa ni mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pas khyab cing /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyi mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud cing mngon par zhen pa med kyang / chos de dag gi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pas de ltar zhen pa ni mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pas khyab cing /
translated: Although they do not comprehend the characteristics of the signs of inner and outer phenomena and do not conceive of them,üîΩthey conceive of the signs of those phenomena.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i khyad par du mi 'thad do zhe na /üîΩskyon med de /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba'i khyad par du mi 'thad do zhe na / skyon med de /
translated: Thus they are pervaded by conceiving of the characteristics of signs, and it is untenable that they are distinguished by being of the nature of that.

original: mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad ma thogs pa de lta na yang don ni ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par zhen cing khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad ma thogs pa de lta na yang don ni ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par zhen cing khong du chud pa ste /
translated: There is no error because although they do not employ the conventions of the characteristics of signs, they conceive of the meaning just as it is and comprehend it.

original: ji ltar blun pos ba lang gi dngos po'i mtshan nyid mngon par zhen cing khong du chud pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar blun pos ba lang gi dngos po'i mtshan nyid mngon par zhen cing khong du chud pa na /
translated: When fools conceive of and comprehend the characteristics of the entity of an ox,

original: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad ma thogs shing mngon par zhen pa med kyang /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad ma thogs shing mngon par zhen pa med kyang /
translated: they do not employ the conventions of the characteristics of that which possesses a dewlap and so on and do not conceive of them.

original: de 'dra ba'i don khong du chud cing mngon par zhen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i don khong du chud cing mngon par zhen pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the case of someone who has understood such a meaning and is attached to it.

original: de bzhin du ming la mngon par zhen pa yang ming don dang sbyar nas mngon par @127b zhen gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ming la mngon par zhen pa yang ming don dang sbyar nas mngon par @127b zhen gyi /
translated: In the same way, attachment to names is also attachment to names in connection with meanings.

original: don dang ma 'brel ba'i ming du mngon par zhen pa mi 'thad pas mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i dbye bar 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: don dang ma 'brel ba'i ming du mngon par zhen pa mi 'thad pas mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i dbye bar 'thad pa'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable to be attached to a name that is not connected with a meaning, it is tenable that the classification of attachment to the characteristics of signs is twofold.

original: blo gros chen po de ni zhes pa mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ming dang dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i yul de ni sngar bstan pa ltar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid gnyis so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ni zhes pa mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ming dang dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i yul de ni sngar bstan pa ltar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid gnyis so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, that which is the nature of attachment to the characteristics of signs, the object of attachment to the signs of names and things, is as was previously explained, the two characteristics of the imagined nature.

original: de 'dra ba'i kun brtags ni mtshan nyid yongs su chud pa kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig yin pas mtshan ma las skye ba mi 'thad la //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i kun brtags ni mtshan nyid yongs su chud pa kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig yin pas mtshan ma las skye ba mi 'thad la //
translated: Since such an imagined nature is only the imagined nature that is fully understood as a characteristic, it is not tenable that it arises from signs.

original: mtshan ma las skye ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma las skye ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs kyi kun brtags pa'o //
translated: The arising from signs is the nominal imagined nature, as previously explained.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na de ni zhes pa'i don dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na de ni zhes pa'i don dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa ste //
translated: In one sense, it is the manifest clinging to the signs of entities.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid sngar bstan pa las gnyis pa'o zhes pa ste grangs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid sngar bstan pa las gnyis pa'o zhes pa ste grangs gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second of the previously explained characteristics of the imagined nature is the second, i.e., the second in number.

original: de la gnas shing dmigs pa las byung zhes pa ni rnam grangs kyi kun brtags rtog pa'i gzung ba de la gnas shing dmigs pa'i blo snga ma las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la gnas shing dmigs pa las byung zhes pa ni rnam grangs kyi kun brtags rtog pa'i gzung ba de la gnas shing dmigs pa'i blo snga ma las byung ba ste /
translated: The arising from the prior intellect that abides and arises from the objective referent is the prior intellect that abides and arises from the objective referent of the imagined nature, which is the object of conceptual differentiation.

original: de ltar snang ba'i blo phyi ma gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i blo phyi ma gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: The subsequent intellect that appears in that way is the dependent nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the perfected is

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te /
translated: the domain of the transcendent wisdom of the noble ones‚Äô individual intuitive knowledge.

original: ye shes rang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos nyid 'gyur ba med pa'i yongs su grub pa dang / de ltar rtog pa'i rigs pa'i cha phyin ci log pa'i yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes rang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos nyid 'gyur ba med pa'i yongs su grub pa dang / de ltar rtog pa'i rigs pa'i cha phyin ci log pa'i yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The consummate nature that is the opposite of the aspect of reasoning that conceives of things in that way.

original: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de ltar bden cing grub pas yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de ltar bden cing grub pas yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is true and established just as it is posited, it is called the consummate nature.

original: gzhan yang 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'i dbang du byas na kun du rtog pa 'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'i dbang du byas na kun du rtog pa 'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, in this context, if we consider the middle way of vij√±aptimƒÅtra, imagination and so on are the dependent nature.

original: sems nyid rig pa rang gi rigs snga ma la rag las te /
analyzed: sems nyid rig pa rang gi rigs snga ma la rag las te /
translated: The mind itself is dependent on its own previous type.

original: byung ba sgyur ma lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
analyzed: byung ba sgyur ma lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
translated: The dependent nature is like a transformation that has arisen.

original: de nyid la yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags shing zhen par byas pa'i don ni kun du brtags pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid la yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags shing zhen par byas pa'i don ni kun du brtags pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: The imputed nature is the imputation and clinging by the mind that conceives of things as existent, nonexistent, and so on in that dependent nature.

original: de ltar zhen cing sgro btags pa'i don gyis stong pa'i gzhan dbang rigs pa dang stong pa zung ngu 'jug pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /üîΩdbyings dang ye shes kyi ldog pas go @128a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhen cing sgro btags pa'i don gyis stong pa'i gzhan dbang rigs pa dang stong pa zung ngu 'jug pa ni yongs su grub pa ste / dbyings dang ye shes kyi ldog pas go @128a * //
translated: The dependent is empty of the object conceived and imputed in that way. The union of the dependent and emptiness is the real.

original: rims bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa zhes dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang yang ma dag pa dang rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rims bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa zhes dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa lta bu'o // gzhan gyi dbang yang ma dag pa dang rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is called the ‚Äúunchanging perfect‚Äù and the ‚Äúunmistaken perfect,‚Äù respectively, as Distinguishing the Middle from the Extremes declares.üîΩThe dependent is also twofold: impure and pure.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: It is subsumed by the afflictive and purified classes.

original: kun brtags pa ni snga ma ltar mtshan nyid yongs su chad pa dang / rnam grangs dang ltos pa'i kun brtags te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni snga ma ltar mtshan nyid yongs su chad pa dang / rnam grangs dang ltos pa'i kun brtags te /
translated: The imagined is threefold: the imagined that is a complete designation of characteristics, the imagined that is a synonym, and the imagined that is a dependent designation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: yod pa'i zla la ltos nas 'di ni med pa 'ba' zhig go zhes pa 'am /
analyzed: yod pa'i zla la ltos nas 'di ni med pa 'ba' zhig go zhes pa 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence on the existence of the moon, this is only the absence of the moon.‚Äù

original: ring ba dang thung ba la sogs pa phan tshun ltos pa'i dbang gis blos sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: ring ba dang thung ba la sogs pa phan tshun ltos pa'i dbang gis blos sgro btags pa ste /
translated: Long and short and so on are mutually dependent upon each other and are mentally imputed.üîΩThe imaginary is threefold:

original: mtshan nyid cha dang rnam grangs dang // ltos pa'i kun brtags rnam pa gsum //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid cha dang rnam grangs dang // ltos pa'i kun brtags rnam pa gsum // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: character, enumeration, and dependence.

original: rang bzhin gsum po de rnams kyis kyang chos lnga bsdus pa nyid du tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum po de rnams kyis kyang chos lnga bsdus pa nyid du tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas ston te /
translated: The five dharmas are also included in the three natures, as shown in the following verse.

original: de la ming dang rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa ni kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: de la ming dang rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa ni kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyis bsdus te /
translated: Name, sign, and discrimination are included in the imaginary and dependent natures.

original: de yang mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba ni de ltar rtogs pa'i blo'i bdag nyid yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gis kyang bsdus la /
analyzed: de yang mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba ni de ltar rtogs pa'i blo'i bdag nyid yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gis kyang bsdus la /
translated: Moreover, the apprehended object of the imagination of signs is the nature of the mind that imagines it, and thus it is also included in the dependent.

original: rnam grangs kyis na phyin ci la log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi yin pas kun du brtags pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis na phyin ci la log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi yin pas kun du brtags pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: But it is also called imaginary because it is the basis of the superimposition of error.

original: ming du snang ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar 'di bum pa zhes don dang 'brel ba'i bdag nyid kho nar zhen gyi /
analyzed: ming du snang ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar 'di bum pa zhes don dang 'brel ba'i bdag nyid kho nar zhen gyi /
translated: The appearance as name is, as previously explained, only the adherence to the nature of the connection between the object and the term, such as ‚Äúthis is a pot.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i khyad par gyi chos su zhen pa med par spyi rnam par snang ba mi 'thad pas kun du brtags pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i khyad par gyi chos su zhen pa med par spyi rnam par snang ba mi 'thad pas kun du brtags pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Since it is not tenable that a universal appears without the adherence to a particular quality, it is only imagination.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni sngar bstan pa ltar yongs su grub pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni sngar bstan pa ltar yongs su grub pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Correct pristine wisdom and reality are included in the two kinds of perfected natures, as previously explained.

original: de ltar chos kyi bye brag sna tshogs su rnam par gzhag pa yang /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi bye brag sna tshogs su rnam par gzhag pa yang /
translated: Thus, the various classifications of phenomena

original: sems can las tha dad pa med pas 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can las tha dad pa med pas 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul zhes pa'o //
translated: are called the domain of the noble ones‚Äô individual self-knowledge because they are not different from the sentient beings‚Äô mind.

original: rang bzhin gsum po nyid kyang bdag med pa gnyis kyis bsdus la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum po nyid kyang bdag med pa gnyis kyis bsdus la /
translated: The three natures are also included in the two kinds of selflessness.

original: de la gang zag gi bdag med pa shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus pa rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs par shes shing /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi bdag med pa shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus pa rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs par shes shing /
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of persons is the knowledge of impermanence, suffering, etc. of the phenomena of the addiction class, included in the truths of suffering and origin.

original: phyi rol bas brtags pa'i rtag pa dang / bdag @128b dang ; gtsang ba la sogs pas dben par shes par bya'o //üîΩ'dir rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang phyi rol bas brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pas dben pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyi rol bas brtags pa'i rtag pa dang / bdag @128b dang ; gtsang ba la sogs pas dben par shes par bya'o // 'dir rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang phyi rol bas brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pas dben pa yin mod kyi /
translated: It is the knowledge of the emptiness of the self, permanence, pleasure, and purity imagined by non-Buddhists.üîΩHere, the class of purification is also empty of the self, etc. imagined by non-Buddhists, but that is not mentioned as a special knowledge of the selflessness of persons.

original: de mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa thog ma nyid du yid 'byung ba'i gnas ma yin pas de dag shes pa ni gang zag la bdag med par shes pa'i khyad par nyid du ma gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa thog ma nyid du yid 'byung ba'i gnas ma yin pas de dag shes pa ni gang zag la bdag med par shes pa'i khyad par nyid du ma gsungs pa'o //
translated: That is because the knowledge of that is not the first basis of disgust with impurity, suffering, etc.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis dbang po thams cad las rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni shes par byed de zhes 'og tu sbyar bar
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis dbang po thams cad las rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni shes par byed de zhes 'og tu sbyar bar
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is that consciousness arises from all the sense faculties by the power of the habitual tendencies of manifest clinging to the things of grasped and grasper, such as name and form, and so on.üîΩThis is to be applied below.

original: bya'o // gang zhig rnam par shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: bya'o // gang zhig rnam par shes par byed ce na /
translated: What is it that is made conscious?

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par byed ce na /
translated: How is it made conscious?

original: phung po la sogs pa ri gzar gyi chu 'bab pa dang / sa bon gyi skad cig 'gag par 'gyur ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ri gzar gyi chu 'bab pa dang / sa bon gyi skad cig 'gag par 'gyur ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe aggregates, etc., are like a waterfall, the cessation of the moment of the seed, etc.,‚Äù and so on. It is just consciousness.

original: g-yo ba spre'u dang 'dra zhes pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba spre'u dang 'dra zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMotion is like a monkey.‚Äù

original: rgyun mi brten pa'am rnam shes yul la g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi brten pa'am rnam shes yul la g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is an unstable continuum or the motion of consciousness to an object.

original: sbrang ma lta bur rang nyid mi gtsang zhing yul mi gtsang ba la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sbrang ma lta bur rang nyid mi gtsang zhing yul mi gtsang ba la spyod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLike a fly, one is oneself impure and engages in impure objects.‚Äù

original: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis gang ba la sogs par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis gang ba la sogs par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is filled with the thirty-two impure substances, and so on.

original: mgon med pa ste bsod nams kyi snang ba las ma gtogs pa dbang phyug lta bu'i skyabs kyi gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: mgon med pa ste bsod nams kyi snang ba las ma gtogs pa dbang phyug lta bu'i skyabs kyi gnas med pa ste /
translated: It is without a protector, for there is no refuge like God, apart from the light of merit.

original: 'dis kyang 'gro ba sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to //üîΩme 'bar ba ltar yul la 'dod pa mched cing chog mi shes pa 'am /
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'gro ba sdug bsngal ba nyid du bstan to // me 'bar ba ltar yul la 'dod pa mched cing chog mi shes pa 'am /
translated: This also shows that the world is suffering.üîΩIt is like a blazing fire, for it is insatiable and insatiable in its desire for objects.

original: de'i reg bya la zhen cing chog mi shes pa dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //üîΩzo chun ltar 'khor ba nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i reg bya la zhen cing chog mi shes pa dang mtshungs zhes pa'o // zo chun ltar 'khor ba nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni /
translated: Or it is like a person who is insatiable and attached to the touch of a lover.üîΩThe wheel of life is explained as being like a waterwheel.

original: srid pa'i 'gro ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wheel of life is like a waterwheel, etc.

original: de 'dra ba'i lus 'byung zhing 'jug pa la rang dbang thob pa'i sems yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lus 'byung zhing 'jug pa la rang dbang thob pa'i sems yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a mind that has attained mastery over the arising and entering of such a body?

original: sgyu ma dang ro langs dang / shing gi 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra bar de kho na nyid du dbang bsgyur ba'i sems med ces pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang ro langs dang / shing gi 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra bar de kho na nyid du dbang bsgyur ba'i sems med ces pa'o //
translated: There is no mind that has mastery over reality, like an illusion, a zombie, or a wooden machine.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can gyis de 'dra ba'i gang zag la bdag med pa shes pa ni thog ma nyid du 'khor ba la yid byung nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug par @129a * //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can gyis de 'dra ba'i gang zag la bdag med pa shes pa ni thog ma nyid du 'khor ba la yid byung nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug par @129a * //
translated: Those of the sravaka and other lineages who know selflessness in such a person first become disenchanted with cyclic existence and then enter the path to nirvana.üîΩ

original: 'gyur ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The understanding of the selflessness of such a person by those of the ≈õrƒÅvaka type and so on is endowed with the intention to turn away from cyclic existence and enter the path to nirvana from the very beginning.

original: de ltar rtogs pas kyang rim gyis chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pas kyang rim gyis chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: By such realization, one gradually realizes the selflessness of phenomena.

original: phung po 'dus pa tsam zhes pa ming dang gzugs 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: phung po 'dus pa tsam zhes pa ming dang gzugs 'dus pa ste /
translated: The mere collection of aggregates is name-and-form.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi sa bon sred pa'i brlan gyis btsas pa'i srad bu lta bus de rnams bsdus shing sbrel ba /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi sa bon sred pa'i brlan gyis btsas pa'i srad bu lta bus de rnams bsdus shing sbrel ba /
translated: The mere collection of those is like a thread spun by the moisture of the seed of contaminated karma and the water of craving.

original: mdung khyim ltar phan tshun rkyen du gyur pas g-yo ba med par 'byung zhes pa ni ji srid gnas ma gyur gyi bar du rgyun nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mdung khyim ltar phan tshun rkyen du gyur pas g-yo ba med par 'byung zhes pa ni ji srid gnas ma gyur gyi bar du rgyun nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: Like a stack of spears, they arise without movement, mutually conditioned, until the transformation of the basis, without interruption of the continuum.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon 'chad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon 'chad de /
translated: The benefits of such realization are explained by ‚Äúthe bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva‚Äù and so on.

original: snang ba med par rab tu rtogs pa ni bzod pa dang 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i snang bas med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med par rab tu rtogs pa ni bzod pa dang 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i snang bas med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the absence of appearances is the realization of the absence of the appearances of subject and object in the states of acceptance and the highest worldly realization.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi spyod yul rab tu 'byed pa ni sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin mthar thug pas sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur bar snang ba 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi spyod yul rab tu 'byed pa ni sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin mthar thug pas sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur bar snang ba 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: The discernment of the domain of the nature of illusion is the appearance of the consecration by the Buddhas through the perfection of the wisdom and concentration that realizes the illusory nature.

original: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas //üîΩji ltar rtag dang chad pa yi //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas // ji ltar rtag dang chad pa yi //
translated: Then, the Bhagavat, etc.

original: lta ba rab tu 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba rab tu 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: How does one not fall into the views of eternalism and nihilism?

original: zhes pa'am / gnyis kyi mtha' brjod ji lta bur //
analyzed: zhes pa'am / gnyis kyi mtha' brjod ji lta bur //
translated: Or, how does one avoid the extremes of duality?

original: zhes dris pa'i lan tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gsungs te /
translated: The answer is given in another way:

original: khyod kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mtha' gnyis spang ba'i dbu ma'i don to //
analyzed: khyod kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mtha' gnyis spang ba'i dbu ma'i don to //
translated: Your Buddha-vehicle is the meaning of the middle way, which is the nature of the Buddha, the abandonment of the two extremes.

original: de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi sems nyid rig pa tsam la mtha' gnyis su brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi sems nyid rig pa tsam la mtha' gnyis su brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The mere awareness of the mind itself, which has such a nature, does not have the meaning of the two extremes that are imputed.

original: gang dag lus la sogs par snang ba'i sems kun gzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi shes pa ni mtha' gnyis la sbyod  ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag lus la sogs par snang ba'i sems kun gzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi shes pa ni mtha' gnyis la sbyod  ces bya'o //
translated: Those who do not understand the mind that appears as the body, etc. to be the nature of the foundation consciousness are said to ‚Äúpractice the two extremes.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs par rab tu 'byed ba med pa ni sgro 'dogs kyi lta ba ngan pa'i yul rigs pa dam pa'i don med cing mi dmigs so zhes rtogs pa'i shes rab med pas snang tshod tsam du yang med do zhes skur pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par rab tu 'byed ba med pa ni sgro 'dogs kyi lta ba ngan pa'i yul rigs pa dam pa'i don med cing mi dmigs so zhes rtogs pa'i shes rab med pas snang tshod tsam du yang med do zhes skur pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The absence of the discrimination of non-apprehension is the object of the bad views of reification. It is the absence of the object of the highest reasoning, and it is not apprehended. Since there is no wisdom that understands ‚Äúthere is no object of apprehension,‚Äù it is the extreme of deprecation, which is the mere appearance of non-existence.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa ni chos kyi bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa ni chos kyi bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Reification of the characteristic of non-existence is the reification of the self of phenomena.

original: med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa ni gang zag gi bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa ni gang zag gi bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Reification of the view of non-existence is the reification of the self of persons.

original: med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa ni @129b 'dus byas kyi chos su sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa ni @129b 'dus byas kyi chos su sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Reification of the cause of non-existence is the reification of compounded phenomena.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that the former is a superimposition on the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: sgyu ma lta bur zhes pa ni don de ltar yin zhes pa ste //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur zhes pa ni don de ltar yin zhes pa ste //
translated: The phrase like an illusion means that the meaning is like that.

original: sgro 'dogs kyi blo'i rnam par ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyi blo'i rnam par ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the form of the superimposing cognition.

original: dran pa ni sngar mthong ba dran pas da ltar yang mthong bar 'dod pa yid kyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni sngar mthong ba dran pas da ltar yang mthong bar 'dod pa yid kyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: Memory is the engagement of the mind that desires to see now by remembering what was seen before.

original: med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni 'dus ma byas su sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni 'dus ma byas su sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Superimposing a nonexistent entity is superimposing an unconditioned [entity].

original: kun tu brtags pa ni rnga mo'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pas de rnams dper byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni rnga mo'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pas de rnams dper byed pa'o //
translated: Imagined [entities] are like the horn of a rabbit, etc., and those are used as examples.

original: rnga mo'i rva la sogs par snang ba ni blo'i ngo bor yod pas med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnga mo'i rva la sogs par snang ba ni blo'i ngo bor yod pas med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'o //
translated: The appearance as the horn of a rabbit, etc., exists as the essence of cognition, so it is free from the extreme of nonexistence.

original: yang na med pa'i mtshan mar bzung ba de ni bden pas med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na med pa'i mtshan mar bzung ba de ni bden pas med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or, the apprehension of the sign of nonexistence is free from the extreme of nonexistence because it is true.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas mtha' gnyis su lta ba dang bral zhing bdag med pa rtogs pa la sogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas mtha' gnyis su lta ba dang bral zhing bdag med pa rtogs pa la sogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
translated: The line Moreover, Mahamati... and so forth teaches the benefits of being free from the views of the two extremes and realizing selflessness and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi gzhan dbang sgyu ma lta bu la rnam par gnas nas /üîΩrnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa sna tshogs su snang ba ltar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi gzhan dbang sgyu ma lta bu la rnam par gnas nas / rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa sna tshogs su snang ba ltar /
translated: The meaning of the line abiding in the dependent nature and so forth is that, abiding in the dependent nature of mere awareness, which is like an illusion,üîΩone displays various forms, like a wish-fulfilling jewel, in accordance with the various imagined appearances.

original: sna tshogs kyi gzugs su ston cing yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur rtogs pa med par sems can rnams kyi dgos 'dod sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi gzugs su ston cing yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur rtogs pa med par sems can rnams kyi dgos 'dod sgrub pa'o //
translated: Without conceptualization, one fulfills the needs and desires of sentient beings.

original: thams cad dang zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par bstan pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad dang zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par bstan pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: The line all of them refers to all the phenomena taught to be like illusions and so on.

original: skye ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni smon lam la sogs pa'i dbang gis skye gnas gang du skyes pa de dag dang / 'gro ba'i gnas kyi bye brag la sogs pa de dag du dkon mchog gsum gyi legs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni smon lam la sogs pa'i dbang gis skye gnas gang du skyes pa de dag dang / 'gro ba'i gnas kyi bye brag la sogs pa de dag du dkon mchog gsum gyi legs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbirth‚Äù and so forth is that in whatever birth-state one is born by the power of aspiration and so forth, and in whatever specific realm of beings, one praises the excellence of the Three Jewels.

original: de'i tshe tshogs su gyur pa'i sku //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshogs su gyur pa'i sku //
translated: The body that is the assembly at that time

original: gzas shing byed pa kun spangs pa //üîΩzhes pa'i don ni dam par phung po lnga 'dus pa 'am /üîΩrdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku /üîΩ'di dang 'di ltar bya'o zhes rnam par rtog pa sngon du btong nas /
analyzed: gzas shing byed pa kun spangs pa // zhes pa'i don ni dam par phung po lnga 'dus pa 'am / rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku / 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o zhes rnam par rtog pa sngon du btong nas /
translated: is free from all grasping and action.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that the body that is the assembly of the five aggregates or the nature of the assembly of subtle particles is free from the prior conceptualization, ‚ÄúI will do this and that,‚Äù and the action of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis su rnam par lta ba bkag nas /üîΩci slad ji ltar stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis su rnam par lta ba bkag nas / ci slad ji ltar stong pa nyid //
translated: Having thus refuted the two extremes,üîΩthe question is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it emptiness?‚Äù

original: ces pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs dang rang bzhin gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs dang rang bzhin gsungs pa ni /
translated: and so forth. The reply is the enumeration of emptiness and its nature:

original: de nas yang bcom @130a * //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom @130a * //
translated: Then again, the bhagavƒÅn

original: ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas so //üîΩde'i don yang stong pa nyid dang mi skye ba la zhes pa la sogs pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' dang bral ba zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas so // de'i don yang stong pa nyid dang mi skye ba la zhes pa la sogs pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' dang bral ba zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.üîΩThe emptiness of non-production, etc. is the union of the two, free from the extremes of existence and non-existence, the nature of illusion.

original: de yang gang dang gang gis stong pa dgag bya'i rang bzhin ni kun du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang dang gang gis stong pa dgag bya'i rang bzhin ni kun du brtags pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the object of refutation, which is empty of this and that, is the imagined.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la /
translated: In the illusion-like dependent,

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos don dam par kun brtags pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos don dam par kun brtags pas stong pa'o //
translated: the imagined ultimate, the properties of existence and non-existence, etc. are empty.

original: de la med pa'i mthar 'dzin pa gang dag de 'dra ba'i kun brtags pa la mngon par zhen pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i dngos por smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la med pa'i mthar 'dzin pa gang dag de 'dra ba'i kun brtags pa la mngon par zhen pas stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i dngos por smra ba ste /
translated: Those who grasp the extreme of non-existence are proponents of entities such as emptiness, who are attached to such an imagined.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos stong pa'i bdag rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos stong pa'i bdag rtag pa'am /
translated: They are proponents of a permanent self empty of the entities of subject and object,

original: rig pa skad cig ma'i dngos po la sogs pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa skad cig ma'i dngos po la sogs pa smra ba'o //
translated: or of momentary awareness, etc.

original: dngos po med pa dang rang bzhin med pa zhes pa yang dngos po nyid khas blangs nas dngos po'i phyi'i phyogs gzhan gyis stong bas te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang rang bzhin med pa zhes pa yang dngos po nyid khas blangs nas dngos po'i phyi'i phyogs gzhan gyis stong bas te /
translated: Also, nonthing and essenceless are posited by accepting things and then saying that they are empty of some other thing that is different from them.

original: nyi tshe ba'i stong pa'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i stong pa'o //
translated: Also, non-entity and essenceless are limited emptinesses, because they are emptinesses of one aspect of an entity that is accepted as existent, namely, emptiness of an external aspect of an entity.

original: rnam pa gcig du na 'di rnams kyi don ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig du na 'di rnams kyi don ni /
translated: In one way, the meaning of these terms is as follows:

original: stong ba dang mod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa la snang ba la med pa'i rang bzhin bden pa'i don nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong ba dang mod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa la snang ba la med pa'i rang bzhin bden pa'i don nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of non-existence appears to the conceptual thought that conceives of the signs of emptiness, non-emptiness, and so forth, and it is a superimposition of the nature of non-existence as truly existent.

original: de bzhin du dngos po yod par kun brtags pa yang stong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po yod par kun brtags pa yang stong zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the imputation of the existence of an entity is called emptiness.üîΩMoreover, the meaning of these terms is as follows:

original: gzhan yang 'di rnams kyi don ni byis pa'i skye bo kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di rnams kyi don ni byis pa'i skye bo kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: The nature of the imputational is conceived by all foolish beings to be truly existent,

original: de'i gnyen por stong pa la sogs pa'i dngos por smra ba yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por stong pa la sogs pa'i dngos por smra ba yin zhes pa ste /
translated: and the nature of emptiness and so forth is taught as an antidote to that.

original: don dam pa'i dngos pos stong pa sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos por de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos pos stong pa sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos por de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs zhes pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata taught that the ultimate nature is empty of entities and is an entity that is like an illusion.

original: 'dus pa phan tshun ltos pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: 'dus pa phan tshun ltos pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'am /
translated: Because they are mutually dependent aggregates and because there is no difference in their classification.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa 'dus pa ni 'dus pa can rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par las logs shig na med na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa 'dus pa ni 'dus pa can rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par las logs shig na med na /
translated: The aggregates of name and form, etc., or the aggregates of subtle atoms, etc., do not exist apart from the difference in the classification of the aggregates.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par rnams kyang cha shas su phye ba na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par rnams kyang cha shas su phye ba na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And the difference in the classification of the aggregates does not exist when they are divided into parts.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhig pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhig pa na //
translated: Form is destroyed by the destruction of atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni yod ma yin //üîΩzhes pa'am / skad cig gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod ma yin // zhes pa'am / skad cig gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Atoms do not have parts.üîΩOr,

original: 'jig rten skad cig la mi gnas //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩphan tshun ltos pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par te /
analyzed: 'jig rten skad cig la mi gnas // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // phan tshun ltos pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par te /
translated: The world does not endure for a moment, because it has the nature of three moments.

original: dgag pa'i tshul rgyas par bstan @130b zin to //
analyzed: dgag pa'i tshul rgyas par bstan @130b zin to //
translated: The extensive teaching on the mode of negation has already been explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas bar phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyud 'ga' zhig ni bdag yin pa dang / 'ga' zhig ni de la ltos pa'i pha rol gzhan nyid ces pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gnas pa med ces pa'o /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas bar phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyud 'ga' zhig ni bdag yin pa dang / 'ga' zhig ni de la ltos pa'i pha rol gzhan nyid ces pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gnas pa med ces pa'o /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic does not endure.

original: de la 'dir gtan tshigs 'og ma ni snga ma'i khyab pa sgrub pa'i yan yag  du sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: de la 'dir gtan tshigs 'og ma ni snga ma'i khyab pa sgrub pa'i yan yag  du sbyar ba 'am /
translated: Here, the latter reason is applied as a premise establishing the pervasion of the former.

original: rang rgyud pa nyid yin pa la yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rang rgyud pa nyid yin pa la yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in its being an autonomous reason.

original: rang dang rang bzhin gyi dngos po skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po med ces pa dang / rang bzhin gyis skye ba med ces pa ste /
analyzed: rang dang rang bzhin gyi dngos po skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po med ces pa dang / rang bzhin gyis skye ba med ces pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Because there is no arising of a thing that is itself and its intrinsic reality‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause there is no intrinsically real thing‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause there is no intrinsically real arising.‚Äù

original: de la rang bzhin smos pa ni dngos po'am skye ba'i khyad par gzhan bkag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin smos pa ni dngos po'am skye ba'i khyad par gzhan bkag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the mention of ‚Äúintrinsic reality‚Äù does not refute other features of things or arising.

original: rang rang gi rang bzhin bden pa'i dngos por yod pa'am skye ba'i ngo bor grub pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi rang bzhin bden pa'i dngos por yod pa'am skye ba'i ngo bor grub pa bkag pa'o //
translated: It refutes the establishment of things or arising as having a nature that is their own true reality.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rang dang rang zhes bzlog pa'i sgra'i sbyor bas dngos po skye ba'i khyad par du ma mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rang dang rang zhes bzlog pa'i sgra'i sbyor bas dngos po skye ba'i khyad par du ma mtshon pa ste /
translated: In one sense, the words ‚Äúitself‚Äù and ‚Äúitself‚Äù are used in the reverse order to indicate the many special features of the arising of things.

original: de rnams thams cad med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad med ces pa'o //
translated: All of them are nonexistent.

original: 'dir khyab pa'i don ni de 'dra ba'i skye ba bkag pa na ma skyes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni shin tu yang mi 'thad pas thams cad dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyab pa'i don ni de 'dra ba'i skye ba bkag pa na ma skyes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni shin tu yang mi 'thad pas thams cad dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of pervasion is that when such arising is refuted, it is utterly untenable that there is an essence of nonarising. Therefore, everything is empty of an essence of things.

original: srid pa'i stong pa nyid ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang gang zag gi bdag dang bdag gi bas stong ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i stong pa nyid ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang gang zag gi bdag dang bdag gi bas stong ba ste /
translated: The emptiness of existence is the illusionlike dependent nature, which is empty of the self of persons and the self of phenomena.

original: sgyu ma tsam du srid pas srid pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma tsam du srid pas srid pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since there is existence that is merely an illusion, it is called the emptiness of existence.

original: de la rgyu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is the foundation consciousness.

original: rigs pa ni bya ba byed pa dang ltos pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni bya ba byed pa dang ltos pa ste /
translated: The reasoning is the performance of functions and dependence.

original: ji ltar me dang shing gi tshogs pa ni du bskyed pa'i bya ba byed par rigs kyi gzhan du ma yin zhes pa dang / du ba yang me dang shing gi tshogs pa la ltos par rigs kyi gzhan du ma yin zhes dngos po'i rang bzhin de ltar gnas pas 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig nyid skye bar 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar me dang shing gi tshogs pa ni du bskyed pa'i bya ba byed par rigs kyi gzhan du ma yin zhes pa dang / du ba yang me dang shing gi tshogs pa la ltos par rigs kyi gzhan du ma yin zhes dngos po'i rang bzhin de ltar gnas pas 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig nyid skye bar 'thad pa'o //
translated: Just as it is reasonable that the collection of fire and wood performs the action of producing smoke, not anything else, and that smoke is dependent on the collection of fire and wood, not anything else, so it is reasonable that something arises from something else, since the nature of things abides in that way.

original: byed pa dang las ni sems pa'i las dang / lus dag gi las so //
analyzed: byed pa dang las ni sems pa'i las dang / lus dag gi las so //
translated: Action and agent are the mental action and the action of the body.

original: 'byor pa ni de rnams tshigs shing 'phrod pa 'du ba las kun rdzob tsam du skye bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni de rnams tshigs shing 'phrod pa 'du ba las kun rdzob tsam du skye bar snang ba'o //
translated: The combination of those is the coming together of the conditions, from which arising appears as mere convention.

original: gang du rgyu dang ldan pa'o zhes gzhung 'don par byed pa'i skabs su ni rgyu dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gang du rgyu dang ldan pa'o zhes gzhung 'don par byed pa'i skabs su ni rgyu dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: In the context of reciting the text as ‚Äúwhere there is a connection with a cause,‚Äù it is a connection with a cause.

original: tshig gi don rtogs par sla'o //üîΩphung po rnams la zhes pa ni sngar gyi zag pa bcas pa'i phung po la /
analyzed: tshig gi don rtogs par sla'o // phung po rnams la zhes pa ni sngar gyi zag pa bcas pa'i phung po la /
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mi srid ces pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mi srid ces pa ste /
translated: With regard to the aggregates, it is impossible to attain nirvana in the previously mentioned contaminated aggregates.

original: snga na med pa'i khyad par @131a * //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i khyad par @131a * //
translated: The special feature not found in other treatises is theüîΩtaste.üîΩHere, the teaching of the identity of cyclic existence and nirvana isüîΩmade in terms of the nirvana that is the natural state of affairs, so there is

original: ro ; 'dir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gcig pa nyid du bstan pa ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas pas skyon med do //
analyzed: ro ; 'dir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gcig pa nyid du bstan pa ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas pas skyon med do //
translated: no error.üîΩThe statement that all phenomena are inexpressible is made in responseüîΩto the assertion that all of these are mere names, and in response to theüîΩattachment to the things that are expressed, such as the one hundred and

original: chos thams cad brjod du med ces pa ni 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste zhes pa dang tshig brgya rtsa brgyad la sogs pa gsungs pas thams cad brjod pa'i dngos por zhen pa'am gzhan yang brjod pa nyid brjod bya'i rang bzhin du zhen pa na /
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med ces pa ni 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste zhes pa dang tshig brgya rtsa brgyad la sogs pa gsungs pas thams cad brjod pa'i dngos por zhen pa'am gzhan yang brjod pa nyid brjod bya'i rang bzhin du zhen pa na /
translated: eight expressions, and so forth. Moreover, when there is attachment toüîΩexpression itself as the nature of the object expressed,

original: de ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: that is the imagined nature, and it is empty of such a nature.üîΩThe emptiness of all the habitual tendencies of views and faults is theüîΩemptiness of such things as the view of the transitory aggregates, and the

original: lta ba dang nyes pa'i bag chags thams cad kyis stong ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang // de las gzhan sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag chags glo bur gyi dri mas kun rdzob tsam du yang stong pa 'am /
analyzed: lta ba dang nyes pa'i bag chags thams cad kyis stong ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang // de las gzhan sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag chags glo bur gyi dri mas kun rdzob tsam du yang stong pa 'am /
translated: other obscurations, which are adventitious stains. They are empty evenüîΩconventionally.

original: gcig gis gcig stong pa ni phan tshun bdag nyid dam rten du gyur pa'i tshul gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig stong pa ni phan tshun bdag nyid dam rten du gyur pa'i tshul gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of one in the other is the emptiness of mutual nature or mutual support.

original: shes par sla'o //
analyzed: shes par sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: stong pa nyid 'di ni kun gyi tha shal te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di ni kun gyi tha shal te /
translated: This emptiness is the worst of all.üîΩYou should completely abandon it.

original: de ni khyod kyis yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o zhes pa'i don ni de 'dra ba'i stong pa nyid ni byis pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis rtogs shing goms kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spong zhing /
analyzed: de ni khyod kyis yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o zhes pa'i don ni de 'dra ba'i stong pa nyid ni byis pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis rtogs shing goms kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spong zhing /
translated: The meaning of this is that such an emptiness is realized and cultivated by all childish beings, but it does not help to abandon the side of affliction

original: skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba'i don thob pa la mi phan bas de 'dra ba gtan la phab pa ni dgos pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba'i don thob pa la mi phan bas de 'dra ba gtan la phab pa ni dgos pa med ces pa'o //
translated: and to obtain the purpose that is necessary for a human being. Therefore, establishing such an emptiness is pointless.

original: gal te de ltar na mi srid pa'i stong ba nyid kyang phyi rol pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i stong pa nyid bzhi ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mi srid pa'i stong ba nyid kyang phyi rol pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i stong pa nyid bzhi ste /
translated: If that is so, then the emptiness of the impossible is also the emptiness of the four kinds of emptiness asserted by non-Buddhists,

original: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa dang gtan nas med pa bshad pa las /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa dang gtan nas med pa bshad pa las /
translated: which are explained as nonexistence before, nonexistence after, nonexistence in one another, and complete nonexistence.

original: snga na med pa'i khyad par nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid yin te de 'dre ba gtan la phab pa la yang dgos pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i khyad par nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid yin te de 'dre ba gtan la phab pa la yang dgos pa med do zhe na /
translated: There is no need to establish the mixing of the limited emptiness with the ultimate.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: de 'dra ba nyi tshe ba'i stong ba'i khyad par bstan pas byis pa'i skye bo rnams zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyi tshe ba'i stong ba'i khyad par bstan pas byis pa'i skye bo rnams zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po la /
translated: By teaching the limited emptiness, the special kind of emptiness, childish beings become disenchanted and disgusted with the contaminated aggregates,üîΩthinking, ‚ÄúThere is no peace, no happiness of abiding in nirvana.‚ÄùüîΩThey enter the path to nirvana, which abandons those aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang bsal bar gnas pa'i bde ba med do zhes skyo zhing yid byung bas de spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang gzhan yang mya ngan las 'das pa sngar nas yod pa'iüîΩrtag pa theg zug pa'i dngos por phyin ci log spong ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang bsal bar gnas pa'i bde ba med do zhes skyo zhing yid byung bas de spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang gzhan yang mya ngan las 'das pa sngar nas yod pa'i rtag pa theg zug pa'i dngos por phyin ci log spong ba'o //
translated: They also abandon the misconception that nirvana is a permanent, static thing that existed before.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yang grub mtha' phyin ci log gis bslang pa kha cig @131b gtso bo'i rang bzhin du gcig pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yang grub mtha' phyin ci log gis bslang pa kha cig @131b gtso bo'i rang bzhin du gcig pa'am /
translated: Some, due to their distorted philosophical tenets, think that things such as form are one with the nature of prakriti.

original: spyi'i sgo nas gcig pa nyid du phyin ci log pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi'i sgo nas gcig pa nyid du phyin ci log pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not a mistake to generalize and say that they are the same?

original: des na de dag phan tshun stong par bstan pas de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log bsal ba'i dgos pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des na de dag phan tshun stong par bstan pas de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log bsal ba'i dgos pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is shown that they are mutually empty, the purpose is to dispel such a mistake.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de dag gis kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / bsal ba'i bye brag phan tshun gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / bsal ba'i bye brag phan tshun gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: For, they merely realize that the state of form and so on and the distinctions of the individual are empty of each other.

original: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i stong par rtogs pa dang / de ltar ma rtogs shing gcig tu 'dzin pa ni 'ching ba'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs pas gcig tu 'dzin pa bkag nas tha dad pa'i dngos por bstan pa la dgongs pa cung zad kyang med ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i stong par rtogs pa dang / de ltar ma rtogs shing gcig tu 'dzin pa ni 'ching ba'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs pas gcig tu 'dzin pa bkag nas tha dad pa'i dngos por bstan pa la dgongs pa cung zad kyang med ces pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the realization of such an emptiness and the nonrealization and apprehension of oneness are the same in being the cause of bondage, it is said that there is not the slightest intention to refute the apprehension of oneness and teach the existence of difference.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid kyi rnam grangs mi ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid kyi rnam grangs mi ston te /
translated: Moreover, the phrase ‚ÄúFurthermore, Mahamati‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on does not teach a different category.

original: de'i don yang ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kun rdzob tu yang mi skye la /
analyzed: de'i don yang ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kun rdzob tu yang mi skye la /
translated: The meaning of that is that at the time of the meditative absorptions of cessation, etc., the bases of samadhi, the consciousnesses that engage them do not arise even conventionally.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par shes pa dang ye shes rnams don dam par rgyu med par rang 'byung ba'i tshul du yang mi skye la /üîΩyang zhes pas bsdus pa bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka las kyang mi skye zhing /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par shes pa dang ye shes rnams don dam par rgyu med par rang 'byung ba'i tshul du yang mi skye la / yang zhes pas bsdus pa bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka las kyang mi skye zhing /
translated: And in other situations, consciousnesses and pristine wisdoms do not arise in the manner of self-arising without cause ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bur rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skye bas mi skye ba yang ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bur rgyu rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skye bas mi skye ba yang ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: The ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚Äúnot from self, not from other, not from both‚Äù includes the arising of consciousnesses and pristine wisdoms from both self and other.üîΩAnd the ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚Äúnot from no cause‚Äù includes the arising of consciousnesses and pristine wisdoms from no cause.

original: de'i phyir mi skye ba'i don yang zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi skye ba'i don yang zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of non-arising is also only the illusion-like state of primordial unity.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i don de ltar yin bas don dam par ma skyes pa la sogs pa la dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i don de ltar yin bas don dam par ma skyes pa la sogs pa la dgongs te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútherefore‚Äù means that because the meaning of primordial unity is like that, the meaning of non-arising, etc., is intended to be ultimate non-arising, etc.

original: dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par bstan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par bstan zhes pa'o //
translated: All things are shown to be essenceless.

original: don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu mtshan yang gzhan dbang skad cig ma'i rgyun rgyud ni skad cig ma'i bkod pa yin pas bkod pa tsam gyi skad cig las logs na med la /
analyzed: don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu mtshan yang gzhan dbang skad cig ma'i rgyun rgyud ni skad cig ma'i bkod pa yin pas bkod pa tsam gyi skad cig las logs na med la /
translated: The reason that the ultimate is essenceless is that the continuum of the momentary dependent nature is an arrangement of moments, and so it does not exist apart from the mere arrangement of moments.üîΩAnd as was previously explained, even the single moment does not exist.

original: skad cig gcig pa nyid kyang sngar bstan pa ltar med pa dang / yang gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos por ni gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin med zhes pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig gcig pa nyid kyang sngar bstan pa ltar med pa dang / yang gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos por ni gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin med zhes pa ste /
translated: And since the dependent thing appears to change, all phenomena are said to be essenceless.

original: 'dir khyab pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba ni de las gzhan rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa'i dngos por mi 'thad la /üîΩgzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos por @132a * //
analyzed: 'dir khyab pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba ni de las gzhan rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa'i dngos por mi 'thad la / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos por @132a * //
translated: The pervasion here is as follows: As was previously explained, since it appears to change, it is not tenable that it is something else, a permanent, unchanging thing.üîΩAnd it is contradictory for a thing that changes

original: bden pa yang 'gal te /
analyzed: bden pa yang 'gal te /
translated: to be truly existent.
