original: sngar gyi bdag nyid de nyid ma spangs par gzhan du 'gyur na ni dus gcig tu dngos po gcig nyid ldog par gzhan la mtshos par de nyid dang gzhan yin pa mi 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi bdag nyid de nyid ma spangs par gzhan du 'gyur na ni dus gcig tu dngos po gcig nyid ldog par gzhan la mtshos par de nyid dang gzhan yin pa mi 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it transforms into another without abandoning its previous nature, then it would not be contradictory for one thing to be both itself and another at the same time.

original: gal te sngar gyi rang bzhin de nyid spangs nas gzhan du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te sngar gyi rang bzhin de nyid spangs nas gzhan du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it transforms into another by abandoning its previous nature,

original: snga ma bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gags la /
analyzed: snga ma bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gags la /
translated: then the previous nature would have ceased in all ways.

original: phyi ma la glo bur ba gzhan skyes pas snga ma de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma la glo bur ba gzhan skyes pas snga ma de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Since the later one arises anew, the previous one does not transform into the later one.

original: ji ltar lha sbyin shi nas mchod sbyin skyes pas ni lha sbyin du gyur pa ma yin ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lha sbyin shi nas mchod sbyin skyes pas ni lha sbyin du gyur pa ma yin ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as when Devadatta dies and Yajnadatta is born, Devadatta does not become Yajnadatta.

original: skabs kyi don 'di yang sngar yod med skye 'gag gi skabs su yod pa dang med pa ni gcig la rim gyis kyang 'gal lo zhes bstan pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di yang sngar yod med skye 'gag gi skabs su yod pa dang med pa ni gcig la rim gyis kyang 'gal lo zhes bstan pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: This topic is similar to the earlier explanation that existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive in a single thing.

original: bsams pas go bar zad do //
analyzed: bsams pas go bar zad do //
translated: This can be understood through reflection.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang //
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna also says:

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Transformation of intrinsic nature

original: nam yang 'thad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad pa ma yin te //
translated: is never tenable.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gnyis su med pa'i don yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ltar /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ltar /
translated: The meaning of non-duality is like that of cyclic life and nirvana.

original: don dam par gnyis kyi dngos por ma grub la /
analyzed: don dam par gnyis kyi dngos por ma grub la /
translated: In the ultimate sense, they are not established as dual entities.

original: kun rdzob du gnyis su snang ba tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob du gnyis su snang ba tha dad pa ste /
translated: In the superficial sense, they are different in the appearance of duality.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i don 'ba' zhig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i don 'ba' zhig bstan pa'o //
translated: It is only the meaning of illusion that is taught.

original: grib ma dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i dpe gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: grib ma dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i dpe gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Other examples such as shadow and sunlight should be applied in the same way.

original: gal te 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa kun rdzob tu ji ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa kun rdzob tu ji ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: If cyclic life and nirvana are different in the superficial sense, how are they different?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúMahamati, cyclic life is like the appearance of the world in a mirror, a gem, or water, and nirvana is like the non-appearance of the world in a mirror, a gem, or water.‚Äù

original: don go bar zad do //
analyzed: don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is understood.

original: rtag tu stong pa nyid bshad kyang //
analyzed: rtag tu stong pa nyid bshad kyang //
translated: Although emptiness is always taught,

original: las ni rnam par mi 'jig go //
analyzed: las ni rnam par mi 'jig go //
translated: Karma is not destroyed.

original: zhes pa'i don ni don dam par stong nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par bstan kyang kun rdzog du zab pa dang bcas pa'i las dang / de'i 'bras bu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po 'khor ba'i rang bzhin yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni don dam par stong nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par bstan kyang kun rdzog du zab pa dang bcas pa'i las dang / de'i 'bras bu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po 'khor ba'i rang bzhin yod ces pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that although emptiness is taught to be naturally passed beyond sorrow in the ultimate, in the relative, there is the nature of samsara, with its profound karma and its results, the defiled aggregates.

original: de lta na yang byis pa'i skye bo 'ga' zhig de dag stong par bstan pa la brten nas med pa'i mthar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang byis pa'i skye bo 'ga' zhig de dag stong par bstan pa la brten nas med pa'i mthar rtog pa'o //
translated: In that case, some childish beings, based on the teaching of their emptiness, imagine an extreme of nonexistence.

original: yang la la dag rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang so sor brtags par 'gog pa ste gnyen po'i stobs kyis spang bya spangs pa dang / brtags min gyi 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: yang la la dag rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang so sor brtags par 'gog pa ste gnyen po'i stobs kyis spang bya spangs pa dang / brtags min gyi 'gog pa ste /
translated: Moreover, some imagine that natural nirvana, space, and analytical cessation‚Äîthe abandonment of the object of abandonment by the power of the antidote‚Äîand nonanalytical cessation‚Äî

original: skye bar 'gyur rgyu'i chos ma skyed pa rnams 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzas dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du rtog la /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur rgyu'i chos ma skyed pa rnams 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzas dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du rtog la /
translated: the nonarising of phenomena that would arise‚Äîare substantial unconditioned things, the nature of entities.

original: 'phags pa de @132b de dag gis mthar rtog pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa de @132b de dag gis mthar rtog pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The noble ones abandon the conception of extremes.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas skabs kyi don de nyid gsung rab dag las stong pa nyid la sogs pa don dam pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas skabs kyi don de nyid gsung rab dag las stong pa nyid la sogs pa don dam pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, and so on and so forth means that one should apply this very topic to all the teachings of the scriptures such as emptiness and so on, which are synonyms of the ultimate.

original: de ltar bden pa gnyis su rnam par phye ba las /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa gnyis su rnam par phye ba las /
translated: Thus, from the division into two truths,

original: don dam ba'i dbang du byas te /üîΩsteng pa nyid la sogs par bstan pa ma yin pa spyir stong pa nyid la sogs par bstan pa dang / theg pa chung du'i gsung rab dag las kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: don dam ba'i dbang du byas te / steng pa nyid la sogs par bstan pa ma yin pa spyir stong pa nyid la sogs par bstan pa dang / theg pa chung du'i gsung rab dag las kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: from the perspective of the ultimate,üîΩin general, the teachings of emptiness and so on, which are not taught in the scriptures of emptiness and so on,

original: yod pa dang skye ba la sogs par bstan ba ma yin pa spyir phung po la sogs pa yod pa dang skye ba la sogs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa dang skye ba la sogs par bstan ba ma yin pa spyir phung po la sogs pa yod pa dang skye ba la sogs par bstan pa ni /
translated: and in general, the teachings of the existence and arising of the aggregates and so on, which are not taught in the scriptures of the Hƒ´nayƒÅna from the perspective of the conventional,

original: sems can gyi bsam pa la ltos nas bstan pa don 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa la ltos nas bstan pa don 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: are teachings that are mistaken with respect to their meaning in dependence on the thoughts of sentient beings,

original: kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bor grub pa dang / don dam par grub pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bor grub pa dang / don dam par grub pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are established as the nature of the dependent in the conventional and are not established in the ultimate.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba lam ltos par yod pa dang med pa 'ba' zhig gi mthar rtog pa ni mi bden zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba lam ltos par yod pa dang med pa 'ba' zhig gi mthar rtog pa ni mi bden zhes pa'o //
translated: The path of the two truths is the analysis of existence and nonexistence in dependence. To conceive of it as only the extreme of existence or nonexistence is not true.

original: gzhan yang phung po la sogs pa kun rdzob pa'i dngos por yang stong zhes pa dang / yang don dam pa'i dngos por yang yod do zhes pa la sogs par bstan pa ni shin du yang drang ba'i don 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po la sogs pa kun rdzob pa'i dngos por yang stong zhes pa dang / yang don dam pa'i dngos por yang yod do zhes pa la sogs par bstan pa ni shin du yang drang ba'i don 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the teaching that things such as the aggregates are empty of superficial reality and also exist in ultimate reality and so on is also a mistaken interpretation of the interpretable meaning.

original: de ltar na nges pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar zung du 'jug pa'i dbu ma gzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa'i chos rnams //
analyzed: de ltar na nges pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar zung du 'jug pa'i dbu ma gzhan gyi dbang gis bsdus pa'i chos rnams //
translated: Thus, the definitive meaning is the union of the two truths, as previously explained, and the dependent reality, which is the subject matter of the scriptures of the Great Vehicle.

original: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
translated: All things exist superficially,

original: dam pa'i don du yod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du yod ma yin //
translated: but do not exist ultimately.

original: zhes bstan pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: This is the only teaching.

original: snga ma ltar bstan pa rnams ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi yul don dam pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par dgongs pa'i gtam ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ltar bstan pa rnams ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi yul don dam pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par dgongs pa'i gtam ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The former teachings are not the discourse of the intention of the ultimate reality, the object of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa-sutra,

original: rton pa rnam pa bzhi gsungs te /üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: rton pa rnam pa bzhi gsungs te / ji skad du /
translated: four reliances are taught:

original: nges pa'i don la rton gyi drang ba'i don la mi rton ces pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang chos la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton ba dang / don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don la rton gyi drang ba'i don la mi rton ces pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang chos la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton ba dang / don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: One should rely on the ultimate meaning and not on the interpretable meaning, on exalted wisdom and not on consciousness, on the Dharma and not on persons, and on the meaning and not on the letter.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa ltar shes bya thams cad sems su 'dus shing /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bstan pa ltar shes bya thams cad sems su 'dus shing /
translated: Then, in the passage beginning The bodhisattva, it is shown that all objects of knowledge are included in mind,

original: sems kyi chos nyid kyang stong @133a * //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid kyang stong @133a * //
translated: and that the reality of mind is emptiness,

original: pa nyid kyi rnam grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pas gzhan dag gi log par rtog pa sel bar mdzad de /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi rnam grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pas gzhan dag gi log par rtog pa sel bar mdzad de /
translated: which is taught as the tathiigatagarbha, thus dispelling the misconceptions of others.

original: de'i don ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo la sogs pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po spros ba dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba blo bur gyi dri ma rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: de'i don ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo la sogs pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po spros ba dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba blo bur gyi dri ma rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The Bhagavat taught the Tathiigatagarbha in the Tathiigatagarbha Sutra, the Mahaparinirvii1)a Sutra, and so on, as being free from all conceptual elaborations, naturally radiant, and pure of adventitious contaminants.

original: thog ma nas rnam par dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis kyang dag pa gdul bya la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs par ston par nus pa /
analyzed: thog ma nas rnam par dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis kyang dag pa gdul bya la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs par ston par nus pa /
translated: It is primordially pure, and is pure by nature, and is able to manifest to disciples in the form of the thirty-two marks of a superman and so on.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi nang na mchis par brjod de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi nang na mchis par brjod de /
translated: It is said to exist within the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: phung po la sogs pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The aggregates and so on are the result, subsumed within the truth of suffering.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni kun 'byung ba las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni kun 'byung ba las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are the origins, karma and afflictions.

original: yongs su rtog pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Imagination is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i dngos por gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i dngos por gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be a permanent entity, a self, and so on.

original: ji skad du chu bo dga' skyed kyi drung du kun tu rgyu lnga brgya rjes su gzung ba'i don du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du chu bo dga' skyed kyi drung du kun tu rgyu lnga brgya rjes su gzung ba'i don du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as it was taught for the sake of guiding five hundred wandering mendicants in the presence of the river Nanda.

original: de lta na mu stegs byed rnams kyang lus can thams cad la thar pa 'am grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa bdag dam pa gnyis su med ba'i don yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na mu stegs byed rnams kyang lus can thams cad la thar pa 'am grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa bdag dam pa gnyis su med ba'i don yod par 'dod de /
translated: In that case, the tƒ´rthikas also assert that there is a supreme self that is the cause of liberation or freedom for all embodied beings, which is the meaning of nondual.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
translated: All beings have peace.

original: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid //
analyzed: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid //
translated: I am the one who is peace.

original: ces pa 'am /
analyzed: ces pa 'am /
translated: Or:üîΩüîΩ

original: lus can kun la bdag yod de //
analyzed: lus can kun la bdag yod de //
translated: All embodied beings have a self.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa smra ba dang / ci'i phyir mi mtshungs zhes pa'o //üîΩde la rtag pa byed pa yon tan med pa khyab pa mi 'jigs pa'o zhes pa ni bdag rtag pa shes pa rigs pa de nyid yul la longs spyod pa'i bya ba byed pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa smra ba dang / ci'i phyir mi mtshungs zhes pa'o // de la rtag pa byed pa yon tan med pa khyab pa mi 'jigs pa'o zhes pa ni bdag rtag pa shes pa rigs pa de nyid yul la longs spyod pa'i bya ba byed pa'am /
translated: Why is it not the same?

original: de la brten nas thar pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas thar pa thob pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the self is permanent, an agent, without qualities, pervasive, fearless, and so on. The self is the consciousness that is the principle of cognition. It is the one who performs the action of enjoying objects or who, in dependence on that, attains liberation.

original: yon rtan  med pa ni gzugs dang bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: yon rtan  med pa ni gzugs dang bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis stong pa'o //
translated: The absence of a substantial basis is the emptiness of such qualities as form and pleasure.

original: khyab pa ni lus can so so la bdag tha dad pa re gnas par 'dod pa dang / thams cad la thun mong ba'i bdag gcig tu gyur pa yod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni lus can so so la bdag tha dad pa re gnas par 'dod pa dang / thams cad la thun mong ba'i bdag gcig tu gyur pa yod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is the assertion that each embodied being has a separate self, and the assertion that there is a single self common to all.

original: lan gyi don ni nga yis bstan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mthar thug pa don dam par stong zhing kun rdzob tu myong ba tsam gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa rang @133b bzhin gyis rnam par dag
analyzed: lan gyi don ni nga yis bstan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mthar thug pa don dam par stong zhing kun rdzob tu myong ba tsam gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa rang @133b bzhin gyis rnam par dag
translated: The meaning of the reply is that the essence of the Tathagata, as I have taught it, is the ultimate reality of the foundation consciousness, which is empty of ultimate existence and is the identity of mere experience in the relative, and is included among the synonyms of the naturally pure essence,

original: pa ste / ther zug pa'i dngos po don dam pa nyid du khas mi len pas gzhan dang mi mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa ste / ther zug pa'i dngos po don dam pa nyid du khas mi len pas gzhan dang mi mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: which is not accepted as a permanent entity in the ultimate. Therefore, it is not the same as the others.

original: snying po zhes yod pa'i sgrar bstan pa ni byis pa rnams bdag med pas chad pa'i lta bas 'jigs pa rnams la bstan ba'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes yod pa'i sgrar bstan pa ni byis pa rnams bdag med pas chad pa'i lta bas 'jigs pa rnams la bstan ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúessence‚Äù is taught in order to show that the essence of the Tathagata is not nonexistent, and in order to show to the childish who are afraid of the view of annihilation due to selflessness.

original: gzhan yang gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la ni sngar bstan pa ltar bdag la sogs pa rang gi ming gis kyang bstan no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la ni sngar bstan pa ltar bdag la sogs pa rang gi ming gis kyang bstan no //
translated: Moreover, for some special disciples, the self and so on are taught by their own names, as was previously explained.üîΩMoreover, in the scriptures, the Buddha did not teach this to most ordinary beings because they would have conceived the self to be a real thing.

original: yang gsung rab dag las phal cher byis pa'i skye bo bdag rtogs par 'gyur bas de ltar ma gsungs te ji skad du //
analyzed: yang gsung rab dag las phal cher byis pa'i skye bo bdag rtogs par 'gyur bas de ltar ma gsungs te ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag tu rtogs par gyur na mi rung zhes /
analyzed: bdag tu rtogs par gyur na mi rung zhes /
translated: If they conceive the self, it is not suitable,

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan // zhes gsungs pa'am /
translated: so I do not teach this to the childish.üîΩOr,

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las /
translated: in the noble Lankavatara-sutra,

original: de 'dra ba bshad pa na sems can thams cad la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba bshad pa na sems can thams cad la /
translated: when this was taught, all sentient beings

original: bdag 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba cig yod do snyam ste log par mthong nas shes rab med pa rnams la rmi lam du rmis pa bzhin ston par byed de /
analyzed: bdag 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba cig yod do snyam ste log par mthong nas shes rab med pa rnams la rmi lam du rmis pa bzhin ston par byed de /
translated: saw it wrongly, thinking, ‚ÄúThis self is like this.‚Äù Those who lack wisdom are taught as if they were dreaming.

original: 'jig rten pa de dag gis kyang de skad du thos nas rang gi lus la bdag yod do snyam du rtog par byed la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa de dag gis kyang de skad du thos nas rang gi lus la bdag yod do snyam du rtog par byed la /
translated: Those worldly people, having heard this, think, ‚ÄúThe self exists in my body.‚Äù

original: de dag gis bdag de'i rang bzhin ni mi shes so //
analyzed: de dag gis bdag de'i rang bzhin ni mi shes so //
translated: They do not know the nature of that self.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshig thos nas log par bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i tshig thos nas log par bzung ste /
translated: Thus, having heard the words of the bodhisattvas, worldly people misunderstand.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams skyes bu mthe bong tsam zhes bya ba dang / ldum bu sha ma ka'i 'bras bu tsam dang / 'bras kyi 'bru tsam zhig snying la gnas te 'bar ro zhes log par rtog par byed do zhes pa la sogs par gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams skyes bu mthe bong tsam zhes bya ba dang / ldum bu sha ma ka'i 'bras bu tsam dang / 'bras kyi 'bru tsam zhig snying la gnas te 'bar ro zhes log par rtog par byed do zhes pa la sogs par gsungs pa dang /
translated: They imagine that a person the size of a thumb, or the size of a sesame seed, or the size of a grain of rice, abides in the heart and blazes.

original: yang la la dag bdag gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin 'ga' zhig snying gi phyogs na gnas shing 'ba' ro zhes log par rtog pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: yang la la dag bdag gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin 'ga' zhig snying gi phyogs na gnas shing 'ba' ro zhes log par rtog pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: And some imagine that a self, which is not material, but has the nature of consciousness alone, abides in the heart and blazes.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa las /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa las /
translated: In this regard, emptiness is taught in the Nirvana Sutra:

original: srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga la bden pa gcig tsam yang yod par ma mthong zhes pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga la bden pa gcig tsam yang yod par ma mthong zhes pa'o //
translated: I do not see even one truth in the twenty five existent things.

original: smon pa med pa ni de rnams stong pa dang kun rdzob tu nyes skyon dang bcas pas smon pa dang 'tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni de rnams stong pa dang kun rdzob tu nyes skyon dang bcas pas smon pa dang 'tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The absence of expectancy is the emptiness of those and the search for the faults and flaws of the relative.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma bcu med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma bcu med pa ste /
translated: The absence of attributes is the absence of ten attributes.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'i mtshan ma dang skye 'jig gnas pa gsum gyi mtshan ma dang / po dang mo'i mtshan ma med pa ste /üîΩde rnams @134a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'i mtshan ma dang skye 'jig gnas pa gsum gyi mtshan ma dang / po dang mo'i mtshan ma med pa ste / de rnams @134a * //
translated: The attributes of the five objects such as form, the attributes of the three: arising, abiding, and ceasing, the attributes of male and female, and the attributes of the four: form, feeling, perception, and formation.

original: kyis kyang lus dang longs spyod dang gnas kyi mtshan ma gsum spangs pa'o //
analyzed: kyis kyang lus dang longs spyod dang gnas kyi mtshan ma gsum spangs pa'o //
translated: Those are the attributes of the body, enjoyments, and abode.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni yang dag pa'i don gang gi mthar thug pa'i gnas lugs de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni yang dag pa'i don gang gi mthar thug pa'i gnas lugs de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The perfect limit is the suchness of the natural state, the ultimate meaning of perfection.

original: mya ngan la 'das pa ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan la 'das pa ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is natural nirvana.

original: de la sogs pa de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The suchness of those and so on is the dharmadhatu.

original: don dam pa'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i snying po'i sgo ni dngos po lta bur bstan pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i snying po'i sgo ni dngos po lta bur bstan pa'i thabs te /
translated: The door of the heart that is included in the ultimate enumeration is the method of teaching as if it were a thing.

original: des snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi yul spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba nyid ston to ;
analyzed: des snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi yul spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba nyid ston to ;
translated: It teaches that the object of non-apparent transcendent wisdom is free from elaborations and is luminosity.

original: / bzo ni rig pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: / bzo ni rig pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Skill is a special knowledge.

original: nan tan ni yid gzhungs pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan ni yid gzhungs pa'o //
translated: Diligence is a sharp mind.

original: ji ltar rdza mkhan gyi dpe dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'jim pa lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po las /
analyzed: ji ltar rdza mkhan gyi dpe dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'jim pa lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po las /
translated: Just as in the example of the potter, the TathƒÅgata, from the tathƒÅgata heart that is like clay,

original: de kho na nyid shes pa'i shes rab dang / sems can 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa'i shes rab dang / sems can 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa 'am /
translated: through the various skillful means of the wisdom that knows thatness and taming sentient beings, teaches the tathƒÅgata heart.

original: yang bdag tu smra bas 'jigs pa dang bdag tu phyin ci log du 'gyur ba spang pa'i don du gang zag gis bdag med par bstan pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang bdag tu smra bas 'jigs pa dang bdag tu phyin ci log du 'gyur ba spang pa'i don du gang zag gis bdag med par bstan pas kyang rung ste /
translated: Or, in order to abandon fear of the self and the error of the self, it is also suitable to teach the selflessness of persons.

original: sems can so so la grags pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis dngos sam brgyud pa'i sgo nas snying po de nyid rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can so so la grags pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis dngos sam brgyud pa'i sgo nas snying po de nyid rtogs par byed cing /
translated: It causes the realization of that essence by means of various kinds of words and letters that are renowned to individual sentient beings, either directly or indirectly.

original: gnas skabs kyi lam mi 'dra ba la brten nas rigs gcig po de nyid las gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu mi 'dra ba sna tshogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi lam mi 'dra ba la brten nas rigs gcig po de nyid las gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu mi 'dra ba sna tshogs byed pa'o //
translated: Based on the different temporary paths, that single essence produces various temporary results.

original: snying po bstan pas snying po ston zhes pa ni dngos po'i sgrar bstan pa'i thabs kyi snying po yang dag rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying po bstan pas snying po ston zhes pa ni dngos po'i sgrar bstan pa'i thabs kyi snying po yang dag rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe essence is taught by the teaching of the essence‚Äù is the correct realization of the essence of the method that is taught by the term ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'tshang rgya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: mngon par 'tshang rgya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes te /
translated: How does one become enlightened?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'i tshul bstan nas 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i don du snying po'i sgrar bstan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'i tshul bstan nas 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i don du snying po'i sgrar bstan zhes pa'o //
translated: After the mode of thinking ‚ÄúHow does one become enlightened?‚Äù is taught, the meaning of ‚Äúenlightenment‚Äù is taught by the term ‚Äúessence.‚Äù

original: gang zag rgyu ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis brtags pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: gang zag rgyu ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis brtags pa lta bu'am /
translated: The person is not like the person imputed by non-Buddhists.

original: rang gi sde pa gang dag rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang du yang brjod du med pa'i gang zag las dang las kyi khur khyer ba yod par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa gang dag rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang du yang brjod du med pa'i gang zag las dang las kyi khur khyer ba yod par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some of our own schools assert that there is a person who is inexpressible as either permanent or impermanent, and who carries the burden of karma and the results of karma.

original: rkyen ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Conditions are ignorance and so forth.

original: rdul ni @134b rang gi sde pas 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: rdul ni @134b rang gi sde pas 'dod pa 'am /
translated: Particles are what are asserted by our own schools,

original: yang phyi rol pas rdul phra rab rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang phyi rol pas rdul phra rab rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'o //
translated: or else, what are asserted by non-Buddhists as permanent particles.

original: don 'di rnams kyang /üîΩsnying po ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don 'di rnams kyang / snying po ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: These topicsüîΩare also to be applied as answers to the question,

original: zhes pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow does the essence arise?‚Äù

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúThen the bodhisattva,‚ÄùüîΩthe reply to the question,

original: rnal 'byor las ni ji ltar ldog / rnal 'byor la yang ji ltar 'jug / ci 'dra'i skyes bu ci tshul du //
analyzed: rnal 'byor las ni ji ltar ldog / rnal 'byor la yang ji ltar 'jug / ci 'dra'i skyes bu ci tshul du //
translated: ‚ÄúHow does one turn away from yoga? How does one enter into yoga? What is a person like? In what way is a person like that?

original: rnal 'byor gzhag pa bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gzhag pa bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please teach me the yoga of resting.‚Äù

original: zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i thabs ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i thabs ston pa'o //
translated: is taught by way of the reply to the question, which is the method of purifying the essence of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de la g-yo ba med pa ni de kho na nyid du sems kyi 'jug pa 'am /
analyzed: de la g-yo ba med pa ni de kho na nyid du sems kyi 'jug pa 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúUnmoving‚Äù means that the mind does not engage in reality.

original: mi rtag pa dngos por yang grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dngos por yang grub pa med pa'o //
translated: Impermanence is not established as a thing.

original: bag chags la mngon par zhen pas bsgos pa /
analyzed: bag chags la mngon par zhen pas bsgos pa /
translated: ‚ÄúTainted by the latent propensities‚Äù means that the mind is tainted by the latent propensities of the afflictions.

original: khams gsum gyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs la nye bar spyod pas 'brel pa zhes pa ni khams gsum po bag chags kyis gzhag cing /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs la nye bar spyod pas 'brel pa zhes pa ni khams gsum po bag chags kyis gzhag cing /
translated: ‚ÄúConnected to the various forms of the three realms‚Äù means that the three realms are established by the latent propensities.

original: de yang khams gsum gyis bsdus pa'i tshul lugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis spyod pas 'khor bar rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de yang khams gsum gyis bsdus pa'i tshul lugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis spyod pas 'khor bar rjes su 'brel pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the various ways of being included in the three realms are connected to cyclic existence by the conduct of craving the pleasures of the desire realm and by the conduct of craving the taste of the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i gzugs skye ba dang 'dra bar zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni gzugs de dag la rang dang gzhan dang gnyis kar gyur pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i gzugs skye ba dang 'dra bar zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni gzugs de dag la rang dang gzhan dang gnyis kar gyur pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúLike the arising of forms in a magical illusion‚Äù means that because those forms do not have a cause that is the same as, different from, or both the same as and different from them,

original: mi skye ba dang 'dra bar dngos po thams cad mi skye zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba dang 'dra bar dngos po thams cad mi skye zhes pa ste /
translated: all things are like what is not arisen.

original: ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩgzhan yang srid pa'i yan lag gi rkyen rnams kyi rdul phra rab bam /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no // gzhan yang srid pa'i yan lag gi rkyen rnams kyi rdul phra rab bam /
translated: As it was taught above.üîΩMoreover, one sees that the aggregates of subtle particles or moments, which are the conditions for the limbs of existence,

original: skad cig ma 'dus pa'i phung po dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa gang dag gis ched du spangs pa med par mthong nas kun rdzob tu rang dga' ba'i rtogs pas brtags pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma 'dus pa'i phung po dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa gang dag gis ched du spangs pa med par mthong nas kun rdzob tu rang dga' ba'i rtogs pas brtags pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: are not intentionally abandoned by any Ishvara, etc., and one understands that they are just imputed by the autonomous thought of the superficial.

original: rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa khong du chud ces pa ni rtogs pa de nyid khyad par du gyur pa so so rang rig pa'i tshul gyis mngon du byas pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa khong du chud ces pa ni rtogs pa de nyid khyad par du gyur pa so so rang rig pa'i tshul gyis mngon du byas pa ste /
translated: The understanding of the transformation of thought is the actualization of that very thought, which has become special, by the method of individual intuitive awareness.

original: der rnam par shes pa rnams kyi snang ba yang gnas par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: der rnam par shes pa rnams kyi snang ba yang gnas par gyur ba'o //
translated: There, the appearances of the consciousnesses also become stabilized.

original: yang 'dir phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa rang bzhin med par mthong bas de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa so so rang gi ye shes kyi yul dang / @135a * //
analyzed: yang 'dir phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa rang bzhin med par mthong bas de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log sa bon dang bcas te spangs pa so so rang gi ye shes kyi yul dang / @135a * //
translated: Moreover, here, by seeing that external things, etc., are essenceless, one abandons such error together with its seeds, and the object of individual intuitive awareness

original: yul can chos kyi sku'i ye shes la mngon par mos pa'o //
analyzed: yul can chos kyi sku'i ye shes la mngon par mos pa'o //
translated: The object is the aspiration for the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: 'dis ni thabs byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa nyid bstan la /
analyzed: 'dis ni thabs byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa nyid bstan la /
translated: This shows the method, the generation of the supreme mind of enlightenment.

original: snga ma gsum gyis ni rtse gcig ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa shes rab zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i rnal 'byor bstan te /
analyzed: snga ma gsum gyis ni rtse gcig ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa shes rab zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i rnal 'byor bstan te /
translated: The previous three show the wisdom that is concomitant with the samƒÅdhi of one-pointedness, the yoga of the union of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i rigs sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i rigs sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: Thus, the path of the union of method and wisdom purifies the family of the ƒÅryas

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'dren par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'dren par byed pa ste /
translated: and leads to the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //üîΩde nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas kyang /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no // de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas kyang /
translated: It is as previously explained.üîΩThen, the BhagavƒÅn said to Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who wishes to understand the meaning of the words of this Dharma teaching should train in the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba dag dang lus 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba dag dang lus 'dzin pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, how should bodhisattvas train in the perfection of wisdom?‚ÄùüîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, bodhisattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom by not training in any phenomena.‚Äù

original: ci yi slad du bya ba 'byung //
analyzed: ci yi slad du bya ba 'byung //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, how should bodhisattvas train in the perfection of wisdom by not training in any phenomena?‚ÄùüîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, bodhisattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom by not training in form, not training in feeling, not training in perception, not training in formation, and not training in consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩMa√±ju≈õrƒ´ said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, how should bodhisattvas train in the perfection of wisdom by not training in form, not training in feeling, not training in perception, not training in formation, and not training in consciousness?‚ÄùüîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, bodhisattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom by not training in the skandhas, not training in the dhƒÅtus, not training in the ƒÅyatanas, not training in the four truths, not training in the twelve links of dependent origination, not training in the perfections, not training in the emptinesses, not training in the thirty-seven factors for awakening, not training in the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, not training in the four fearlessnesses, not training in the four detailed and thorough knowledges, not training in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, not training in the knowledge of all aspects, and not training in the knowledge of paths.‚ÄùüîΩMa√±

original: zhes pa dang / rkyen gyis skye ba ji lta bu 'bras bu gang lags rgyu ni ci zhes dris pa'i lan ni sngar bstan pa las tshul gzhan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / rkyen gyis skye ba ji lta bu 'bras bu gang lags rgyu ni ci zhes dris pa'i lan ni sngar bstan pa las tshul gzhan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: The reply to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of the effect that arises from conditions?‚Äù is explained in detail by means of a method other than that taught above.

original: de yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas don dam pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas don dam pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Moreover, by understanding the characteristics of causes and conditions, one will enter into the nature of the ultimate expanse.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: By engaging with dependent origination, one will enter into the expanse of reality.

original: de la phyi ni phyi rol du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyi ni phyi rol du snang ba'o //
translated: Here, the external is the appearance of the external.

original: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa la /
analyzed: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa la /
translated: With regard to the teaching on internal dependent origination,

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las dang chos 'di dag la sogs pa ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las dang chos 'di dag la sogs pa ni zhes pa la /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúignorance, craving, action, and so on‚Äù

original: len pa dang srid pa dang rnam par shes pa rgyus bsdus pa yang ste /
analyzed: len pa dang srid pa dang rnam par shes pa rgyus bsdus pa yang ste /
translated: are also included in the causes of grasping, becoming, and consciousness.

original: de la srid pa la sogs pa gsum ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las mngon par 'du byas kyang /
analyzed: de la srid pa la sogs pa gsum ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las mngon par 'du byas kyang /
translated: Among these, the three beginning with existence are mentioned here because, although karma is accumulated through the condition of ignorance,

original: sred pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis ma zin na /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis ma zin na /
translated: if it is not embraced by the condition of craving and so forth,

original: yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur bas 'dir smos pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur bas 'dir smos pa'o //
translated: then the actualization of further existence will not occur.

original: rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob zhes bya ba ni rgyus bsdus pa drug gam rnam pa lnga'o //üîΩblo gros chen po 'di dag las skyes pa'i phung po dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'bras bus bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa 'am /üîΩming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bus bsdus pa drug gam /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob zhes bya ba ni rgyus bsdus pa drug gam rnam pa lnga'o // blo gros chen po 'di dag las skyes pa'i phung po dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'bras bus bsdus pa'i rnam par shes pa 'am / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bus bsdus pa drug gam /
translated: The phrase obtains the name dependent origination refers to the six or five aspects that are subsumed by causes.

original: yang na bdun nyid do //
analyzed: yang na bdun nyid do //
translated: The phrase MahƒÅmati, these are the six or seven results that arise from those refers to the six or seven results that are subsumed by consciousness or name-and-form and so forth.

original: 'di rnams kyi don cung zad bsdus te gsal ba bstan pa ni 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i mdo las rnam pa bcu'i sgo nas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don cung zad bsdus te gsal ba bstan pa ni 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i mdo las rnam pa bcu'i sgo nas gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of these is summarized a little and clarified in the noble S≈´tra of the Ten Stages, which teaches them from ten perspectives.

original: 'di ltar srid pa'i yan lag @135b rjes su 'brel pa dang / sems gcig tu yang dag bar 'du ba dang / rang gi las ma 'dres pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa'i yan lag @135b rjes su 'brel pa dang / sems gcig tu yang dag bar 'du ba dang / rang gi las ma 'dres pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: and they are not different.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyud du gcig ba 'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyud du gcig ba 'am /
translated: They are the same in being a continuum of affliction,üîΩin being the same in being the cause of the uninterrupted continuity of each of their own results,üîΩin being the same in being the support,üîΩin being the continuum of the three paths,üîΩin being dependent on the prior limit, the present, and the future limit,

original: rang rang gi 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rton par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa dang / lam gsum gyi rgyud du 'brang ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang da ltar byung ba dang phyi ma'i mtha' la ltos pa dang / sdug bsngal gsum kun du 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rang rang gi 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rton par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa dang / lam gsum gyi rgyud du 'brang ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang da ltar byung ba dang phyi ma'i mtha' la ltos pa dang / sdug bsngal gsum kun du 'byung ba dang /
translated: in being the origination of the three kinds of suffering,üîΩin arising from causes and conditions,üîΩin being related to birth and destruction,

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa dang / med pas zad par so sor rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa dang / med pas zad par so sor rtogs pa'o //
translated: and in being individually realized as exhausted by nonexistence.

original: de las dang po pa'i dbang du byas ta /
analyzed: de las dang po pa'i dbang du byas ta /
translated: The first of these is from the perspective of the beginner.

original: ma rig pa ni bden pa rnams mngon par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni bden pa rnams mngon par mi shes pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is not directly knowing the truths.

original: de yang kun du brtags pa'i ma rig ba'o //
analyzed: de yang kun du brtags pa'i ma rig ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the imagined ignorance.

original: 'du byed sems pa dang bsam ba'i las so //
analyzed: 'du byed sems pa dang bsam ba'i las so //
translated: The formations are the volition and the action of volition.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gtso bor kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gtso bor kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the fundamental consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs ni dbang po ma dod pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni dbang po ma dod pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Name-and-form is the stage when the faculties are not yet complete.

original: skye mched drug ni dbang po thams cad rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni dbang po thams cad rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The six sense bases is the stage when the faculties are complete.

original: reg pa ni bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Contact is the discrimination of the aspects of the object that is to be experienced as pleasure, etc.

original: de yang sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i bye brag mi phyed pa ni reg pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i bye brag mi phyed pa ni reg pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das pa las gsungs so //
translated: And it is said in the Paramartha-sastra: ‚ÄúContact is the nondiscrimination of the specific differences of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.‚Äù

original: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Sensation is the experience of the object.

original: srid pa ni tshor ba la chags pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni tshor ba la chags pa'o //
translated: Craving is attachment to sensation.

original: len pa ni tshor ba'i rgyu la chags pa'o //
analyzed: len pa ni tshor ba'i rgyu la chags pa'o //
translated: Grasping is attachment to the cause of sensation.

original: srid pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon kun gzhi la yod pa len pas gsos btab ste /üîΩmthu dang ldan par song ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon kun gzhi la yod pa len pas gsos btab ste /üîΩmthu dang ldan par song ba'o //
translated: Existence is the seed of name-and-form in the store consciousness nourished by grasping and thus become powerful.üîΩConsciousness is the consciousness that is the seed of name-and-form.

original: skye ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa de nyid dang thog mar byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa de nyid dang thog mar byung ba'o //
translated: Birth is the initial arising of name and form, etc.

original: rga shi ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa de nyid gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa dang rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: rga shi ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa de nyid gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa dang rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Aging and death is the transformation of name and form, etc., into another state and the severence of their continuum.

original: yang rgas pa ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o //üîΩzhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: yang rgas pa ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o // zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: Also, aging is the complete ripening of the aggregates.

original: spyi'i nges pa'i tshig ni snga ma snga ma rnams la rten cing 'brel te phyi ma rnams 'byung bas so //
analyzed: spyi'i nges pa'i tshig ni snga ma snga ma rnams la rten cing 'brel te phyi ma rnams 'byung bas so //
translated: The general etymologies are as follows: because the former are dependent and connected, the latter arise.

original: so so'i dbye ba la ma rig pa ni gnyis te /üîΩlas rgyu 'bras la rmongs pa srog gi mchod sbyin la sogs pas thar par 'dod pa dang / de kho na nyid la rmongs pa bdag dang bdag gi la sogs par phyin ci log pa dang de rnams ji lta ba bzhin @136a * //
analyzed: so so'i dbye ba la ma rig pa ni gnyis te / las rgyu 'bras la rmongs pa srog gi mchod sbyin la sogs pas thar par 'dod pa dang / de kho na nyid la rmongs pa bdag dang bdag gi la sogs par phyin ci log pa dang de rnams ji lta ba bzhin @136a * //
translated: Ignorance is twofold:

original: ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: ignorance of the cause and effect of karma, such as the belief that sacrifice of life, etc., leads to liberation, and ignorance of reality, such as the misconception of self and mine, and the non-realization of them as they are.

original: 'du byed la gsum ste /
analyzed: 'du byed la gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of karmic predispositions:

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las so //
translated: meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable karma.

original: yang na sgo gsum gyi las gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na sgo gsum gyi las gsum mo //
translated: Or else, the three actions of the three doors.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rgyu dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rgyu dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa gnyis so //
translated: Consciousness is twofold: cause and effect.

original: ming dang gzugs ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Name-and-form is fivefold.

original: skye mched ni drug go //
analyzed: skye mched ni drug go //
translated: The six sense spheres are sixfold.

original: reg pa yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa drug go //üîΩtshor ba yang de nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'am /
analyzed: reg pa yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa drug go // tshor ba yang de nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'am /
translated: Contact is also sixfold, such as contact through the coming together of eye, form, and consciousness.

original: rnam pa gsum mam lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum mam lnga'o //
translated: Feeling is also threefold or fivefold, in accordance with that.

original: sred pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sred pa ni gsum ste /
translated: Craving is threefold:

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: craving for desire, craving for form, and craving for the formless.

original: len pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: len pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Grasping is fourfold:

original: 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'o //
translated: grasping at desire, grasping at views, grasping at morality and asceticism, and grasping at the doctrine of self.

original: 'dir nye bar len zhes pa ni de dag la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar len zhes pa ni de dag la chags pa'o //
translated: Here, grasping means attachment to them.

original: srid pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: srid pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Existence is also fourfold:

original: sngon dus kyi srid pa dang / 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dus kyi srid pa dang / 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: the existence of the past, the existence of death, the existence in the intermediate state, and the existence of birth.

original: 'dir ni de rnams kyis bsdus pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon len pas mthu dang ldan par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni de rnams kyis bsdus pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon len pas mthu dang ldan par byas pa'o //
translated: Here, the seed of name-and-form included in those is empowered by being made powerful.

original: skye ba dang rga shi las skye ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi las skye ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Birth and aging-and-death are threefold:

original: skad cig gi skye ba dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i skye ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig gi skye ba dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i skye ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skye ba'o //
translated: momentary birth, birth as actualization, and birth as rebirth.

original: rgas pa yang gsum ste /
analyzed: rgas pa yang gsum ste /
translated: Aging is also threefold:

original: nye bar spyad pas rgas pa dang / gzhan nyid kyis rgas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bas rgas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyad pas rgas pa dang / gzhan nyid kyis rgas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bas rgas pa'o //
translated: aging through usage, aging through another state, and aging through transformation.

original: gnyis pa de rnams sems gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa de rnams sems gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba ni /
translated: The second is the complete inclusion of those in a single mind.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar kun rdzob tu thams cad sems nyid yin la de yang spyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig nyid de /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar kun rdzob tu thams cad sems nyid yin la de yang spyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig nyid de /
translated: As previously explained, conventionally everything is mind-only, and that is generally the one all-ground consciousness.

original: rgya mtsho dang dpa' rlabs bzhin zhes sngar bstan to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang dpa' rlabs bzhin zhes sngar bstan to //
translated: As previously explained, it is like the ocean and waves.

original: gzhan yang rgyun dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi ni thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pas der 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyun dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi ni thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pas der 'du shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the alaya that is continuous is the seed of everything, and so it is the perception of that.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: All of these are present in a single mind.

original: rang gi las ma 'dres pa ni dang por ma rig pa'i dbang du byas na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi las ma 'dres pa ni dang por ma rig pa'i dbang du byas na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One‚Äôs own karma is unmixed. First, when it is under the influence of ignorance, it is twofold:

original: sems can rnams dmigs pa la kun du rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams dmigs pa la kun du rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes sentient beings to be confused about their objects and it produces the cause for the establishment of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang @136b bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang @136b bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The formative forces are not present as two actions:

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa yang mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa yang mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: they establish the future ripening and they produce the cause for the establishment of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the remaining limbs also

original: rang rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma rnams mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu 'byin pa dang / khyad par du rnam par shes pas srid pa nying mtshams sbyor bar yang byed pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyis phan tshun ston par byed pa dang / skye mched drug gis rang gi yul rnams phye ba yang ston pa dang /
analyzed: rang rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma rnams mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu 'byin pa dang / khyad par du rnam par shes pas srid pa nying mtshams sbyor bar yang byed pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyis phan tshun ston par byed pa dang / skye mched drug gis rang gi yul rnams phye ba yang ston pa dang /
translated: The six sense bases reveal the division of their own objects,üîΩcontact makes contact with its focal object and feeling experiences what is desirable, undesirable and free from both.

original: reg pas dmigs pa la reg par byed pa dang / tshor bas yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba myong bar yang byed pa dang / sred pas chags par gyur pa'i dngos po la kun du chags bar yang byed pa dang /
analyzed: reg pas dmigs pa la reg par byed pa dang / tshor bas yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba myong bar yang byed pa dang / sred pas chags par gyur pa'i dngos po la kun du chags bar yang byed pa dang /
translated: Craving causes attachment to things that are desired and grasping fully takes hold of those things.

original: len pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'brel bar yang byed pa dang / srid pas sred pa'i rgyud gzhan yang gnas par byed pa dang / skye bas phung po 'byung bar byed pa dang / rga bas dbang po yongs su 'gyur par byed pa dang /
analyzed: len pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'brel bar yang byed pa dang / srid pas sred pa'i rgyud gzhan yang gnas par byed pa dang / skye bas phung po 'byung bar byed pa dang / rga bas dbang po yongs su 'gyur par byed pa dang /
translated: it causes the faculties to change through aging,üîΩit causes conditioned states to disintegrate through death,

original: 'chi bas 'du byed 'jig par byed pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'chi bas 'du byed 'jig par byed pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: and it produces the cause of the uninterrupted continuum of ignorance.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid ma rtogs pas tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyur yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid ma rtogs pas tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyur yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of other lives due to not understanding the reality of dependent origination.

original: de la byed pa 'di rnams kyi don ni ji ltar dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus zhes pa dang / tshad ma ni yul la sgro 'dogs gcod par byed ces pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa 'di rnams kyi don ni ji ltar dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus zhes pa dang / tshad ma ni yul la sgro 'dogs gcod par byed ces pa lta bu ste /
translated: The meaning of these activities is like the characteristic of a thing is the ability to perform a function and a valid cognition is that which eliminates superimpositions with regard to its object.

original: byed pa rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin gyi don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin gyi don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: An activity is the essence of something and not something else.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i don ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes pa ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rton par byed pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i don ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes pa ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rton par byed pa ste /
translated: The meaning of non-difference is that the formations are the condition of ignorance. The formations are the condition of ignorance in the sense of continuity and support.

original: de yang ma rig pa ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, ignorance has two states: the state of seed and the state of fruit.

original: de la sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyis ni /
analyzed: de la sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyis ni /
translated: In this regard, the state of seed

original: 'du byed rgyun mi 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed rgyun mi 'chad par byed do //
translated: makes the formations continuous.

original: sa bon ma spangs pa de srid du 'du byed kyi rgyun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon ma spangs pa de srid du 'du byed kyi rgyun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as the seed is not abandoned, the continuity of the formations occurs.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyis ni skyed cing rton par byed de /üîΩde skyes pas de yang rjes thogs su skye @137a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyis ni skyed cing rton par byed de / de skyes pas de yang rjes thogs su skye @137a * //
translated: The state of fruit generates and supports.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it arises, that also arises immediately after.

original: don 'di gnyis kyang 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes pa dang / 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skyes zhes bya ba'i don rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: don 'di gnyis kyang 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes pa dang / 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skyes zhes bya ba'i don rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: These two meanings are taught by the two meanings of ‚Äúbecause this exists, that occurs‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause this arises, that arises.‚Äù

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The remaining members should be understood in the same way.

original: lam gsum gyi rgyun du 'brang ba ni de lam rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gsum gyi rgyun du 'brang ba ni de lam rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The continuity of the three paths is the continuity of the path of affliction, which is craving and grasping, and the affliction of affliction.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: Conditioning and becoming are the continuity of the path of karma.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: They are the affliction of karma.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: The remaining members are distinguished as the continuity of suffering.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: They are the affliction of birth.

original: de nyid sa bcu'i mgon pos kyang //
analyzed: de nyid sa bcu'i mgon pos kyang //
translated: The lords of the ten stages have also said

original: dang po brgyad dang dgu nyon mongs //
analyzed: dang po brgyad dang dgu nyon mongs //
translated: That the first, eighth, and ninth are afflictions,

original: gnyis dang bcu pa las yin te //
analyzed: gnyis dang bcu pa las yin te //
translated: The second and tenth are karma,

original: lhag ma dag ni tshe yin no //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni tshe yin no //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
translated: And the remaining ones are life.

original: 'dis kyang da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten nas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mngon par 'grub cing de dag tu yang snga ma bzhin du nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang zhing /
analyzed: 'dis kyang da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten nas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mngon par 'grub cing de dag tu yang snga ma bzhin du nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang zhing /
translated: This also is the establishment of future birth in dependence on the defilement of the present passion and the defilement of the present action instigated by it. And in those future births, the passion instigates the action,

original: las mngon par 'dus byas pas yang gzhan du skye ba mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: las mngon par 'dus byas pas yang gzhan du skye ba mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: and the action establishes the birth in another world, as before.

original: sdug bsngal kyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mass of suffering arises.

original: dus gsum la ltos pa yang ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum la ltos pa yang ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa ste /
translated: The three times are also related: ignorance and the conditioning factors are related to the prior limit,

original: da ltar gyi phung po'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: because they are the cause of the present aggregates.

original: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba'i bar ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba'i bar ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa ste /
translated: Consciousness up to feeling are related to the present,

original: snga ma la ltos pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pas ltos pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma la ltos pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pas ltos pa'o //
translated: because they are the result of the prior and the cause of the subsequent.

original: sred pa la sogs pa gsum ni phyi ma'i mtha'i ltos pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa gsum ni phyi ma'i mtha'i ltos pa ste /
translated: The three, craving and so on, are the future dependence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la sogs pas bsdus pa ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la sogs pas bsdus pa ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the cause of name and form and so on subsumed by future birth and so forth.

original: de ltar bstan pas kyang srid pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du go rims su bstan pa 'di rnams tshe gsum la rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas kyang srid pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du go rims su bstan pa 'di rnams tshe gsum la rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Thus the order of these is taught in terms of the cause and effect of existence. They are completed in three lifetimes.

original: dang po gnyis ni snga ma lnga'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni snga ma lnga'o //
translated: The first two are subsumed by the first five.

original: de nas rnam pa brgyad ni tshe 'di nyid la rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa brgyad ni tshe 'di nyid la rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Then the eight aspects are completed in this lifetime.

original: sred pa la sogs pa gsum phyi ma'i mtha'i ltos pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni de'i nye ba'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa gsum phyi ma'i mtha'i ltos pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni de'i nye ba'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: The three, craving and so on, are the future dependence. They are the immediate cause of future birth and so on.

original: tshe'i dbang du byas na da @137b ltar bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i dbang du byas na da @137b ltar bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of lifetime, they are subsumed by the present.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni tshe phyi mas bsdus pa'o //üîΩphyi ma phan chad du yang de bzhin du rab tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni tshe phyi mas bsdus pa'o // phyi ma phan chad du yang de bzhin du rab tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: Birth and aging and death are subsumed by the future lifetime.üîΩThey occur in the future and so on.

original: phyi ma nyid kyi dus mngon du gyur pa na de la ltos te /
analyzed: phyi ma nyid kyi dus mngon du gyur pa na de la ltos te /
translated: When the future becomes the present, they are dependent on that.

original: de ltar ba ni sngon gyi mtha' la ltos zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ba ni sngon gyi mtha' la ltos zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúThis is dependent on the prior limit.‚Äù

original: shes par zad do /
analyzed: shes par zad do /
translated: This is all that is known.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu yang tshar gnyis kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu yang tshar gnyis kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Therefore, cause and effect are also included in two parts.

original: dang po gnyis ni rgyu la /
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni rgyu la /
translated: The first two are the cause.

original: de nas rnam pa lnga ni 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa lnga ni 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: Then, the next five are the effect.

original: yang sred pa la sogs pa gsum ni phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: yang sred pa la sogs pa gsum ni phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the three, craving and so on, are the cause of the future.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni 'bras bu rgyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni 'bras bu rgyur pa'o //
translated: Birth and aging and death are the effect.

original: gzhan yang 'di rnams kyis ni gang dag ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di rnams kyis ni gang dag ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since ignorance and formation and so on are not differentiated,üîΩit would follow that the bodies of all sentient beings would be simultaneously established.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus cig car 'grub par thal zhes pa dang / gzhan yang gang zag gi bdag med par 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus cig car 'grub par thal zhes pa dang / gzhan yang gang zag gi bdag med par 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when all formations become momentary due to the selflessness of persons,

original: byed pa po med pas las bdag gir bya ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa po med pas las bdag gir bya ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: since there would be no agent, there would be no karma to be appropriated.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: las byas nas ni zhig pa na //
analyzed: las byas nas ni zhig pa na //
translated: Having performed the action, it disintegrates.

original: su yi las su 'gyur zhe na //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: su yi las su 'gyur zhe na // zhes pa ste /
translated: Whose karma would it be?

original: rnam par smin pa'i dus na las byed pa po 'gags nas med pas des rnam par smin pa myong ba med cing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i dus na las byed pa po 'gags nas med pas des rnam par smin pa myong ba med cing /
translated: Since the agent of the karma ceases and does not exist at the time of its maturation, it does not experience its karmic maturation.

original: gzhan la smin par 'gyur bar byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i nyes par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la smin par 'gyur bar byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i nyes par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: The error of wasting what was done and encountering what was not done would ensue.

original: gzhan yang sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu ma bskyed par 'gags pas phyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir las rnams chud zos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩskyon med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu ma bskyed par 'gags pas phyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir las rnams chud zos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhe na / skyon med de /
translated: Moreover, since past karma ceases without generating a result, the error of wasting karma would ensue since it does not exist at the time of generating a result later.

original: spyir las byas pa dang / byas kyang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa dang / byas shing 'bras bu ma bskyed kyang gnyen po rnyed pas spangs zin pa na yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa mi 'thad la /
analyzed: spyir las byas pa dang / byas kyang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa dang / byas shing 'bras bu ma bskyed kyang gnyen po rnyed pas spangs zin pa na yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa mi 'thad la /
translated: There is no error because in general it is untenable that karmic maturation is established when karma is created, when it is created but its result has already been generated, or when it is created but its result is not generated and it is abandoned through obtaining its antidote.

original: de'i phyir las 'ga' zhig ni byas la 'ga' zhig ni ma byas pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir las 'ga' zhig ni byas la 'ga' zhig ni ma byas pa 'am /
translated: Therefore some karma is created and some is not created.

original: byas pa yang 'ga' zhig gis ni 'bras bu bskyed zin pa 'am //
analyzed: byas pa yang 'ga' zhig gis ni 'bras bu bskyed zin pa 'am //
translated: Some karma has already generated its result,

original: 'ga' zhig gis ma bskyed pa 'am /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis ma bskyed pa 'am /
translated: some has not yet generated its result,

original: ma bskyed pa yang 'ga' zhig ni gnyen pos spangs pa 'am /
analyzed: ma bskyed pa yang 'ga' zhig ni gnyen pos spangs pa 'am /
translated: some karma that has not yet generated its result has been abandoned by its antidote,

original: 'ga' zhig ni ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni ma spangs pa ste /
translated: and some has not been abandoned.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi lus cig car mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur te /üîΩlas ma byas pa 'am byas pa 'am byas kyang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi lus cig car mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur te / las ma byas pa 'am byas pa 'am byas kyang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, the body of all beings does not simultaneously manifest.

original: byas lam @138a * //
analyzed: byas lam @138a * //
translated: The result of karma that has not been committed, that has been committed but has been abandoned by its antidote,üîΩor that has been committed but its result has already been generated

original: bskyed kyang gnyen po mngon par thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bskyed kyang gnyen po mngon par thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: does not occur.

original: de las bzlog pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The result of karma that is the opposite of those does occur.

original: des na rgyu las khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pas nyes pa dang po las grol lo //
analyzed: des na rgyu las khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pas nyes pa dang po las grol lo //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference in the cause, the reason is not established, and the first fault is overcome.

original: gnyis pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The second fault is also untenable.
