original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyun dang ldan pas de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sa bon gyi kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par shes pas las bsags shing /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyun dang ldan pas de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sa bon gyi kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par shes pas las bsags shing /
translated: Since the foundation consciousness is continuous, the consciousnesses that arise from the seeds that are its nature accumulate karma.

original: las kyi skad cig 'gags pa na yang de'i sa bon kun gzhi la bsgos pa /
analyzed: las kyi skad cig 'gags pa na yang de'i sa bon kun gzhi la bsgos pa /
translated: Even when the moments of karma cease, the seeds of those karmas are infused in the foundation consciousness.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnams las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung pos bsdus pa dang lhan cig pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes par red cing smin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnams las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung pos bsdus pa dang lhan cig pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes par red cing smin pa ste /
translated: The foundation consciousness that is the support and the ripening of the consciousnesses that arise from those seeds that are passed down from one to another is the foundation consciousness that is concomitant with the consciousnesses that are included in the contaminated aggregates.

original: gnas dang lus la sogs pa 'dod bya dang 'dod bya ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ba rgyu ba cha phra ba ste /
analyzed: gnas dang lus la sogs pa 'dod bya dang 'dod bya ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ba rgyu ba cha phra ba ste /
translated: It is the subtle movement that appears as the forms of the desirable and undesirable abodes, bodies, and so on.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / rgyun gcig la ni brten nas su //üîΩbyed po spyod pa zhes byar bstan //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyun gcig la ni brten nas su //üîΩbyed po spyod pa zhes byar bstan //
translated: The agent is taught to be dependent on a single continuum.

original: zhes pa'o // des na 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid 'khor gyi de med par gyur na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // des na 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid 'khor gyi de med par gyur na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, here, the foundation consciousness itself is the wheel. If it did not exist, the wheel of cyclic existence would not be tenable for the active forms of consciousness. This will be explained below.

original: pha rol pos brjod pa'i nyes pa dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol pos brjod pa'i nyes pa dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be connected with the faults expressed by the opponent.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu ma bskyed par las zad pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu ma bskyed par las zad pa de lta na yang /
translated: Moreover, even if karma were to expire without producing a result,

original: las kyis bsgos pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rgyun chags su gnas pa de nyid las 'bras bu 'byung bas las chud zos pa'i nyes pa las kyang grol te /
analyzed: las kyis bsgos pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rgyun chags su gnas pa de nyid las 'bras bu 'byung bas las chud zos pa'i nyes pa las kyang grol te /
translated: the result would arise from the seed that is the foundation consciousness, which is infused by karma and remains continuous. Thus, we are free from the fault that karma would expire.

original: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
translated: The karma of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: does not expire even in one hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and the time are right,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: the result will ripen.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the scriptures.

original: de yang gnyen po ma thob pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gnyen po ma thob pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of an individual who has not attained the antidote.

original: des na las 'ga' zhig ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /üîΩtshe de nyid la 'bras bu bskyed zin pas phyi ma la skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na las 'ga' zhig ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ste / tshe de nyid la 'bras bu bskyed zin pas phyi ma la skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, some karma is to be experienced in the current life.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced after rebirth.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a third life.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a fourth life or after.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a fifth life or after.

original: 'ga' zhig ni sred pa dang len pa'i rkyen tshang zhing gnyen po ma thob pas skyes nas 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur @138b ba'o //üîΩ'ga' zhig ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni sred pa dang len pa'i rkyen tshang zhing gnyen po ma thob pas skyes nas 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur @138b ba'o // 'ga' zhig ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Some karma is to be experienced in a sixth life or after.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a seventh life or after.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.

original: 'ga' zhig myong bar ma nges te /üîΩgnyen po'i stobs kyis zad par 'gyur ba dag kyang srid do //üîΩ'dir chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig myong bar ma nges te / gnyen po'i stobs kyis zad par 'gyur ba dag kyang srid do // 'dir chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las /
translated: Some karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis su grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di rnams la rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa gnyis las /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis su grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di rnams la rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa gnyis las /
translated: Some karma is to be experienced in a life after that.

original: rgyus bsdus pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyus bsdus pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Some karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.üîΩSome karma is to be experienced in a life after that.

original: 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu ring bar gyur pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu nye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu ring bar gyur pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu nye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The projecting cause is the remote cause, and the actualizing cause is the proximate cause.

original: de la 'phen par byed pa ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rgyus bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'phen par byed pa ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rgyus bsdus pa ste /
translated: Among them, the projecting cause is ignorance, karmic formation, and consciousness, which are included in the cause.

original: de yang gang la brten te 'phen pa dang / gang gis 'phen pa dang / tshul ji ltar 'phen te /
analyzed: de yang gang la brten te 'phen pa dang / gang gis 'phen pa dang / tshul ji ltar 'phen te /
translated: Moreover, it is projected in dependence on something, it is projected by something, and it is projected in a certain manner.

original: rnam pa gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These should be applied in order to the three aspects.

original: de ltar 'phen par byed pa yang de rnams las mang pa mi dgos shing nyung na yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur bas de dag tsam du grangs nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'phen par byed pa yang de rnams las mang pa mi dgos shing nyung na yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur bas de dag tsam du grangs nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the projecting cause is definitely that many in number, not more, because there is no need for more, and not less, because there would be a deficiency of factors.

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu la yang /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu la yang /
translated: As for the actualizing cause,

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: there are also three aspects.

original: gang la brten te 'grub pa dang / gang gis 'grub pa dang / ji ltar 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang la brten te 'grub pa dang / gang gis 'grub pa dang / ji ltar 'grub ste /
translated: It is actualized in dependence on something, it is actualized by something, and it is actualized in a certain manner.

original: rim pa bzhin sred len srid pa gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin sred len srid pa gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: These should be applied in order to the three: craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: 'bras bu'i dbang du byas te 'phen par byed pas 'phangs pa ring ba'i 'bras bu ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dbang du byas te 'phen par byed pas 'phangs pa ring ba'i 'bras bu ni bzhi ste /
translated: The result of distant projection is fourfold from the perspective of the result.

original: lus thob pa dang / thob pa gang las longs spyod pa las /
analyzed: lus thob pa dang / thob pa gang las longs spyod pa las /
translated: The first is the attainment of a body and the attainment of resources from which one enjoys resources.

original: dang po ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis te /
translated: The first is twofold:

original: thog ma nyid du thob pa dang / thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du thob pa dang / thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: the attainment of a body in the beginning and the complete attainment of a body.

original: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied respectively to name and form and the six sense bases.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas thob pa yul la longs spyod pa reg pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la longs spyod pa tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas thob pa yul la longs spyod pa reg pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la longs spyod pa tshor ba'o //
translated: From the perspective of the second, the attainment of resources, there is contact, which is the enjoyment of objects, and feeling, which is the enjoyment of the maturation of karma.

original: de ltar na rnam pa bzhir nges so //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa bzhir nges so //
translated: Thus there are definitely four results.

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The result of actualization is twofold:

original: rten gyi dbang du byas pa skye ba dang / brten pa'i dbang du byas nas rga shi'o //
analyzed: rten gyi dbang du byas pa skye ba dang / brten pa'i dbang du byas nas rga shi'o //
translated: birth from the perspective of the basis and aging and death from the perspective of what is based on it.

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum mam bzhi las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum mam bzhi las /
translated: Moreover, from the perspective of the three or four characteristics of conditioned states,

original: gnas pa ma smos pa ni srid pa'i yan lag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtag par bya ba'i don 'di rnams bstan pa ni cung zad 'khor ba las skyo ba skyed pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa ma smos pa ni srid pa'i yan lag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtag par bya ba'i don 'di rnams bstan pa ni cung zad 'khor ba las skyo ba skyed pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: Abiding is not mentioned because the purpose of teaching these topics that are limbs of existence to be investigated by bodhisattvas is to generate a little disenchantment with samsara.

original: gnas pa ni skyo ba skyed pa'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur @139a * //
analyzed: gnas pa ni skyo ba skyed pa'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur @139a * //
translated: Abiding does not become a limb that generates disenchantment.

original: bas ma smos pa'o //
analyzed: bas ma smos pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is not mentioned.

original: rgas pa dang shi ba gnyis yan lag gcig tu gzhag pa yang /
analyzed: rgas pa dang shi ba gnyis yan lag gcig tu gzhag pa yang /
translated: Aging and death are posited as one limb because

original: ma rgas par 'chi ba yod pas de la yan lag 'ga' zhig mtshang bar 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rgas par 'chi ba yod pas de la yan lag 'ga' zhig mtshang bar 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is possible that some limbs are damaged in the case of those who die without aging.

original: gal te de lta na rdzus te skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba la ming dang gzugs med pa'i skye mched drug yod pas de gnyis kyang gcig tu gzhag par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rdzus te skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba la ming dang gzugs med pa'i skye mched drug yod pas de gnyis kyang gcig tu gzhag par rigs so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it is logical to posit both spontaneous birth and heat and moisture birth as one, since both have name and form and the six ƒÅyatanas.

original: de ci nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs med mod kyi /
analyzed: de ci nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs med mod kyi /
translated: Even though the stages of kalala and so on do not exist,

original: de tsam gyis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could that alone mean that name and form and so on do not exist?

original: gzhan yang 'di ni gtso bor mngal nas skye ba dang ; sgo nga las skye ba'i dbang du byas te rnam par gzhag pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni gtso bor mngal nas skye ba dang ; sgo nga las skye ba'i dbang du byas te rnam par gzhag pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Moreover, this is stated primarily from the perspective of birth from a womb and birth from eggs, so there is no error.

original: srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams kyi go rims ni skye ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams kyi go rims ni skye ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The order of these limbs of existence is the order of their arising.

original: gzhan yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Moreover, the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga says:

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ste /
translated: Ignorance, formation, craving, grasping, and existence

original: lnga ni rgyu yis bsdus pa la /
analyzed: lnga ni rgyu yis bsdus pa la /
translated: are included in the cause.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The rest are results.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa thogs med kyis /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa thogs med kyis /
translated: And ƒÄrya Asa·πÖga says:

original: lnga po de rnams las lhag tu rnam par shes pa yang rgyus bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: lnga po de rnams las lhag tu rnam par shes pa yang rgyus bsdus pa ste /
translated: From among those five, consciousness is also included in the cause.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam pa drug tu nges pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam pa drug tu nges pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus cause and effect are ascertained as six types.

original: de ltar rgyu 'bras tshar gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu 'bras tshar gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus they are included in one set of cause and effect.

original: de dag kyang tshe gnyis kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang tshe gnyis kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: They are also included in two lifetimes.

original: snga ma nas 'dir 'pho ba'i dbang du byas na rgyu drug ni tshe snga ma la rdzogs shing nges bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma nas 'dir 'pho ba'i dbang du byas na rgyu drug ni tshe snga ma la rdzogs shing nges bsdus pa yin la /
translated: If it is from the former to this life, the six causes are complete and included in the former life.

original: 'bras bu drug ni tshe 'di nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu drug ni tshe 'di nyid la'o //
translated: The six results are in this life.

original: 'di nas phyi mar 'pho ba'i dbang du byas na yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nas phyi mar 'pho ba'i dbang du byas na yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is from this life to the next, it should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di rnams ni cung zad dpyad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni cung zad dpyad par bya ba ste /
translated: These should be analyzed a little.

original: srid pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di rnams mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du snga ma snga ma rnams kyi rkyen gyis phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba /üîΩdon gyi go rims su bstan pa de ltar na sred pa dang len pa la sogs pa gsum ni tshe snga ma la bsdus par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: srid pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di rnams mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du snga ma snga ma rnams kyi rkyen gyis phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba / don gyi go rims su bstan pa de ltar na sred pa dang len pa la sogs pa gsum ni tshe snga ma la bsdus par mi 'thad de /
translated: Existence is the twelve links, which arise in sequence through the condition of earlier and later links, as stated in the sutras.

original: tshor ba da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the order of their meaning is taught in that way, it is untenable that the three craving, grasping and existence are included in the former life because feeling is present.

original: gzhan du na da ltar ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis tshe snga mas bsdus pa'i sred pa skyed pas ma 'ongs pa rgyu nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na da ltar ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis tshe snga mas bsdus pa'i sred pa skyed pas ma 'ongs pa rgyu nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the future would be the cause because craving subsumed by a former life would be generated due to the condition of present feeling.

original: gal te tshor ba yang srid @139b pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i tshe snga mas bsdus pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba yang srid @139b pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i tshe snga mas bsdus pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that feeling is subsumed by a former life that precedes craving for existence,

original: de lta na de'i rgyur gyur pa'i reg pa la sogs pa yang tshe snga ma nyid kyis bsdus pas 'bras bu de rnams da ltar ba'i sred pas bsdus pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de'i rgyur gyur pa'i reg pa la sogs pa yang tshe snga ma nyid kyis bsdus pas 'bras bu de rnams da ltar ba'i sred pas bsdus pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that the cause of that craving, contact and so on, would also be subsumed by a former life.

original: gzhan yang de ltar na 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang / de rnams kyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar na 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang / de rnams kyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, in that case, it would be untenable to posit the specific categories of projecting causes, establishing causes, the result projected by them and the result established by them.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu skye ba dang rga shi de dag tshe 'di nyid kyis bsdus pa'i ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin nam /üîΩ'on te 'di'i 'og ro la tshe phyi mas bsdus pa gcig yin zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu skye ba dang rga shi de dag tshe 'di nyid kyis bsdus pa'i ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin nam / 'on te 'di'i 'og ro la tshe phyi mas bsdus pa gcig yin zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: The effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.

original: dang po ltar na 'phen byed kyis 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs la sogs pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu gcig nyid yin pas ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ni 'phen byed kyi rgyus 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du chod pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po ltar na 'phen byed kyis 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs la sogs pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu gcig nyid yin pas ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ni 'phen byed kyi rgyus 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du chod pa yin la /
translated: The effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni de las bzlog pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyus mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu bar du mchod pa yin zhes pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni de las bzlog pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyus mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu bar du mchod pa yin zhes pa mi 'thad de /
translated: The effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is the absence of the cause.

original: cha shas kyi bskyed bya skyed byed nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas kyi bskyed bya skyed byed nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect of separation is the absence of the cause.üîΩThe effect of separation is

original: des na ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'phen byed kyi rgyus 'phangs shing bskyed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'phen byed kyi rgyus 'phangs shing bskyed pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as name and form and so on are projected and generated by the projecting cause,

original: skye ba dang rga shi yang 'phangs shing skyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi yang 'phangs shing skyed par 'gyur la /
translated: birth and aging and death are also projected and generated.

original: skye ba dang rga shi mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i rgyus bsgrubs shing bskyed pa ltar /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i rgyus bsgrubs shing bskyed pa ltar /
translated: Just as birth and aging and death are established and generated by the cause that establishes and generates them,

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa yang skyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa yang skyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: name and form and so on are also generated.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang /
translated: According to the second position,üîΩit is untenable that birth and aging and death are the effect that is not obstructed by another

original: skye ba dang rga shi mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu la ltos te /üîΩbar du ma chod pa'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu la ltos te / bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad cing /
translated: in dependence on the cause that establishes birth and aging and death.

original: de rnams tshe gsum la rdzogs pa'i phyogs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams tshe gsum la rdzogs pa'i phyogs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They would be complete in three lifetimes.

original: des na mdo sde dag las bstan pa srid pa'i yan lag skye ba'i go rims su bstan pa rnams ni kho bos sngar bstan pa ltar 'thad kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mdo sde dag las bstan pa srid pa'i yan lag skye ba'i go rims su bstan pa rnams ni kho bos sngar bstan pa ltar 'thad kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the order in which the links of existence are taught in the sutras is tenable as I have previously explained, but not otherwise.

original: spyir sred pa'i yan lag 'di rnams kyi rigs tsam gyi dbang du byas na khams gsum po skye pa rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa rnams kyi tshe re re la yang phal cher rdzogs pa ste /üîΩma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pas rnam par @140a * //
analyzed: spyir sred pa'i yan lag 'di rnams kyi rigs tsam gyi dbang du byas na khams gsum po skye pa rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa rnams kyi tshe re re la yang phal cher rdzogs pa ste / ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pas rnam par @140a * //
translated: In general, in terms of the mere type of these links of craving, they are complete in each life of the three realms subsumed by the four types of birth.

original: shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa na yang sred pa la sogs pa'i rkyen tshang dgos te /
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa na yang sred pa la sogs pa'i rkyen tshang dgos te /
translated: When consciousness and so on are produced by ignorance, formation and so on, the conditions of craving and so on must be complete.

original: ji skad du 'phags pas bcu pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pas bcu pa las /
translated: As the Ten Levels S≈´tra says:

original: 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi rang bzhin yang srid pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi rang bzhin yang srid pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The seeds of mind that are fully infused by those formations, which are contaminated and appropriated, do not give rise to birth, aging, and death in the future, to the nature of existence, and to manifest existence.

original: las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / srid pa'i rlan dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa dang / lta bar gyur pa'i dra ba rab tu 'phel bas ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung bas te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / srid pa'i rlan dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa dang / lta bar gyur pa'i dra ba rab tu 'phel bas ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung bas te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sprout of name and form arises from the field of karma, the darkness of ignorance, the moisture of craving, the swelling of the conceit of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and the proliferation of the net of views.

original: yang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ma rig pa la sogs pa rjes su 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ma rig pa la sogs pa rjes su 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Also, ignorance and so on are related to the stage of name and form and so on.

original: gzhung 'dis ni rnam par shes pa rgyu'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa nyid gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ni rnam par shes pa rgyu'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa nyid gsal bar bstan te /
translated: This passage clearly demonstrates that consciousness is subsumed by the causal factor.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: sems kyi sa bon nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi mngon par 'grub pa nyid du gsungs pas so /
analyzed: sems kyi sa bon nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi mngon par 'grub pa nyid du gsungs pas so /
translated: The seed of mind that appropriates is the establishment of birth and aging and death in the future.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar ba'i ltos pa nyid du gsungs pas ni rnam par shes pa 'bras bus bsdus pa nyid du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar ba'i ltos pa nyid du gsungs pas ni rnam par shes pa 'bras bus bsdus pa nyid du gsungs pa ste /
translated: bases of the present. Thus, consciousness is said to be included in the effect.

original: gang yin kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gang yin kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: So there is no contradiction.

original: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang /
translated: In the noble Aksayamatinirdesa-sutra it says,üîΩSon of noble family, these twelve factors of dependent origination are

original: rigs kyi bu rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni sems can thams cad la mnyam par yod de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni sems can thams cad la mnyam par yod de /
translated: present in all sentient beings equally.

original: phyi nang gnyis so /
analyzed: phyi nang gnyis so /
translated: They are twofold: internal and external.

original: bcu gnyis po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The affliction of the past is ignorance.

original: 'das pa'i las ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las ni 'du byed do //
translated: The karma of the past is compositional activity.

original: da ltar gyi dus na thog mar mngal du 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu sems can thams cad la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'di dag yod mod kyi yongs su ma rdzogs te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na thog mar mngal du 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu sems can thams cad la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'di dag yod mod kyi yongs su ma rdzogs te /
translated: And again, Son of noble family, although these dependent originations exist in all sentient beings, they are not complete.üîΩWhen the embryo is in the stage of a lump, death is not tenable, and the six sense spheres and so on are not tenable.

original: nur nur por 'dug pa'i tshe shi ba la skye mched drug la sogs pa mi 'thad pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can la tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang / reg pa rnam pa gsum dang / sred pa rnams @140b dang ; rga ba dang shi ba med kyang rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nur nur por 'dug pa'i tshe shi ba la skye mched drug la sogs pa mi 'thad pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can la tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang / reg pa rnam pa gsum dang / sred pa rnams @140b dang ; rga ba dang shi ba med kyang rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: Although the sentient beings of the form realm do not have the three types of feeling, the three types of contact, the three types of craving, and aging and death, they are said to possess the twelve aspects.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems can de dag gzugs med pa nas rga shi'i bar du med kyang rnam pa bcu gnyis po dang ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems can de dag gzugs med pa nas rga shi'i bar du med kyang rnam pa bcu gnyis po dang ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: Although the sentient beings of the formless realm do not have form, up to and including aging and death, they are said to possess the twelve aspects.

original: de ni nges par thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nges par thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they definitely will obtain them.

original: des na sems can kun la mnyam par rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba cu gnyis dang ldan pa yod pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na sems can kun la mnyam par rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba cu gnyis dang ldan pa yod pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said that all sentient beings are equal in possessing the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi khams sbam gtan bzhi la so so'i skye bo'i sas bsdus pa la tshor ba btang snyoms las ma gtogs pa rnams bzhi ka med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi khams sbam gtan bzhi la so so'i skye bo'i sas bsdus pa la tshor ba btang snyoms las ma gtogs pa rnams bzhi ka med mod kyi /
translated: Here, in the four absorptions of the form realm, there are no four feelings except for the feeling of equanimity, which is included in the level of ordinary beings.

original: btang snyoms nyid dang gsal ba dang / gnyen po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas yid bde ba nyid du chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: btang snyoms nyid dang gsal ba dang / gnyen po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas yid bde ba nyid du chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: However, the Compendium of Dharma S≈´tra says that equanimity itself is clear and possesses the qualities of being an antidote and so on, and therefore it is mental satisfaction.

original: btang snyoms dang yid bde ba las ma gtogs pa tshor ba gsum dang / kham gyi zas dang bral bas lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus to reg pa dang / rnam par shes pa de nyid kyi rjes su byung ba de dag gi yul la mngon par zhen pa'i yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang yid bde ba las ma gtogs pa tshor ba gsum dang / kham gyi zas dang bral bas lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus to reg pa dang / rnam par shes pa de nyid kyi rjes su byung ba de dag gi yul la mngon par zhen pa'i yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ste /
translated: The three feelings except for equanimity and mental satisfaction, the contact of the tongue sense base, the contact of the nose sense base, and the contact of the mental sense base that is the attachment to the objects of those consciousnesses arise in dependence on the form realm.

original: reg pa gsum dang / 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / khams 'og mas bsdus pa'i rgas pa dang de dang 'brel ba'i shi ba de lta bu med ces pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa gsum dang / 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / khams 'og mas bsdus pa'i rgas pa dang de dang 'brel ba'i shi ba de lta bu med ces pa'o //
translated: The three contacts, craving for desire realm objects and aging included in the lower realms and death related to those do not exist.

original: 'di rnams kyang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na med cing shas chung ba tsam la dgongs pa yin gyi /üîΩrnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na med cing shas chung ba tsam la dgongs pa yin gyi / rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: These are not asserted to exist in the context of meditative equipoise, but they are asserted to exist in a weak form.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la dbang bsgyur du med pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba yin zhes mdo gzhan las gsungs pa dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang sa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin la dbang mi byed pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la dbang bsgyur du med pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba yin zhes mdo gzhan las gsungs pa dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang sa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin la dbang mi byed pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: They do not exist in every way because, as previously explained, it is said in other s≈´tras that they are also afflicted by the suffering of not being able to control the qualities of a tathƒÅgata and so on and that formless realm beings are afflicted by the suffering of not being able to control the samƒÅdhis of all levels.

original: dam pa'i chos mi thob pa'i sdug bsngal kyis sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mi thob pa'i sdug bsngal kyis sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said that they are afflicted by the suffering of not obtaining the excellent Dharma and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de 'dra ba'i yon tan thob par 'dod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa'i sred pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir na med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de 'dra ba'i yon tan thob par 'dod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa'i sred pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir na med ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, why would there be no desire to obtain such qualities and craving attachment to the taste of concentration?

original: gzhan yang mdo 'di'i don ni rdzas su grub pa'i gzugs sems las tha dad pa ni gang na yang med la @141a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo 'di'i don ni rdzas su grub pa'i gzugs sems las tha dad pa ni gang na yang med la @141a * //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of this sutra is that there is no material form established as a substance that is different from mind.

original: gzugs su snang ba tsam gyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba tsam gyi dbang du byas na /
translated: From the perspective of the mere appearance of form,

original: gzugs med pa rnams la yang shin tu phra ba'i gzugs su snang ba cung zad yod pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la yang shin tu phra ba'i gzugs su snang ba cung zad yod pa ste /
translated: even in the formless realm, there is a slight appearance of extremely subtle form.

original: phra ba'i phyir med ces bstan par zad do //
analyzed: phra ba'i phyir med ces bstan par zad do //
translated: It is merely taught that it does not exist because it is subtle.

original: des na der skyes pa'i sems can rnams la yang spyir ming dang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yod cing /
analyzed: des na der skyes pa'i sems can rnams la yang spyir ming dang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad yod cing /
translated: Therefore, in general, all names and forms and so on exist for sentient beings born there.

original: phung po yongs su smin pa'i rgas pa dang / shi ba yang yod de /
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa'i rgas pa dang / shi ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also aging and death that fully ripen the aggregates,

original: de rnams 'chi 'pho'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'chi 'pho'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that they are tormented by the suffering of death and transmigration.

original: yang sngar rgas pa dang shi ba med par bstan pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'phags pa'i gnas gzhan po rnams la rnam par chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa med pa la dgongs te yang gsungs pa'o //üîΩ'dir lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: yang sngar rgas pa dang shi ba med par bstan pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'phags pa'i gnas gzhan po rnams la rnam par chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa med pa la dgongs te yang gsungs pa'o // 'dir lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur pa'am /
translated: Again, the previous statement that there is no aging or death is stated from the perspective of the other ƒÅrya abodes of the fourth absorption, where there is no death or transmigration.üîΩHere, karma to be experienced in other lives

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: or karma to be experienced in this life is not taken as the basis.

original: tshe gsum la rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe gsum la rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The presentation of the completion of the life span in three lives and so on is not made.

original: 'on kyang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pas skyon med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pas skyon med do //
translated: However, since it is taught from the perspective of karma to be experienced after rebirth and so on, there is no error.

original: de ltar sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa la sogs pa spros pa dang bcas te bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa la sogs pa spros pa dang bcas te bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the elaborations of the dependence on the prior limit and so on,

original: mdor na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung zhes pa'i don de rnams kyang sdug bsngal gsum gyis bsdus par ston te /
analyzed: mdor na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung zhes pa'i don de rnams kyang sdug bsngal gsum gyis bsdus par ston te /
translated: the meaning of the statement the mere mass of suffering arises is taught to be subsumed by the three sufferings.

original: de la ma rig pa nas skye mched drug gi bar ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa nas skye mched drug gi bar ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: From ignorance up to the six sense spheres are the suffering of the formative forces.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid du gsungs te /
translated: Contact and feeling are said to be the suffering of suffering.

original: de'i don yang srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams byis pa rnams 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i don du gtso bor ngan song gi phung po dang 'brel pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang srid pa'i yan lag 'di rnams byis pa rnams 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i don du gtso bor ngan song gi phung po dang 'brel pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that these limbs of existence are taught primarily in order to generate disgust for cyclic existence in the naive, and they are related to the mass of lower rebirths.

original: des na de dag gi reg pa dang tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid shas che bas de ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des na de dag gi reg pa dang tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid shas che bas de ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, contact and feeling are taught to be the suffering of suffering because they are the most obvious suffering.

original: gzhan du na mtho ris kyi phung po mngon par 'grub pa'i las kun nas slong ba ni ma rig pa nyid yin pa'i nges pa med /
analyzed: gzhan du na mtho ris kyi phung po mngon par 'grub pa'i las kun nas slong ba ni ma rig pa nyid yin pa'i nges pa med /
translated: Otherwise, there is no certainty that ignorance alone motivates the karma that establishes the mass of higher rebirth.

original: dad pa dang las dang 'bras bu'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i shes rab kyis kyang /
analyzed: dad pa dang las dang 'bras bu'i bye brag ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i shes rab kyis kyang /
translated: Wisdom that is knowledge of the specific characteristics of faith and karma and its results

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge ba kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: motivates virtuous contaminated karma.

original: sred pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: The remaining members such as craving are the suffering of change.

original: cung @141b zad bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas so //
analyzed: cung @141b zad bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas so //
translated: They are associated with a slight pleasure.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung zhes pa ni 'bras bu phyi ma mngon bar 'grub pa la ji skad bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung zhes pa ni 'bras bu phyi ma mngon bar 'grub pa la ji skad bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising from causes and conditions‚Äù means that the future result is produced from the collection of causes and conditions as has been explained.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa la sogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa la sogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: It does not arise from the cause of the store consciousness and the condition of craving alone.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa ni yan lag de rnams sngar nas yod pa'i don rgyu dang rkyen gyis gsal bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa ni yan lag de rnams sngar nas yod pa'i don rgyu dang rkyen gyis gsal bar byas pa'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconnected with birth and destruction‚Äù means that those members are not like an object that existed previously and is made manifest by causes and conditions,

original: phyis kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: or like something that will not perish later.

original: rkyen gyis glo bur du skyed cing /
analyzed: rkyen gyis glo bur du skyed cing /
translated: They are suddenly produced by conditions and

original: yang ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa la sogs pa lugs las ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa la sogs pa lugs las ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: they are connected with the cessation of the forward order of dependent origination, as in the statement ‚ÄúThrough the cessation of ignorance, the karmic forces cease,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pas zag par so sor rtog / ces pa ni dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes thob ba la sogs pa rnams la de dag med pa'o //
analyzed: med pas zag par so sor rtog / ces pa ni dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes thob ba la sogs pa rnams la de dag med pa'o //
translated: This means that arhats and pratyekabuddhas obtain the knowledge of elimination and nonarising, etc., and they do not exist for them.

original: yang de rnams la yang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i rten 'brel ni yod pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: yang de rnams la yang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i rten 'brel ni yod pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: However, it is said that the dependent origination of purification, such as the condition of the level of the latent afflictions of ignorance, exists for them.

original: gal te 'dir sred pa'i yan lag 'di rnams su grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan sngar bstan pa ltar mi 'thad na de las gzhan du rnam par 'jog dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir sred pa'i yan lag 'di rnams su grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan sngar bstan pa ltar mi 'thad na de las gzhan du rnam par 'jog dgos so zhe na /
translated: If the reason for the definite enumeration of these links of craving is not tenable as explained above, then they must be posited in another way.

original: bden te / 'dir ni 'khor gdul bya nye ba'i bsam pa nyid la ltos nas de dag tsam bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: bden te / 'dir ni 'khor gdul bya nye ba'i bsam pa nyid la ltos nas de dag tsam bstan par zad kyi /
translated: That is true, but here they are taught to be just that in dependence on the attitude of the retinue to be guided.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see any other reason.üîΩAgain, the treatise on Abhidharma states:

original: yang chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las khams gsum du skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i tshul rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las khams gsum du skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i tshul rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine ways of actualizing birth in the three realms.

original: khams gsum nas 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i tshul gsum dang ; gzugs khams su skye ba gsum dang / gzugs med par skye ba gsum ste /
analyzed: khams gsum nas 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i tshul gsum dang ; gzugs khams su skye ba gsum dang / gzugs med par skye ba gsum ste /
translated: There are three ways of transferring from the three realms and taking birth in the desire realm, three ways of taking birth in the form realm and three ways of taking birth in the formless realm.

original: de ltar rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Thus there are nine types.

original: de la ma rig pa ma gtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan thams cad ni gang du skye bar 'gyur ba'i khams sam sa der gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ma gtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan thams cad ni gang du skye bar 'gyur ba'i khams sam sa der gtogs pa yin la /
translated: All the branches except ignorance belong to the realm or level where one will be born.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang du byas na 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba gsum ma gtogs pa gzhan ni sa mi mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang du byas na 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba gsum ma gtogs pa gzhan ni sa mi mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: But if ignorance is considered, then except for the three ways of taking birth in the desire realm, the others are not the same level.

original: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba'i khams dang sa der mi gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba'i khams dang sa der mi gtogs pa'o //
translated: They do not belong to the realm or level where one will be born.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams nas 'phos nas bsam gtan dang po'i lhar skyes pa na /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams nas 'phos nas bsam gtan dang po'i lhar skyes pa na /
translated: Thus, when one transfers from the desire realm and is born as a god of the first absorption,

original: de 'dra ba'i lus 'grub par byed pa'i las ni 'dod pa'i @142a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lus 'grub par byed pa'i las ni 'dod pa'i @142a * //
translated: the karma that establishes such a body is karma of the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam gsum pa yin la /
translated: The third uninterrupted path that abandons attachment to the desire realm is the path of the first absorption.

original: de kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sas bsdus pa ma yin te khams 'og ma 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni de'i rgyu las gong ma'i nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu skye ba mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sas bsdus pa ma yin te khams 'og ma 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni de'i rgyu las gong ma'i nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu skye ba mi 'thad la /
translated: Ignorance that motivates that karma is not subsumed by the first absorption level, because it is untenable that those not free from attachment to the desire realm level generate manifest afflictions of higher levels, since they are the cause of that level.

original: bral na yang de spong ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam sngon du song bas de'i rjes su byung ba bsam gtan dang po'i sas bsdus pa'i ma rig pas sngar gyi las kun nas slong ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bral na yang de spong ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam sngon du song bas de'i rjes su byung ba bsam gtan dang po'i sas bsdus pa'i ma rig pas sngar gyi las kun nas slong ba mi 'thad de /
translated: If they are free from attachment, then it is untenable that ignorance subsumed by the first absorption level that occurs after the prior uninterrupted path that abandons that level motivates that karma,

original: ma 'ongs pa rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be the cause of the future.

original: des na las de 'dra ba kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams de nyid du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na las de 'dra ba kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams de nyid du gtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore the ignorance that motivates such karma belongs to the desire realm itself.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong nas gong du skye bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyi tshul yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong nas gong du skye bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyi tshul yang shes par bya'o //
translated: So too, the mode of all higher rebirth up to the summit of existence should be understood.

original: yang rang gi sar skye bas te /
analyzed: yang rang gi sar skye bas te /
translated: Also, one is born in one‚Äôs own level.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas 'phos nas dang po pa nyid du skye ba'i las ni sngar 'dod pa'i khams mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa de nyid la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas 'phos nas dang po pa nyid du skye ba'i las ni sngar 'dod pa'i khams mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa de nyid la /
translated: Karma that projects birth in the first absorption from the first absorption is the uninterrupted path that abandons attachment to the desire realm.

original: las gcig gis lus du ma 'grub par byed pa'i las zhi rags kyi rnam par bsgom pa /üîΩ'dod pa'i 'dod chags spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam nyid yin la /
analyzed: las gcig gis lus du ma 'grub par byed pa'i las zhi rags kyi rnam par bsgom pa / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam nyid yin la /
translated: It is the karma that establishes many bodies through a single karma and it is the meditation on the aspects of coarseness and calmness.

original: de kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa yang 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa yin gyi /üîΩphyis byung ba bsam gtan gyi sar gtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa yang 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa yin gyi / phyis byung ba bsam gtan gyi sar gtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The ignorance that motivates that karma belongs to the desire realm.

original: ma 'ongs ba rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dir de 'dra ba'i las med par bsam gtan dang po nas 'phos nas yang dang po'i lhar skye ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs ba rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // 'dir de 'dra ba'i las med par bsam gtan dang po nas 'phos nas yang dang po'i lhar skye ba mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not the ignorance of the higher realms because it would then be the cause of the future.

original: de la zhi rags kyi rnam ba bsgom pa med bar ni der skye ba mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de la zhi rags kyi rnam ba bsgom pa med bar ni der skye ba mi 'thad la /
translated: If such karma does not exist, it is untenable that one who transmigrates from the first absorption is born as a god of the first absorption because it is untenable that one is born there without meditating on the aspects of coarseness and calmness.

original: de ltar bsgom pa yang gnas skabs der mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa yang gnas skabs der mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that one meditates on those aspects at that time.

original: 'dod ba'i khams la rags pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la zhi bar bsgom pa ni mi dgos te /
analyzed: 'dod ba'i khams la rags pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la zhi bar bsgom pa ni mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to cultivate the desire realm as gross and the first absorption as peaceful,

original: sngon de ltar bsgoms pas bsam gtan dang po nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon de ltar bsgoms pas bsam gtan dang po nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has already obtained the first absorption through previously cultivating it in that way.

original: dang po de nyid la zhi rags kyi rnam par bsgom pa ni 'gal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dang po de nyid la zhi rags kyi rnam par bsgom pa ni 'gal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Cultivating the first absorption itself as gross and peaceful would be contradictory.üîΩAnd it is not tenable that one is born as a god of the first absorption through cultivating the desire realm as gross and the second absorption and above as peaceful.

original: de la rags pa dang gnyis pa yan chod la zhi bar bsgoms pas ni bsam gtan dang po'i lhar skye ba mi 'thad pas snga ma ltar 'dod pa'i khams la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la rags pa dang gnyis pa yan chod la zhi bar bsgoms pas ni bsam gtan dang po'i lhar skye ba mi 'thad pas snga ma ltar 'dod pa'i khams la brten pa'o //
translated: Thus it is as before, based on the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi rang gi sar skye ba thams cad @142b kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi rang gi sar skye ba thams cad @142b kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: So too, all births in one‚Äôs own level up to the summit of existence should be viewed in the same way.

original: gzhan yang 'og mar skye ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'og mar skye ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Moreover, from the perspective of birth in lower levels,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas 'phos nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas 'phos nas /
translated: one who has transmigrated from the second absorptionüîΩand is born as a god of the first absorption has karma that establishes a body

original: dang po'i lhar skye ba na de 'dra ba'i lus 'grub pa'i las ni /
analyzed: dang po'i lhar skye ba na de 'dra ba'i lus 'grub pa'i las ni /
translated: like that.

original: sngar gyi dus mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la brten nas zhi rags kyi rnam par bsgom pa'i las rnying ba de nyid yin pas de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa yang sa de nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi dus mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la brten nas zhi rags kyi rnam par bsgom pa'i las rnying ba de nyid yin pas de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa yang sa de nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The ignorance that motivates that karma is also included in that level, since it is the old karma of meditating on coarseness and calmness in dependence on the level of not being equipoise.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'og mar skye ba'i tshul thams cad blta bar bya'o zhes 'chad pa ni shin du mi 'thad de /üîΩspyir bde 'gro'i rigs de dag du skye ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i las sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'og mar skye ba'i tshul thams cad blta bar bya'o zhes 'chad pa ni shin du mi 'thad de / spyir bde 'gro'i rigs de dag du skye ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i las sam /
translated: It is utterly untenable to explain that all the ways of taking birth in lower realms from the summit of existence to the first absorption should be viewed in this way.

original: khyad par du mi g-yo ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa ni ma rig pa nyid yin par ma nges te /
analyzed: khyad par du mi g-yo ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa ni ma rig pa nyid yin par ma nges te /
translated: In general, the contaminated virtuous karma that takes birth in those types of happy rebirths is not definitely motivated by ignorance,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar shes rab dang dad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas kyang kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar shes rab dang dad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas kyang kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: since, as previously explained, it is also motivated by wisdom, faith and so on.

original: gal te ma rig pas slong ba de ltar yang bsam gtan dang po'i lus su 'grub pa'i las ni rgyu snyoms 'jug gi bsam gtan te /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pas slong ba de ltar yang bsam gtan dang po'i lus su 'grub pa'i las ni rgyu snyoms 'jug gi bsam gtan te /
translated: If it is said that the action that establishes the body in the first absorption is the cause, then it is the meditative stabilization of meditative equipoise.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba'i las de nyid yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba'i las de nyid yin la /
translated: That very action of the first absorption‚Äôs concentration is unwavering.

original: de yang dus kyi mthar gyur pa'i skad cig gnyis dang gsum la sogs par gnas pa tsam la ni /
analyzed: de yang dus kyi mthar gyur pa'i skad cig gnyis dang gsum la sogs par gnas pa tsam la ni /
translated: However, mere abiding for two or three moments at the end of time

original: bsam gtan nyid du tha snyad gdags par bya ba'i don med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan nyid du tha snyad gdags par bya ba'i don med do //
translated: is not the meaning that is to be designated as meditative stabilization.

original: de'i ngo bo ni sems rtse gcig par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni sems rtse gcig par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because its nature is the mind abiding one pointedly.

original: gzhan du na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyang bsam gtan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyang bsam gtan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, even the mind of meditative equipoise would be meditative stabilization,

original: skad cig gnyis dang gsum la sogs par dmigs pa la rtse gcig pa ni de dag la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis dang gsum la sogs par dmigs pa la rtse gcig pa ni de dag la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has one pointedness of focus for two or three moments and so on.

original: de nas de 'dra ba'i bsam gtan la dus ji ltar rigs pa bzhin mnyam par bzhag nas tshe 'phos te bsam gtan dang po'i lus mngon par 'grub pa na /
analyzed: de nas de 'dra ba'i bsam gtan la dus ji ltar rigs pa bzhin mnyam par bzhag nas tshe 'phos te bsam gtan dang po'i lus mngon par 'grub pa na /
translated: Then, having meditated in this way for a suitable length of time, he dies and is reborn in the first absorption.

original: de'i sngon rol du gyur pa'i bsam gtan mi g-yo ba'i las skyed bar byed pa ni sa de nyid du gtogs pa'i ma rig pa yin pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i sngon rol du gyur pa'i bsam gtan mi g-yo ba'i las skyed bar byed pa ni sa de nyid du gtogs pa'i ma rig pa yin pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in maintaining that the ignorance belonging to that level generates the karma of the immutable absorption that precedes it.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan thob pa'i de ma thag tu tshe 'pho ba nyid du bsams nas smras pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //üîΩde bzhin du bsam gtan dang po nas 'phos nas dang por skye ba'i las ni sngon mnyam par ma bzhag @143a * //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan thob pa'i de ma thag tu tshe 'pho ba nyid du bsams nas smras pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do // de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po nas 'phos nas dang por skye ba'i las ni sngon mnyam par ma bzhag @143a * //
translated: This is merely said because it is thought that one who has attained the absorptions dies immediately after attaining them.

original: pa'i sa la las gcig gis lus su ma grub pa'i las bsags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i sa la las gcig gis lus su ma grub pa'i las bsags pa ma yin te /
translated: Karma that is accumulated in the desire realm and that projects the first absorption is not karma that is accumulated by one who has not previously attained the uncontaminated state of equipoise.

original: de ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na 'gags nas mad pas rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na 'gags nas mad pas rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the effect is born, it has already ceased and is nonexistent, it is not tenable that it is a cause.

original: gzhan du na 'das pa zhig pa rnams rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'das pa zhig pa rnams rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: Otherwise, past states that have disintegrated would be causes.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sgrub pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sgrub pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the foundation consciousness is untenable.

original: 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu gsungs pa yang rgyu'i rgyu yin pas rgyur btags su zad kyi rgyu'i dngos ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang dus gzhan gyis bar chod pa de rnams la 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu gsungs pa yang rgyu'i rgyu yin pas rgyur btags su zad kyi rgyu'i dngos ni ma yin no // gzhan yang dus gzhan gyis bar chod pa de rnams la 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: The statement that it is the projecting cause is merely a designation of cause, not the actual cause.üîΩMoreover, the meaning of dependent origination, ‚ÄúThis existing, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don mi 'thad do //
translated: from the arising of this, that arises,‚Äù is untenable for those interrupted by other times.

original: 'di zhes pa ni nye ba mngon sum pa'i tshig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni nye ba mngon sum pa'i tshig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a word for what is near and directly perceived.

original: des na de 'dra ba'i don la de 'gags nas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de 'dra ba'i don la de 'gags nas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in such a case, it would be merely ‚ÄúWhen this ceases, that arises.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po las ma nyams bar tshe 'phos nas dang por skye ba'i las ni bsam gtan gyi sa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po las ma nyams bar tshe 'phos nas dang por skye ba'i las ni bsam gtan gyi sa de nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, when one who has not degenerated from the first absorption dies and is reborn in the first absorption, the level of absorption is the same.

original: las ma zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: las ma zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the karma is not exhausted.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams su mir skye ba'i bsod nams kyi las ma zad par tshe zad nas de nas 'phos te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams su mir skye ba'i bsod nams kyi las ma zad par tshe zad nas de nas 'phos te /
translated: Just as when merit that produces birth as a human in the desire realm is not exhausted, life ends and then one is reborn in the desire realm.

original: mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ni sngar gyi las de nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ni sngar gyi las de nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The karma that produces birth as a human is the very same karma as before.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan gyis de nyid la brten nas khams 'og ma la rags par bsgom pa dang de nyid la zhi bar bsgom pa la yang gnod pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan gyis de nyid la brten nas khams 'og ma la rags par bsgom pa dang de nyid la zhi bar bsgom pa la yang gnod pa med de /
translated: Moreover, it is not undermined to cultivate the lower realm as coarse in dependence on the absorptions and to cultivate the lower realm as peaceful.

original: de las nyams nas khams 'og mar skye ba srid pas de ltar 'gyur du dgos pa'i phyir de ltar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de las nyams nas khams 'og mar skye ba srid pas de ltar 'gyur du dgos pa'i phyir de ltar bsgom pa'o //
translated: This is because it is necessary that it be cultivated in that way since it is possible that one will degenerate from that and be born in the lower realm.

original: yang bsam gtan gnyis pa nas dang por skye ba na /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan gnyis pa nas dang por skye ba na /
translated: Also, when one is born in the first absorption from the second absorption,

original: de'i lus 'grub par byed pa sngon gyi las rnying pa yin zhes pa yang de bzhin du mi 'thad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lus 'grub par byed pa sngon gyi las rnying pa yin zhes pa yang de bzhin du mi 'thad par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that it is not tenable to say that the old karma that establishes the body in the first absorption is the very same karma as before.

original: gal te las 'gags pa de lta na yang des bsgos pa'i bag chags gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa kun gzhi la yod pa ma 'gags shing de ma thag pa de las de 'dra ba'i lus 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te las 'gags pa de lta na yang des bsgos pa'i bag chags gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa kun gzhi la yod pa ma 'gags shing de ma thag pa de las de 'dra ba'i lus 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that although the action has ceased, the latent potentialities that have been infused by it, which are transmitted from one [life] to the next, exist in the foundation consciousness, and that the body is produced from that which has not ceased and is immediately antecedent to it,

original: de lta na de kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa yang sngon gyi gnas skabs su mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta na de kun nas slong ba'i ma rig pa yang sngon gyi gnas skabs su mi 'thad de /
translated: then the ignorance that motivates that [body] is also untenable in the prior state.

original: don go bar zad do //
analyzed: don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is understood.

original: de dag ni khyad par med pa las byis pa rnams kyis brtags zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi chos de dag kun rdzob tu sems su gcig cing don dam par stong @143b pa nyid du khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni khyad par med pa las byis pa rnams kyis brtags zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi chos de dag kun rdzob tu sems su gcig cing don dam par stong @143b pa nyid du khyad par med pa'o //
translated: As for the statement that childish beings imagine them without differentiation, all outer and inner phenomena are the same in being mind on the relative level, and they are not differentiated in being emptiness on the ultimate level.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i spyi'i dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i spyi'i dbye ba ston te /
translated: The general classification of dependent origination is taught by the lines beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, there are two kinds of dependent origination.‚Äù

original: de dag las byung ba'i rgyu ni sngar bstan pa ltar myu gu dang bum pa la sogs pa phyi'i chos dang / 'du byed la sogs pa nang gi chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo skyed pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu'i bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i rgyu ni sngar bstan pa ltar myu gu dang bum pa la sogs pa phyi'i chos dang / 'du byed la sogs pa nang gi chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo skyed pa'i phyir / rgyu'i bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: The cause that arises from them is the performance of the function of cause, because it generates the entities of external phenomena such as sprouts and pots and internal phenomena such as formations, as previously explained.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sngar bstan pa rnams las rgyu'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sngar bstan pa rnams las rgyu'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: The causal condition is that which is included in the category of cause among the previously explained dependently arisen ones.

original: 'bras bu yang de nyid kyi shugs la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de nyid kyi shugs la bstan pa'o //
translated: The effect is also indicated by implication in that.

original: 'brel ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi phung po la sogs pa dang / sa bon la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi phung po la sogs pa dang / sa bon la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: The related cause is the performance of the function of objective referent, because it is the appearance of the outer and inner aggregates and so on and the appearance of seeds and so on.

original: shes pa yul gyi rnam par snang ba'i rgyu'i rkyen la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa yul gyi rnam par snang ba'i rgyu'i rkyen la sogs pa'o //
translated: The causal condition of the appearance of the aspect of the object in consciousness and so on.

original: 'dir dmigs pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gyi don ji ltar yin pa ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'dir dmigs pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gyi don ji ltar yin pa ni sngar bstan no //
translated: Here, the meaning of objective condition and dominant condition has been previously explained.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni mtshan nyid grub pa'i de ma thag tu mtshon bya'i tha snyad rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni mtshan nyid grub pa'i de ma thag tu mtshon bya'i tha snyad rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The characteristic cause is the connection with the characteristic that immediately establishes the characteristic and then posits the term of the characterized object.

original: de yang mtshan nyid rtags su bkod pa las mtshon bya'i tha snyad rnams par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid rtags su bkod pa las mtshon bya'i tha snyad rnams par 'jog pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the term of the characterized object is posited from the sign of the characteristic.

original: tsha zhing sreg pa'i phyir 'di ni mer tha snyad du byar rung ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tsha zhing sreg pa'i phyir 'di ni mer tha snyad du byar rung ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is suitable to designate this as fire because it is hot and burning.üîΩThe active cause is the activity of the sense faculties, like the universal monarch.

original: byed pa'i rgyu ni dbang bar gtogs pa'i bya ba byed pa ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang ldan pa'i skyes bus rang dbang thob pa'i yul la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin byed pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ni dbang bar gtogs pa'i bya ba byed pa ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang ldan pa'i skyes bus rang dbang thob pa'i yul la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin byed pa ste /
translated: This is the activity of a sentient being who has obtained independence in a country as he wishes.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yul khams la dbang bsgyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yul khams la dbang bsgyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the universal monarch who rules the country.

original: snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa'am brtag par bya ba'i dngos po skyes zin pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba'i bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa'am brtag par bya ba'i dngos po skyes zin pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba'i bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: The cause of illumination is the activity of the illumination of the characteristics of the already arisen object of investigation or of discursive thought.

original: gtan tshigs dang lus ngag gi brda dang / mar me la sogs pa'i snang bas don gsal bar byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang lus ngag gi brda dang / mar me la sogs pa'i snang bas don gsal bar byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the illumination of an object by a reason, the bodily and verbal signs, or the illumination of a lamp, and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa'i snang zhing dmigs pa ni blo'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i snang zhing dmigs pa ni blo'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: The illumination and the object of illumination that were previously taught are of the nature of the mind.

original: 'dir snang ba 'am gsal ba ni yul gyi chos su zhen par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir snang ba 'am gsal ba ni yul gyi chos su zhen par byas pa'o //
translated: Here, illumination or clarity is conceived to be a quality of the object.

original: ltos pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa'i khyad par skyed pa lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal bas bsdus pa ste ji ltar gnyen pos lam gyi spang bya'i chos spangs nas de dag ldog pa'i dus na gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa'i khyad par skyed pa lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal bas bsdus pa ste ji ltar gnyen pos lam gyi spang bya'i chos spangs nas de dag ldog pa'i dus na gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The cause of dependence is subsumed by the incompatible and the special generation, the contradiction of nonsimultaneous abiding, just as the antidote eliminates the phenomena to be eliminated by the path and when they are eliminated, the antidote, the nonconceptual wisdom, arises.

original: shes pa'i rgyun gyi bya ba mi 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyun gyi bya ba mi 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes the activity of the continuum of consciousness to be uninterrupted.

original: gzhan yang spyir @144a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang spyir @144a * //
translated: Moreover, in general,

original: 'dus byas kyi rgyun gyi bya ba mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rgyun gyi bya ba mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: The activity of the continuum of conditioned phenomena is uninterrupted.

original: rigs mthun pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig 'gags kyang de'i yul du de dag nyid kyis skyed pa'i rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po gzhan dang gzhan skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig 'gags kyang de'i yul du de dag nyid kyis skyed pa'i rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po gzhan dang gzhan skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though some things of a similar type cease, the things of a different type that are generated by them arise continuously in their place.

original: 'dir slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis ;
