analyzed: 'dir slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis ;
translated: Here, the master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra explains:

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams skyed pa'i sngon gyi las yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams skyed pa'i sngon gyi las yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: The cause of arising is the prior karma that generates outer and inner phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bu yin gyi /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThese are all dependent‚Äù and so on teaches that these are all dependent, illusionlike,

original: don dam pa'i dngos por gzhag pa ni byis pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos por gzhag pa ni byis pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa nyid du ston te /
translated: and that positing them as ultimate things is the childish imagination.

original: 'dir dus mnyam pa la rgyu 'bras kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad par yang sngar bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir dus mnyam pa la rgyu 'bras kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad par yang sngar bstan la /
translated: Here it has been taught that the characteristics of cause and effect are untenable in the context of simultaneity.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis 'byung ba yang mi 'thad par bstan cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis 'byung ba yang mi 'thad par bstan cing /
translated: Similarly, it has been taught that they are also untenable in the context of sequential arising.

original: gzhan yang rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyogs la rgyur tha snyad gdags pa'i don ni 'bras bu la ltos nas 'jog pa las 'bras bu ma skyes ba'i dus na ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu'i tha snyad kyi don mi 'thad pas 'bras bu nyid kyang gang las 'byung zhes
analyzed: gzhan yang rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyogs la rgyur tha snyad gdags pa'i don ni 'bras bu la ltos nas 'jog pa las 'bras bu ma skyes ba'i dus na ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu'i tha snyad kyi don mi 'thad pas 'bras bu nyid kyang gang las 'byung zhes
translated: Moreover, with respect to the position that effects arise sequentially, the meaning of the term cause is posited in reliance on the effect. But since at the time the effect has not yet arisen, it is not tenable that the cause has the meaning of the term cause in the absence of reliance on the effect. Therefore, what is the effect that arises from the cause?

original: pa'o // de yang ji ltar bu ma skyes par pha'i tha snyad kyi don mi 'thad la /
analyzed: pa'o // de yang ji ltar bu ma skyes par pha'i tha snyad kyi don mi 'thad la /
translated: Just as it is not tenable that the meaning of the term father is a son who has not yet arisen,

original: de ma grub na bu nyid kyang 'byung ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ma grub na bu nyid kyang 'byung ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: if that son is not established, it is untenable that the son arises.

original: des na rgyu 'bras kyi tshul 'di ni rtog gi ba rnams kyis brtags pa ste /
analyzed: des na rgyu 'bras kyi tshul 'di ni rtog gi ba rnams kyis brtags pa ste /
translated: Therefore this way of positing cause and effect is a mere imputation by conceptual thought.

original: de kho na nyid du ma grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ma grub ces pa'o //
translated: It is not established in reality.

original: gal te chos mngon pa'i mdo las rkyen bzhis rnam par shes pa skyed par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos mngon pa'i mdo las rkyen bzhis rnam par shes pa skyed par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But didn‚Äôt the Abhidharma say that consciousness arises due to four conditions?

original: de ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la dgongs nas dmigs pa can gyi skye bo rnams skrag pa spang ba'i don du gsungs kyi ;
analyzed: de ni sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la dgongs nas dmigs pa can gyi skye bo rnams skrag pa spang ba'i don du gsungs kyi ;
translated: This is stated with the intention of the illusionlike dependent nature, in order to eliminate the fear of those who possess reference points.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not in the ultimate sense.

original: de dag las gsungs pa'i don yang rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i rigs mthun pa'i sa bon du gyur ba 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag las gsungs pa'i don yang rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i rigs mthun pa'i sa bon du gyur ba 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: The causal condition is the seed of the type of consciousness that produces the nature of the effect.üîΩThe objective condition is the aspect that appears to consciousness and the aspect that produces it.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni rang snang ba'i yan lag dang / skyed bar byed pa'i yan lag gnyis dang ldan pa shes pa'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o 'dir mtshan nyid ni shes pa'i rnam par 'jog pa'o zhes byed pas nye bar mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid du sbyar kyang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni rang snang ba'i yan lag dang / skyed bar byed pa'i yan lag gnyis dang ldan pa shes pa'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o 'dir mtshan nyid ni shes pa'i rnam par 'jog pa'o zhes byed pas nye bar mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid du sbyar kyang 'gal ba med de /
translated: Here, although the definition is stated as ‚Äúthe aspect that is posited as consciousness,‚Äù there is no contradiction in applying the definition to what is illustrated by the definiendum.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las de ltar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las de ltar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is taught in the treatises on reasoning in this way.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo shes @144b par 'dug pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis char rgyud gcig gis bsdus shing bar du ma chod pa dang / snga ma 'gags pas go phyi nas phyi ma skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo shes @144b par 'dug pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis char rgyud gcig gis bsdus shing bar du ma chod pa dang / snga ma 'gags pas go phyi nas phyi ma skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: both cause and effect are included in one continuum, they are not interrupted, and the former ceases and gives rise to the latter.

original: de nas de'i las kyang go 'byed pa dang / rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyed pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i las kyang go 'byed pa dang / rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyed pa ste /
translated: Then, its object is also given rise to and it is given rise to as the nature of realization.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par shes pas mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par shes pas mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In the treatises on reasoning, it says that the consciousness that is the equivalent immediately preceding condition gives rise to the eye consciousness as the nature of realization and so on.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni rkyen gsum las gzhan du gyur pa rnam shes don la 'dzin nus su skyed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni rkyen gsum las gzhan du gyur pa rnam shes don la 'dzin nus su skyed pa'o //
translated: The dominant condition is that which gives rise to the consciousness that is able to apprehend objects, other than the three conditions.

original: rim gyis 'jug bas mi skyed ces pa ni byis pa'i skye bos brtags shing gsung rab dag las bshad pa de bzhin du skye ba don dam pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug bas mi skyed ces pa ni byis pa'i skye bos brtags shing gsung rab dag las bshad pa de bzhin du skye ba don dam pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot produced by gradual engagement‚Äù means that the ultimate production, as imagined by the childish and as explained in the scriptures, is not tenable.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas shes pa'i bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i rgyu 'bras dngos po yang dag par gzhag pa yang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas shes pa'i bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i rgyu 'bras dngos po yang dag par gzhag pa yang /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, etc.‚Äù teaches that the cause and effect belonging to the nature of cognition, which is the correct establishment of things,

original: brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par mi skye la /
analyzed: brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par mi skye la /
translated: is not ultimately produced because it is merely the attachment to the imagined nature.

original: sems snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi skye ba ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob nyid du yang mi 'thad ces ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi skye ba ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob nyid du yang mi 'thad ces ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExternal production is not tenable even as the correct relative because there is no external object apart from the appearances of the mind.‚Äù

original: brtags pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'byung zhes pa ni shes par rtogs pa'i rten 'brel ni kun rdzob tsam du 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'byung zhes pa ni shes par rtogs pa'i rten 'brel ni kun rdzob tsam du 'thad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization arises due to imagination‚Äù teaches that the dependent origination of the realization of cognition is tenable as mere convention.

original: brtags pa'i rkyen rnams kho na ni skye zhing 'gags par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa ni don dam par rkyen gyis skye ba dang 'gag par gzhag pa ni brtags pa yin gyi gzhan du mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rkyen rnams kho na ni skye zhing 'gags par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa ni don dam par rkyen gyis skye ba dang 'gag par gzhag pa ni brtags pa yin gyi gzhan du mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly the imagined conditions are produced and cease.‚Äù This means that the ultimate establishment of production and cessation by conditions is imagined, and is not tenable in any other way.

original: yang skye ba 'jig rten las 'brel ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa kun rdzob pa ni bzlog bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang skye ba 'jig rten las 'brel ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa kun rdzob pa ni bzlog bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, production and cessation in the world are related, and the conventional, which is the nature of mind, is not to be refuted.

original: snga ma ltar byis pa'i rtog pas brtags pa nyid bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma ltar byis pa'i rtog pas brtags pa nyid bzlog par bya'o //
translated: As before, only the imagination by the conceptions of the childish is to be refuted.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan pa ni /üîΩbag chags rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan pa ni / bag chags rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That itself is taught extensively:üîΩThe mind itself, polluted by latent impressions,

original: bag chags kyis bslad pa'i sems nyid sna tshogs su snang gi bden pa'i dngos po grub pa med ces pa'o //üîΩrkyen rnams dang ni gang dag kyang //
analyzed: bag chags kyis bslad pa'i sems nyid sna tshogs su snang gi bden pa'i dngos po grub pa med ces pa'o // rkyen rnams dang ni gang dag kyang //
translated: appears as a variety, but there is no truly existent entity.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni rkyen gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / yul dang dus dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni rkyen gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / yul dang dus dang sbyar te /
translated: The three phrases ‚Äúconditions‚Äù and so on refer to the nature of the conditions, and are applied to the object and the time.

original: rang gi ngo bo gang yang med cing /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gang yang med cing /
translated: It has no essence at all.

original: yul gang dag dang 'brel ba yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yul gang dag dang 'brel ba yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not related to any object.

original: dus gang gi tshe yang yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //üîΩspyod pa ni snang ba dang @145a * //
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe yang yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o // spyod pa ni snang ba dang @145a * //
translated: It does not exist at any time.

original: bcas pa blo'i yul te /
analyzed: bcas pa blo'i yul te /
translated: The activity is the object of the mind with appearances.

original: blo'i ngon de ltar snang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: blo'i ngon de ltar snang zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind appears in that way.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs bas //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs bas //
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn, etc.

original: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs //
translated: How is it taught without letters?

original: zhes pa 'am //
analyzed: zhes pa 'am //
translated: Or:üîΩüîΩ

original: mngon par brjod pa gang gis skyed //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa gang gis skyed //
translated: By what expression is it generated?

original: ces dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: ces dris pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to these questions,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i khyad par snang bar byed pa'i rgyu'i bye brag tshig dang / tshig gis brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ston te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i khyad par snang bar byed pa'i rgyu'i bye brag tshig dang / tshig gis brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ston te /
translated: the particular cause that illuminates the particular dependent origination is taught as the nature of what is expressed by words and phrases.

original: zhu ba'i skabs su tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snying po tha dad pa'i bye brag shin tu rtogs pa gang gis zhes pa ni rjod byed kyi tshig rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhu ba'i skabs su tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snying po tha dad pa'i bye brag shin tu rtogs pa gang gis zhes pa ni rjod byed kyi tshig rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: In the passage of the request, by means of which one realizes the essence of the characteristics of the verbal discriminations that are different refers to the verbal expressions that appear to the discriminations, which are the characteristics of the discriminations.

original: de'i snying po ni rang bzhin de kho na nyid kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: de'i snying po ni rang bzhin de kho na nyid kyi bye brag ste /
translated: The essence of those is the particular intrinsic reality, thatness.

original: de lta bu rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan rnams rjod pa dang / brjod bya'i don gyis stong pa'i chos nyid khong du chud cing goms pas myur du sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de lta bu rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan rnams rjod pa dang / brjod bya'i don gyis stong pa'i chos nyid khong du chud cing goms pas myur du sangs rgyas nas /
translated: By realizing that, oneself and others will quickly become Buddhas, having understood and become accustomed to the reality that is empty of the expressions and the objects expressed.

original: gzhan la yang de 'dra ba'i chos ston par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de 'dra ba'i chos ston par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: And one will also teach that kind of Dharma to others.

original: don gnyis zhes pa ni dgag bya gnyis la ltos nas rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: don gnyis zhes pa ni dgag bya gnyis la ltos nas rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The two objects are posited in dependence on the two objects of negation.

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: tha dad pa'i bye brag ni gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bye brag ni gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The different particulars are the uncommon [phenomena].

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan ma gzugs dang sgra la sogs bar snang ba la /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan ma gzugs dang sgra la sogs bar snang ba la /
translated: The words of definition are the appearance of the characteristics of things endowed with characteristics, such as form, sound, and so on.

original: 'di nyid gzhan la bstan par bya ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa las byung ba 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhan la bstan par bya ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa las byung ba 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: From the conception that this very [appearance] should be shown to others, and so forth, [the words] arise.

original: 'di ni sgra'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sgra'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is form, this is sound, and so forth.

original: rgyu'i sgo nas mtshon te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas mtshon te bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught by indicating it through its cause.

original: rmi lam gyi tshig ni nyid kyis bslad pa'i gnas skabs na lha sbyin la sogs par snang ba la sngon gyi de nyid 'di yin no zhes myong ba mtshams sbyar nas rjes su dran pa dang / de las sad pa'i gnas skabs na de ltar rtog cing snang ba'i yul med par shes pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi tshig ni nyid kyis bslad pa'i gnas skabs na lha sbyin la sogs par snang ba la sngon gyi de nyid 'di yin no zhes myong ba mtshams sbyar nas rjes su dran pa dang / de las sad pa'i gnas skabs na de ltar rtog cing snang ba'i yul med par shes pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The words of a dream are the memory that arises from connecting with the experience of the past, thinking, This very [person] is Devadatta, and so forth, in the state of being deluded by oneself, and the cognition that arises from knowing that the appearing object does not exist in the state of waking from that [dream].

original: de ltar snang ba ni rmi lam mo zhes brjod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba ni rmi lam mo zhes brjod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words are, What appears like that is a dream.

original: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam ste sgyu ma'i dpe gzhan rnams dang / chos thams cad du snang ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam ste sgyu ma'i dpe gzhan rnams dang / chos thams cad du snang ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: This is just an illustration; the other similes of illusion and so on, and the fact that all phenomena appear like dreams,

original: dngos po med pa'i snang ba'o zhes brjod par byed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i snang ba'o zhes brjod par byed pa'i tshig go //
translated: are words that express the appearance of things that do not exist.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni sngon dgras byas pa'i las rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni sngon dgras byas pa'i las rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: Words of discursive thoughts of negative reflex actions are memories of actions done by enemies in the past.

original: gang dag gis gnod pa byas pa dang / des nye bar @145b mtshon pa su dag gis phan ba byas pa dran pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis gnod pa byas pa dang / des nye bar @145b mtshon pa su dag gis phan ba byas pa dran pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are memories of those who have harmed and helped one, and so on.

original: mdor na nyon mongs pa'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa la brten nas byung ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mdor na nyon mongs pa'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa la brten nas byung ba'i tshig ste /
translated: In brief, they are words that arise in dependence on the presence of the conditions of the afflictions.

original: tshig rtsub po 'byin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po 'byin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the uttering of harsh words and so on.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni thog ma med pa'i spros pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rang gi sa bon zhes pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni thog ma med pa'i spros pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rang gi sa bon zhes pa ste /
translated: Words of discursive thoughts without beginning are the seeds of negative reflex actions that are the habitual tendencies of beginningless attachment to various elaborations.

original: gnas ngan len de nyid rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi sa bon te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len de nyid rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi sa bon te /
translated: That very negative reflex is the seed of the various discriminations,

original: de las byung ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshig go //
translated: and the words arise from that.

original: de yang ji ltar kha ton bya ba 'don pa ltar 'phral la don spyi'i rnam par snang ba med kyang sngon goms pa'i bag chags kyis byung ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar kha ton bya ba 'don pa ltar 'phral la don spyi'i rnam par snang ba med kyang sngon goms pa'i bag chags kyis byung ba'i tshig ste /
translated: Moreover, those words arise from the habitual tendencies of former practice, even though the appearance of the meaning in a general way does not occur immediately, as when one is reciting something by rote.

original: 'di yang shes bya'i sgrib par gtogs pa'i kun nas bslong ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang shes bya'i sgrib par gtogs pa'i kun nas bslong ba'i tshig go //
translated: And those words are also the words that motivate the downfalls that are among the obscurations to omniscience.

original: sngar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni 'phral du gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang zhing zhen pa las byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni 'phral du gzugs la sogs pa'i don du snang zhing zhen pa las byung ba yin pas /
translated: The words that have the previously explained characteristics arise from the appearance and adherence to objects such as form, etc.

original: 'di dag mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: So they are not the same as those.

original: de la rmi lam gyi tshig ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i tshig yin la /
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi tshig ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i tshig yin la /
translated: Among those, the words of dreams are words that are included in the side of the antidote.

original: gzhan gsum ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gsum ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i tshig go //
translated: The other three are words that are included in the side of the counteragent.

original: de'i phyir sngar gyi tshig brgya rtsa brgyad la sogs pa yang 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar gyi tshig brgya rtsa brgyad la sogs pa yang 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the previous one hundred and eight words are included in these.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas tshig gi rgyu ni de dag tsam du 'dus pa ma yin pa rgyu gzhan dag yod pa rnams zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas tshig gi rgyu ni de dag tsam du 'dus pa ma yin pa rgyu gzhan dag yod pa rnams zhus pa'o //
translated: Then, the Blessed One, with the words beginning ‚ÄúThen, the Blessed One,‚Äù and so on, asked about the other causes that are not included in just those words.

original: tshig rnam par rig pa rtog pa zhes pa ni tshig gi rnam par rig byed snga ma ltar rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: tshig rnam par rig pa rtog pa zhes pa ni tshig gi rnam par rig byed snga ma ltar rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cognition of words is conceptual‚Äù means that the cognition of words is of the nature of conception, as before.

original: yang na rnam par rig pa ni mngon pa'i spyod yul zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na rnam par rig pa ni mngon pa'i spyod yul zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Or, ‚Äúcognition‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthe domain of manifest activity,‚Äù

original: rtog pa med pa'i shes pas yul du byas pa shes pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i shes pas yul du byas pa shes pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: and it is the cognition that has become the nature of that cognition that takes the object by a non-conceptual consciousness.

original: de yang yul lam dus gang du /
analyzed: de yang yul lam dus gang du /
translated: Moreover, in what place or time?

original: rgyu ci las /
analyzed: rgyu ci las /
translated: By what cause?

original: rnam pa ji ltar /
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar /
translated: In what aspect?

original: rkyen gang gis 'byung ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rkyen gang gis 'byung ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: By what condition does it arise? The words are applied in this way.

original: lan gyi don ni rgyu dang rkyen ni sngar bstan pa ltar don spyi'i rnam par snang ba 'am de'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / brjod par 'dod pa dang rkan dang lce la sogs pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni rgyu dang rkyen ni sngar bstan pa ltar don spyi'i rnam par snang ba 'am de'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / brjod par 'dod pa dang rkan dang lce la sogs pa'i gnas yin la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúresponse‚Äù is that the cause and conditions are as previously explained, appearing in the aspect of a generic image or having the nature of the habitual tendencies of that, and the object of expression and the place of the palate, tongue, etc.

original: yul lam dus kyang rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i yul lam dus nyid do //
analyzed: yul lam dus kyang rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i yul lam dus nyid do //
translated: The place or time is the very place or time of the assembly of the cause and conditions.

original: rnam pa ni yi ge'i go rims bkod pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni yi ge'i go rims bkod pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: The aspect is the manner of the arrangement of the order of the letters.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni don dam par stong ba'o @146a * //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni don dam par stong ba'o @146a * //
translated: Thus dependent origination is ultimately empty.

original: zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: In order to teach this meaning,

original: blo gros chen pos gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati made a request, and so on.

original: gcig pa zhig yin na ni don gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni bdag nyid la bya ba dang byed pa 'gag pas so //
analyzed: gcig pa zhig yin na ni don gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni bdag nyid la bya ba dang byed pa 'gag pas so //
translated: If it were the same, it would not clarify the meaning, because the activity and the agent would be blocked.

original: de ltar tshig dang tshig kun nas slong ba'i rnam par rtog pa don dam par de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir rang bzhin med ces pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshig dang tshig kun nas slong ba'i rnam par rtog pa don dam par de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir rang bzhin med ces pa ste /
translated: Thus, all words and the concepts that motivate them are said to be essenceless, because ultimately they cannot be said to be identical or different.

original: sngar tshig gi snying po dris pa'i len du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩyang blo gros chen pos gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang tshig gam /
analyzed: sngar tshig gi snying po dris pa'i len du sbyar bar bya'o // yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang tshig gam /
translated: This should be applied as the answer to the question about the essence of words above.üîΩAgain, MahƒÅmati said‚Ä¶

original: tshig gis bstan par bya ba'i yul don dam pa nyid 'gog pa ste ;
analyzed: tshig gis bstan par bya ba'i yul don dam pa nyid 'gog pa ste ;
translated: This is the refutation of the ultimate itself, the object that is indicated by words or by letters, from another perspective.

original: phyi rol pa gang dag gi tshig dang yi ge nyid don dam par khas len te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa gang dag gi tshig dang yi ge nyid don dam par khas len te /
translated: There are non-Buddhists who assert that words and letters themselves are ultimate.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩBrahmƒÅ, beginningless and eternal,

original: thog med dus kyi tshangs pa rtag / yang dag sgra ni yig 'bru gang //
analyzed: thog med dus kyi tshangs pa rtag / yang dag sgra ni yig 'bru gang //
translated: is the true sound, the letters.

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: And also:

original: aom zhes yi ge gcig po tshangs /üîΩgang gis brjod cing nga la ni //
analyzed: aom zhes yi ge gcig po tshangs / gang gis brjod cing nga la ni //
translated: The syllable o·πÉ is BrahmƒÅ,üîΩwho, if recited and remembered by me,

original: rjes su dran par gyur pa de ;
analyzed: rjes su dran par gyur pa de ;
translated: will,

original: / lus 'di yongs su spangs nas su //
analyzed: / lus 'di yongs su spangs nas su //
translated: after abandoning this body,

original: 'gro ba mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: One will go to the highest state.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sna tshogs thams cad sgra'i tshangs pa don dam pa mchog tu bden pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs thams cad sgra'i tshangs pa don dam pa mchog tu bden pa ste /
translated: All varieties are the supreme truth of the ultimate meaning of sound.

original: des na sgra dang don kyang gcig par 'dod do //
analyzed: des na sgra dang don kyang gcig par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, sound and meaning are asserted to be the same.

original: yang gzhan dag sgra ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par byed pa dngos po'i dbang gis zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag sgra ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par byed pa dngos po'i dbang gis zhugs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, others say that sound is engaged by the power of things, just as things are expressed.

original: des na de'i don ni don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na de'i don ni don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, its meaning is the ultimate nature of things.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang /
translated: Here, Buddhists also say:

original: aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: A is the door of all phenomena because it is unborn.

original: ra zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ra zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Ra is the door of all phenomena because it is free from dust.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ston pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / yang /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ston pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / yang /
translated: Pa is the door of all phenomena because it teaches the ultimate.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin /
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin /
translated: And also: A is the supreme of all letters, the great meaning, the sacred letter.

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: The elements are not produced.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pas de dag gam de dag gis brjod par bya ba'i don ni don dam pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pas de dag gam de dag gis brjod par bya ba'i don ni don dam pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the meaning expressed by those words is asserted to be the ultimate itself.

original: de'i phyir de dag so sor rnam par brtags shing dris nas sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag so sor rnam par brtags shing dris nas sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are refuted by being individually examined and questioned.

original: de la tshig nyid don dam pa yin te /
analyzed: de la tshig nyid don dam pa yin te /
translated: In that regard, the words themselves are the ultimate,

original: tshig gis 'phags pa'i ye shes don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gis 'phags pa'i ye shes don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: because the words are the ultimate truth, the wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba don dam pa'i rang bzhin spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du brjod pas de nyid @146b spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du rtogs shing rtogs pa'i don goms pa las /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba don dam pa'i rang bzhin spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du brjod pas de nyid @146b spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du rtogs shing rtogs pa'i don goms pa las /
translated: Since the nature of the ultimate, uncontaminated bliss, is expressed in the manner of a general category, it is realized as just that in the manner of a general category. Through cultivating the meaning that is realized,

original: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid la rim gyis 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir te ji ltar lam ni grong khyer du 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pas grong khyer nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid la rim gyis 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir te ji ltar lam ni grong khyer du 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pas grong khyer nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: it is a limb for gradually entering the ultimate thatness, because it is like a path that is a limb for entering a city, but is not the city itself.

original: spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du brjod ces pa yang rtog pa'i gzung ba la sgro btags pa nyid brjod pa la /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du brjod ces pa yang rtog pa'i gzung ba la sgro btags pa nyid brjod pa la /
translated: The phrase in the manner of a general aspect means that what is expressed is the superimposition on the apprehended object of thought.

original: snang ba dang brtags pa gcig tu zhen nas don dam pa'i rang gi mchan nyid brjod par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang brtags pa gcig tu zhen nas don dam pa'i rang gi mchan nyid brjod par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is the superimposition of the appearance and the imagined as one, and the superimposition of the expression of the ultimate's own nature.

original: tshig gis brjod pa'i bya ba yang don dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig gis brjod pa'i bya ba yang don dam pa ma yin te /
translated: The activity of verbal expression is also not ultimate,

original: tshig gi rnam par rtag pa las byung ba'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam par rtag pa las byung ba'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of the mind that arises from the conceptualization of words.

original: de'i don yang blo de 'dra ba'i yul ni brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba'i sgro btags pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i don yang blo de 'dra ba'i yul ni brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba'i sgro btags pa nyid yin la /
translated: The object of that [mind] is the superimposition that appears mixed with the expression,

original: don dam pa 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ultimate is the domain of the wisdom of the individual self-realization of the noble ones.

original: don 'di nyid kyang //
analyzed: don 'di nyid kyang //
translated: This very meaning is also taught by [the following]:

original: sgra gang zhig ni brjod pa na //
analyzed: sgra gang zhig ni brjod pa na //
translated: Whatever sound is expressed,

original: rtogs pa'i don gang yin pa de //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don gang yin pa de //
translated: that is the object of understanding.

original: de ni sgra yi brjod bya ste //
analyzed: de ni sgra yi brjod bya ste //
translated: That is the object of expression of sound.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: This is taught by [the above verse] and so forth.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni zhes pa'i tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni zhes pa'i tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization‚Äù is the conceptualization of the words.

original: gzhan yang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni skye zhig 'jig pa mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni skye zhig 'jig pa mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas don dam pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par mi byed de /
translated: Moreover, since the intrinsic identity of a sound is impermanent by nature, arising and ceasing, it does not express the ultimate intrinsic identity.

original: de ni de la brdar ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de la brdar ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a conventional symbol for that.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩsgra rnams kyis ni brdar btags ston /
analyzed: de skad du yang / sgra rnams kyis ni brdar btags ston /
translated: As it is said:üîΩSounds teach by conventional symbols.

original: de ni tha snyad ched du byas //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad ched du byas //
translated: They are made for the sake of conventions.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan to //üîΩgzhan yang rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub pas de kho na nyid du don dam pa brjod par mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan to // gzhan yang rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub pas de kho na nyid du don dam pa brjod par mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: And so on, as was previously explained.üîΩMoreover, since what arises from causes and conditions is not established as an ultimate entity, it is not tenable that the ultimate is expressed in reality.

original: gzhan yang brjod bya rjod byed kyis bsdus pa rang dang gzhan gyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir yang de 'dra ba mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod bya rjod byed kyis bsdus pa rang dang gzhan gyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir yang de 'dra ba mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since what is included in the expressed and the expresser does not have the intrinsic and extrinsic identities, such an expression is not tenable.

original: gzhan yang sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ni phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ni phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ste /
translated: Moreover, in conceptual thought that arises from words, external particularities do not appear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, words do not express the ultimate, which is a particularity.

original: yang sna tshogs sgra'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang sna tshogs sgra'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, words have a variety of natures.

original: sgra dang don gcig par gyur na /üîΩji ltar me zhes brjod pas skyes bu'i kha'i nye 'khor na gnas pas de'i don me yang de nyid na gnas pa'i phyir kha tshig pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i sgra nyan pa po'i rna ba'i dbang po'i @147a * //
analyzed: sgra dang don gcig par gyur na / ji ltar me zhes brjod pas skyes bu'i kha'i nye 'khor na gnas pas de'i don me yang de nyid na gnas pa'i phyir kha tshig pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i sgra nyan pa po'i rna ba'i dbang po'i @147a * //
translated: If words were the same as their referents,üîΩthen when one says ‚Äúfire,‚Äù since the referent of that word, fire, would be present in the vicinity of the person‚Äôs mouth, the person‚Äôs mouth would be burned.

original: nye 'khor na gnas pas kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor na gnas pas kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, since the word would be present in the vicinity of the ear faculty of the person who hears it, the same thing would happen.

original: gal te sgra ni thams cad du khyab par gnas pa brtags pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgra ni thams cad du khyab par gnas pa brtags pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you imagine that the word is present everywhere,

original: ma yin te de lta na yang phyogs thams cad sreg pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba dang / res 'ga' 'bar dmigs pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ma yin te de lta na yang phyogs thams cad sreg pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba dang / res 'ga' 'bar dmigs pa mi 'thad do //
translated: But that is not so, because the error would arise that all directions would be burned, and it is not tenable that one observes the fire sometimes.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par 'dod pa ni 'og nas 'gegs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par 'dod pa ni 'og nas 'gegs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The assertion that the meaning of the words is just as it is expressed will be refuted later.

original: snga ma ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i don ni yi ge de rnams kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa la sogs pa yin pa dang / chos kyi bdag po nyid kyis don de rnams la ltos te /
analyzed: snga ma ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i don ni yi ge de rnams kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa la sogs pa yin pa dang / chos kyi bdag po nyid kyis don de rnams la ltos te /
translated: The meaning of what the TathƒÅgata says is that the nature of those syllables is unarisen and so on, and by virtue of being the lord of Dharma, he teaches those meanings in reliance on those syllables.

original: yi ge de dag rjod byed nyid du brdar bkod pa na yang de bzhin du ston par nus pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge de dag rjod byed nyid du brdar bkod pa na yang de bzhin du ston par nus pa ste /
translated: Even when he posits those syllables as the expressers, he is able to teach in that way.

original: 'dir de ltar mtha' gcig tu nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de ltar mtha' gcig tu nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not definite that it is only that.

original: don de nyid tshig dang yi ge gzhan gyis bstan par mi nus pa dang / tshig dang yi ge de rnams kyis kyang don gzhan ston par mi nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don de nyid tshig dang yi ge gzhan gyis bstan par mi nus pa dang / tshig dang yi ge de rnams kyis kyang don gzhan ston par mi nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that he is unable to teach that meaning with other words and syllables, and it is not that those words and syllables are unable to teach other meanings.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas ji ltar brdar sbyar ba bzhin du don go bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas ji ltar brdar sbyar ba bzhin du don go bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to understand the meaning in accordance with the conventions of human desire.

original: de ltar dgongs pa'i don dang dgos pa 'ga' zhig la brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar dgongs pa'i don dang dgos pa 'ga' zhig la brten nas /
translated: Thus, based on some intended meaning and purpose,

original: tshig dang yi ge de rnams kyis don dam pa nyid du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge de rnams kyis don dam pa nyid du gsungs kyi /
translated: those words and letters are said to be the ultimate.

original: dngos su ni de dag don dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su ni de dag don dam pa ma yin te /
translated: But in reality, they are not the ultimate,

original: 'di nyid las gsungs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid las gsungs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are undermined by the valid cognition taught in this very [scripture].

original: stong pa nyid dam zhes pa ni tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam zhes pa ni tshig go //
translated: The phrase emptiness itself is a word.

original: byis pas ma mthong rnam par rgyug / ces pa ni tshig la sogs pa dngos por gzung zhing de yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po brjod pa nyid du bzung nas de las de lta bu'i dngos po tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: byis pas ma mthong rnam par rgyug / ces pa ni tshig la sogs pa dngos por gzung zhing de yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po brjod pa nyid du bzung nas de las de lta bu'i dngos po tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase the childish one who does not see wanders means that one grasps words and so forth as entities, and further, having grasped them as entities with their own characteristics, one seeks such entities from them.

original: dngos po thams cad ces pa la sogs pas ni rkang pa dang po gnyis kyi don 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces pa la sogs pas ni rkang pa dang po gnyis kyi don 'chad pa'o //
translated: The phrase all entities and so forth explains the meaning of the first two lines.

original: mi 'khor mya ngan 'da' mi bya //
analyzed: mi 'khor mya ngan 'da' mi bya //
translated: One does not cycle and does not attain nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: zhes pa ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi chos thams cad stong par rtogs pas shes pas srid pa la mi gnas pa dang / sprul pa lta bur 'gro ba rnams mthong zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi chos thams cad stong par rtogs pas shes pas srid pa la mi gnas pa dang / sprul pa lta bur 'gro ba rnams mthong zhing /
translated: This is because, by realizing that all phenomena, the expressed and the expresser, are empty, one does not abide in existence.

original: de yang sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba nyid du rtogs pas snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba nyid du rtogs pas snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: And, by realizing that beings are like illusions, one does not abide in peace due to compassion.

original: snying po ni chu shing gi snying po'o //
analyzed: snying po ni chu shing gi snying po'o //
translated: The essence is the pith of the plantain.

original: de lta na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not tenable to teach the existence of the characteristics of the aggregates and so on,

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: [the reply is] as stated in the lines beginning with ‚Äújust as . . .‚Äù

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas yang gnyis kyi mtha' brjod pa ji lta @147b ba zhes pa dang // ji ltar rtag dang chad pa yi //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas yang gnyis kyi mtha' brjod pa ji lta @147b ba zhes pa dang // ji ltar rtag dang chad pa yi //
translated: Then again, beginning with ‚ÄúThen again, the Blessed One . . . ,‚Äù the question is raised as to how the two extremes are expressed, as in the lines beginning with ‚Äúhow . . . ?‚ÄùüîΩand ‚Äúhow does the view of eternalism and nihilism

original: lta ba rab tu 'byung mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa'i dri ba tshig gis 'phangs pa /
analyzed: lta ba rab tu 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes pa'i dri ba tshig gis 'phangs pa /
translated: not arise?‚Äù

original: mtha' bzhi'i tshul dgag pa rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i tshul dgag pa rgyas par ston te /
translated: The reply is given extensively in the refutation of the four extremes.

original: rtogs pa rnam bar phye ba'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni rtogs pa nyid rnam par phye ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa rnam bar phye ba'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni rtogs pa nyid rnam par phye ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the discernment of realization is the discernment of realization itself.

original: ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i yul la mchis pa dang ma mchis pa la sogs pa'i mthar 'dzin pa spangs pa de nyid kyi phyir mu stegs can gyi rtog pa mi rgyu ba /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i yul la mchis pa dang ma mchis pa la sogs pa'i mthar 'dzin pa spangs pa de nyid kyi phyir mu stegs can gyi rtog pa mi rgyu ba /
translated: Because of just that, the extreme of existence and non-existence in the object of realization as it is is abandoned, and the conceptual thoughts of the tƒ´rthikas do not operate.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied with the noble one's own wisdom, and so on.

original: de la gcig pa dang tha dad pa ni phyi rol pa gang dag dngos po thams cad rang bzhin nas gcig la /
analyzed: de la gcig pa dang tha dad pa ni phyi rol pa gang dag dngos po thams cad rang bzhin nas gcig la /
translated: Regarding that, identity and difference are the non-Buddhists who say that all things are one in nature,

original: gnas skabs nas tha dad ces pa 'am yan lag gi rdzas ni gcig la /
analyzed: gnas skabs nas tha dad ces pa 'am yan lag gi rdzas ni gcig la /
translated: but different in terms of circumstances, or that the substance of the parts is one,üîΩbut the parts are different, and so on.

original: yan lag tha dad ces pa la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma lags pa yang lta ba de nyid la sbyar bar bya ste go bar zad do //
analyzed: yan lag tha dad ces pa la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma lags pa yang lta ba de nyid la sbyar bar bya ste go bar zad do //
translated: Because of just that, both and neither should also be applied to that view, and the meaning is understood.

original: de la sogs pa rang gi sde pa gang dag rdul phra rab dang skad cig so so ba ni gcig la /
analyzed: de la sogs pa rang gi sde pa gang dag rdul phra rab dang skad cig so so ba ni gcig la /
translated: In this regard, some of our own Buddhist schools say that the subtle particle and the moment are each one,

original: du ma 'dus pa ni tha dad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du ma 'dus pa ni tha dad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and that the aggregation of many is different.

original: mchis pa yang ma lags zhes pa'i don ni mu stegs pa'i sems tsam pa dag shes pa gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mchis pa yang ma lags zhes pa'i don ni mu stegs pa'i sems tsam pa dag shes pa gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not existent‚Äù is that the CittamƒÅtra of the tƒ´rthikas is not existent as the thing that is the duality of the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: gnyis med pa rtag pa'i dngos por med pa yang ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med pa rtag pa'i dngos por med pa yang ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and it is not nonexistent as a permanent thing that is nondual.

original: mdor na dngos po'i phyogs khas len pa thams cad la lta ba 'di rnams rjes su 'jug ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na dngos po'i phyogs khas len pa thams cad la lta ba 'di rnams rjes su 'jug ba'o //
translated: In brief, all those who assert a position of things are implicated in these views.

original: de dag thams cad mu stegs can zhes kyang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mu stegs can zhes kyang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of them will be shown below to be tƒ´rthikas.

original: yul mtha' yas pa'i mtshan nyid lhun gyis grub ces pa ni de dag ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing dbang bsgyur ba'i ye shes dang nus pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: yul mtha' yas pa'i mtshan nyid lhun gyis grub ces pa ni de dag ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing dbang bsgyur ba'i ye shes dang nus pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe defining characteristic of infinite objects is spontaneously present‚Äù means that the wisdom and power that know and control them just as they are is spontaneously present.

original: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: phan pa dang bde ba ni byams pa'i las so //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba ni byams pa'i las so //
translated: Benefit and happiness are the function of love.

original: lha dang mi rnams ni dal 'byor gyi rten phun sum tshogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams ni dal 'byor gyi rten phun sum tshogs pa yin pas /
translated: Gods and humans are the perfect support of leisure and opportunity.

original: de rnams la phan pa dang bde ba byas pa ni 'gro ba phal po che'i don du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams la phan pa dang bde ba byas pa ni 'gro ba phal po che'i don du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: So, the benefit and happiness that is done for them is for the sake of the great multitude of beings.

original: dri za'i grong khyer de ni dri za'i grong khyer med pa 'ang ma yin zhes pa de ltar snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin kun rdzob tu sems kyi ngo bor grub pa'o //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer de ni dri za'i grong khyer med pa 'ang ma yin zhes pa de ltar snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin kun rdzob tu sems kyi ngo bor grub pa'o //
translated: That city of gandharvas is not a non-existent city of gandharvas. In that way, the nature of mere appearance is established as the essence of mind in the relative.

original: grong khyer rin po che rjes su dran zhes pa ni de rnams grong khyer gyi dngos po sngar mthong ba dang 'dra bar 'dzin @148a * //
analyzed: grong khyer rin po che rjes su dran zhes pa ni de rnams grong khyer gyi dngos po sngar mthong ba dang 'dra bar 'dzin @148a * //
translated: The city of jewels is called recollection because it is like the previously seen entity of the city.

original: cing ; sngar ma mthong ba yang dngos po'i tshul du dran pa'o //
analyzed: cing ; sngar ma mthong ba yang dngos po'i tshul du dran pa'o //
translated: It is also the recollection of what was not previously seen in the manner of an entity.

original: med pa pa zhes pa ni chad par lta ba la gnas pa'o zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: med pa pa zhes pa ni chad par lta ba la gnas pa'o zhes zer ba'o //
translated: The nihilists are said to abide in the view of annihilation.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni //
translated: That is clearly explained:

original: skye ba med par smra zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med par smra zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who speak of non-arising... and so on.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni dbang po bslad pas mthong bas sems kyi ngo bor yod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni dbang po bslad pas mthong bas sems kyi ngo bor yod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Seeing and not seeing are seeing through the senses being affected.üîΩ‚Äú

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang tshad ma gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni sems tsam pa gang dag mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang tshad ma gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni sems tsam pa gang dag mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, moreover, the three valid cognitions‚Äù and so on refers to the CittamƒÅtra who posit direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture

original: don nges par byed pa'i yan lag so sor rnam par phye zhing gzhag ste /
analyzed: don nges par byed pa'i yan lag so sor rnam par phye zhing gzhag ste /
translated: as the branches that ascertain the meaning.

original: de rnams la brten nas 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i ye shes sam /
analyzed: de rnams la brten nas 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i ye shes sam /
translated: Based on those, the wisdom that is the object of individual knowledge of the ƒÅryas

original: de'i rigs sems can thams cad la yod pa'i sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i rigs sems can thams cad la yod pa'i sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa 'am /
translated: or the naturally luminous mind that exists in all sentient beings is established by reflexive awareness itself.

original: yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa tsam ni myong ba'i tshad mas grub la /
analyzed: yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa tsam ni myong ba'i tshad mas grub la /
translated: Or else, mere consciousness that is the nature of realization is established by the valid knowledge of experience.

original: de nyid gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi rang bzhin yin pa la gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pas gnyis med pa'i rang rig pa don dam pa'i dngos por yod ces slob dpon dkon mchog 'bangs kyis bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: de nyid gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi rang bzhin yin pa la gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pas gnyis med pa'i rang rig pa don dam pa'i dngos por yod ces slob dpon dkon mchog 'bangs kyis bstan pa 'am /
translated: Master RatnƒÅkara≈õƒÅnti teaches that since there is a valid cognition that refutes the existence of a nature of duality, reflexive awareness, which is nondual, exists as an ultimate entity.

original: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa ltar lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa ltar lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis /
translated: Moreover, as was previously explained, through such reasons as the ascertainment of simultaneous observation,

original: shes pa gnyis med kyi ngo bo don dam par grub pa dang / lung las kyang de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis med kyi ngo bo don dam par grub pa dang / lung las kyang de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the nature of nondual consciousness is ultimately established, and it is also taught in the scriptures in this way.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos por yod ces pa'o //üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa'i 'du shes ni shes pa gnyis med kyi phyir dngos po yod cing /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos por yod ces pa'o // dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i 'du shes ni shes pa gnyis med kyi phyir dngos po yod cing /
translated: Therefore it is said that such an entity exists.

original: gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i dngos po med ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i dngos po med ces pa'o //
translated: Since there is no dual consciousness, it is said that an entity exists, but an entity such as a percept and a perceiver does not exist.

original: de nyid de dag gi bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid de dag gi bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: That very [consciousness] becomes their grasping at a self and so on.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na /
translated: If it existed through its essence,

original: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not become nonexistent.

original: zhes sngar bstan pa'i rig pas de ni rtag tu yod pa'i rang bzhin la brten cing gnas pas shes pa rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin rtag pa la sogs par khas len dgos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sngar bstan pa'i rig pas de ni rtag tu yod pa'i rang bzhin la brten cing gnas pas shes pa rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin rtag pa la sogs par khas len dgos pa'o //
translated: Thus, since consciousness is always based on and exists in dependence upon a permanent nature, one must accept that consciousness is a permanent nature that is mere awareness.

original: gal te de lta na rnam par shes pa dang phyi'i don la sogs pa yod par bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rnam par shes pa dang phyi'i don la sogs pa yod par bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts the teaching that consciousness and external objects and so on exist.

original: de ltar bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can rnams brid pa'i don du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can rnams brid pa'i don du bstan pa ste /
translated: Such teachings are taught by emanation buddhas in order to guide sentient beings.

original: drang ba'i don nyid yin no //üîΩde ni chos nyid kyi @148b sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: drang ba'i don nyid yin no // de ni chos nyid kyi @148b sangs rgyas sam /
translated: They are provisional meaning.üîΩThey are not teachings of the buddhas of reality

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas te longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas te longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: or the buddhas of meditative concentration, that is, the enjoyment body.

original: de ltar phyi nang gi chos rnam par 'jog pa ni mi brjod do zhes tshig phyi ma la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi nang gi chos rnam par 'jog pa ni mi brjod do zhes tshig phyi ma la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus the statement ‚Äúouter and inner phenomena are not described‚Äù should be applied to the following verse.

original: su zhig mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: su zhig mi brjod ce na /
translated: Who does not describe them?

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos 'phags pa'i ye shes so so rang gis rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku'i sangs rgyas ni de 'dra ba mi brjod ces pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos 'phags pa'i ye shes so so rang gis rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku'i sangs rgyas ni de 'dra ba mi brjod ces pa ste /
translated: The Buddhahood of the Dharma body is not described in such terms.

original: 'di'i don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of this has been explained in detail above.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dpe'i rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas kyang don de nyid ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dpe'i rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas kyang don de nyid ston te /
translated: With ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha‚Äù and so on, he teaches that very meaning by way of many examples.

original: shing gi grib ma ni de'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: shing gi grib ma ni de'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The shadow of a tree is its reflection.

original: de ni shing gi dbyibs su snang ba shes pa'i ngo bor yod pas /
analyzed: de ni shing gi dbyibs su snang ba shes pa'i ngo bor yod pas /
translated: It exists as the entity of the consciousness that appears in the shape of the tree.

original: grib ma ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: grib ma ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not not a shadow.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi dbyibs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi dbyibs med pa'i phyir /
translated: But because there is no external shape that is a real entity,

original: rdzas su grub pa'i grib ma 'ang ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas su grub pa'i grib ma 'ang ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: it is also not a shadow that is substantially established.

original: gzhan yang brag ca ni ming dang 'bab chu dang rlung gi sgra dang / ri rong la sogs pa phrad pa las byung zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang brag ca ni ming dang 'bab chu dang rlung gi sgra dang / ri rong la sogs pa phrad pa las byung zhing /
translated: Moreover, an echo arises from the contact of a name, a waterfall or the sound of the wind, a mountain, a valley, and so forth.

original: phyi rol na grag ste /
analyzed: phyi rol na grag ste /
translated: It is heard externally.

original: de ni byis pa mi mkhas pa rnams la phyi rol gyi sgra bden par grag cing /
analyzed: de ni byis pa mi mkhas pa rnams la phyi rol gyi sgra bden par grag cing /
translated: That is heard as a real external sound for the childish who are not learned.

original: mkhas pa rnams la de 'dra ba ma yin par grag pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la de 'dra ba ma yin par grag pa'o //
translated: It is not heard in that way for the learned.

original: de dag ni chags pa dang zhes pa sgom pas gdungs pa'i ri dags la chu ru snang zhing de la chags pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni chags pa dang zhes pa sgom pas gdungs pa'i ri dags la chu ru snang zhing de la chags pa'o //
translated: Those are the appearances of water for the deer tormented by the heat of meditation.

original: dngos 'dzin byis pas 'phangs blangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni byis pa rnams kyis bdag rtag pa la sogs pa dngos por zhen pa dam du bzung ba rnams /
analyzed: dngos 'dzin byis pas 'phangs blangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni byis pa rnams kyis bdag rtag pa la sogs pa dngos por zhen pa dam du bzung ba rnams /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe childish who grasp at entities are deceived by it‚Äù and so on is as follows: The childish firmly grasp the entities of a permanent self and so on.

original: ji ltar shing la sogs pa'i gzer chen po gzer phra mos 'byin par byed pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar shing la sogs pa'i gzer chen po gzer phra mos 'byin par byed pa ltar /
translated: Just as a large nail in a tree is removed by a small nail,

original: de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log rags pa rnams kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dngos por bstan pas rim gyis brid de rnam par rtog pa phra mos rags pa rnams zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log rags pa rnams kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dngos por bstan pas rim gyis brid de rnam par rtog pa phra mos rags pa rnams zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: Such gross errors are also gradually removed by teaching impermanence, etc.

original: sgyu ma ro langs 'khrul 'khor ni sems pa'i g-yo ba med pa'i dpe'o //üîΩrmi lam la sogs pa ni med bzhin du snang ba 'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma ro langs 'khrul 'khor ni sems pa'i g-yo ba med pa'i dpe'o // rmi lam la sogs pa ni med bzhin du snang ba 'am /
translated: The examples of the magical creation, the zombie, and the machine are for the non-movement of the mind.üîΩThe examples of the dream, etc. are for the appearance of the non-existent,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi dpe'o //
translated: or for impermanence.

original: rgyud gsum chad pa ni zad pa dang mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: rgyud gsum chad pa ni zad pa dang mi skye ba ste /
translated: The cutting off of the three continuums is the exhaustion and non-arising of the three continuums.

original: de 'dra ba'i ye shes thob pa na thar par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i ye shes thob pa na thar par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When one attains such a gnosis, one is liberated.

original: gal te rgyud gsum sems kyi dngos por grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyud gsum sems kyi dngos por grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúAre not the three continuums established as mental entities?üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'di la rnam rig gang yang med //
analyzed: 'di la rnam rig gang yang med //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThere is no awareness whatsoever.üîΩ‚Äù

original: ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: cung zad du yang khas blangs med /
analyzed: cung zad du yang khas blangs med /
translated: There is not the slightest assertion.

original: @149a * // ces pa ni yod med la sogs pa'i mtshan mar brtags pa rnams de bzhin du grub pa med pa de 'dra ba'i phyogs rnam par 'jog pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: @149a * // ces pa ni yod med la sogs pa'i mtshan mar brtags pa rnams de bzhin du grub pa med pa de 'dra ba'i phyogs rnam par 'jog pa med ces pa'o //
translated: This means that the characteristics of existence, non-existence, etc., are not established in such a way, and that such a position is not posited.

original: rnam rig 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas snga ma de nyid gsal bar 'chad do //
analyzed: rnam rig 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas snga ma de nyid gsal bar 'chad do //
translated: The verse that begins This cognition explains the above in a clear way.

original: gang la zhes pa myong ba'i rang bzhin tsam la /
analyzed: gang la zhes pa myong ba'i rang bzhin tsam la /
translated: In the phrase in regard to what, it is the mere nature of experience.

original: dngos po'i ngo bor btags pa ni mi bden zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor btags pa ni mi bden zhes pa'o //
translated: The imputation of the nature of an entity is said to be unreal.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nges pa'i don bstan pas ni /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nges pa'i don bstan pas ni /
translated: Thus, by teaching the definitive meaning of all the Tathagatas,

original: mtha' bzhi las rnam par grol ba rigs pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi las rnam par grol ba rigs pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the union of reasoning and emptiness, which is free from the four extremes, is itself taught.

original: gal te de ltan phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltan phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is not tenable to teach that the aggregates, etc., exist.

original: de ni gnas zab mo rtogs par bya ba'i don du thog mar zhen pa dang bcas pa'i skye bo rnams la drang ba'i don nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gnas zab mo rtogs par bya ba'i don du thog mar zhen pa dang bcas pa'i skye bo rnams la drang ba'i don nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to realize the profound abiding way, the Buddha first taught the expedient meaning to those beings who are attached.

original: de la bden pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni bden pa bzhi sngar bstan pa ltar kun nas nyon mongs pas bsdus pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / lam dang 'gog pas bsdus pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rten 'brel dang rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni bden pa bzhi sngar bstan pa ltar kun nas nyon mongs pas bsdus pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / lam dang 'gog pas bsdus pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rten 'brel dang rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The meaning of truths and so forth is as follows: The four truths are the dependent origination subsumed by defilement as previously explained, and the dependent origination and liberation of the side of purification subsumed by the path and cessation.

original: sgo gsum gyi bsten pa 'jug pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: sgo gsum gyi bsten pa 'jug pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: Having previously engaged in the practice of the three doors,

original: de la brten nas rim gyis gnas zab mo rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la brten nas rim gyis gnas zab mo rtogs par byed do //
translated: one gradually realizes the profound abiding reality in dependence on that.

original: de las / gzhan du gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang / zhes pa la sogs pa shes par zad do //
analyzed: de las / gzhan du gtso bo'i rang bzhin dang / zhes pa la sogs pa shes par zad do //
translated: It says in that text: Otherwise, the nature of the principal... and so forth. One should understand.

original: rgyu med pa nyid 'dod rgyal ba 'am /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid 'dod rgyal ba 'am /
translated: Either one asserts causelessness and arbitrariness,

original: yang na 'dod par dga' ba'i stobs kyis 'bras bu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod par dga' ba'i stobs kyis 'bras bu 'byung ba ste /
translated: or the power of desire for pleasure is the cause of the effect.

original: ji ltar tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par thog ma nyid du skyes pa'i sems can 'ga' zhig gi 'dod pa'i stobs kyis lha gzhan gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa skyes so snyam du sems shing khas len pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong par thog ma nyid du skyes pa'i sems can 'ga' zhig gi 'dod pa'i stobs kyis lha gzhan gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa skyes so snyam du sems shing khas len pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the case of a sentient being who is born first in the empty Brahma palace, who thinks and accepts that by the power of his desire, other gods are born, a second, a third, and so on.

original: de bzhin du dus dang rang bzhin rgyur smra ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus dang rang bzhin rgyur smra ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Likewise, it is the case of those who propound time, nature, and primal matter as causes, and so on.

original: de 'dra ba ston par byed pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ston par byed pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not like that, I teach.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos bstan pa 'jug pa'i rim pa nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos bstan pa 'jug pa'i rim pa nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par ston te /
translated: With the words ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,‚Äù and so on, he teaches in detail the stages of engaging in the teaching of the Dharma from another perspective.

original: sgrib pa gnyis kyi gnyen por rim gyis chos ston pa ni ji ltar ded dpon 'ga' zhig 'jim pa'i ri dags kyis bu rnams 'drid pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis kyi gnyen por rim gyis chos ston pa ni ji ltar ded dpon 'ga' zhig 'jim pa'i ri dags kyis bu rnams 'drid pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma in stages as an antidote to the two obscurations is like the case of a captain who deceives his children with a clay deer.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As was taught earlier.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsdus par 'gyur ba brgya'i gnyen por sngar bshad pa ltar /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsdus par 'gyur ba brgya'i gnyen por sngar bshad pa ltar /
translated: Likewise, as was explained earlier, the antidote to the hundred obscurations subsumed within the afflictive obscurations is the teaching of the Dharma in stages.

original: @149b snang ba med pa brgya po nyid thog mar bstan la /
analyzed: @149b snang ba med pa brgya po nyid thog mar bstan la /
translated: The one hundred non-appearances are taught first.

original: de'i rjes su shes bya'i sgrib pas bsdus pa gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de'i rjes su shes bya'i sgrib pas bsdus pa gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa brgyad de /
translated: After that, the eight conceptualizations of apprehendeds and apprehenders that are included within the obstructions to omniscience are taught.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it has been said:

original: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //üîΩgzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
analyzed: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la // gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
translated: On the paths of seeing and meditation,üîΩin order to pacify

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: the conceptualizations of apprehendeds and apprehenders,

original: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the antidotes are the eight conceptualizations.

original: de la gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa rags pa rnam pa bzhi ni mthong ba'i lam gyis sbang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa rags pa rnam pa bzhi ni mthong ba'i lam gyis sbang bar bya ba ste /
translated: The four coarse conceptualizations of apprehendeds and apprehenders are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i rten can dang / gnyis pa gnyen po'i rten can gyi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i rten can dang / gnyis pa gnyen po'i rten can gyi rtog pa'o //
translated: There are two conceptualizations of apprehendeds: the conceptualization of apprehendeds that is the basis of the afflictions and the conceptualization of apprehendeds that is the basis of the antidote.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
translated: By the basis and its antidote,

original: gzung ba'i rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rtog pa rnam pa gnyis // zhes gsungs so //
translated: there are two types of conceptualizations of apprehendeds.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang gnyis te /
translated: There are also two conceptualizations of apprehenders.

original: gang zag rdzas la brten pa dang // skyes bu btags pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas la brten pa dang // skyes bu btags pa la brten pa'o //
translated: The person is based on substance and the individual is based on designation.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩrdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyis /
analyzed: de skad du yang / rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyis /
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩThe two kinds of grasping are accepted

original: 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod // ces gsungs so //
translated: based on substance and designation.

original: de ltar rags pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba med pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rags pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba med pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the four gross [aspects] are to be eliminated by the path of seeing of the bodhisattva's non-conceptual wisdom,

original: phra ba rnam pa bzhi ni de'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba rnam pa bzhi ni de'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: while the four subtle [aspects] are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation of that [wisdom].

original: de lta na lam gnyis kyis bsdus pa spang bya la ltos te ;
analyzed: de lta na lam gnyis kyis bsdus pa spang bya la ltos te ;
translated: Thus, in terms of what is to be eliminated, [the path] is divided into one hundred and eight [aspects] that are included in the two paths,

original: rnam par phye ba brgya rtsa brgyad dang / lam dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i theg pa dang / de rnams kyi bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes yon tan bskyed pa'i gzhir gyur pas sa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba brgya rtsa brgyad dang / lam dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i theg pa dang / de rnams kyi bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes yon tan bskyed pa'i gzhir gyur pas sa zhes pa ste /
translated: and the basis for the generation of the wisdom that realizes the vehicles included in the path and result and the qualities of the essence of those [vehicles] is called a stage.

original: thog mar nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i rim gyis rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: thog mar nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i rim gyis rab tu 'jug go //
translated: One enters gradually, beginning with the vehicle of the hearers and so forth.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams tshul lugs rnam pa bzhir bsdus pa'i sgo nas gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams tshul lugs rnam pa bzhir bsdus pa'i sgo nas gsal bar ston te /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, and so forth, clarify those samadhis of non-appearance by summarizing them into four systems.

original: bsam gtan pa yi yul de gang //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yi yul de gang //
translated: What is the object of the meditator?

original: rnal 'byor rnam pa du ru brjod /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnam pa du ru brjod /
translated: How many kinds of yoga are there?

original: ces dris pa'i lan du yang sbyang bar bya'o //
