analyzed: ces dris pa'i lan du yang sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: The answer is also to be applied.

original: dang po nas gang nas gang du zhes pa ni de ltar dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba la yid 'byung ba sngon du btang nas rim gyis 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: dang po nas gang nas gang du zhes pa ni de ltar dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba la yid 'byung ba sngon du btang nas rim gyis 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ste /
translated: From the beginning, wherever means that, having previously become disgusted with samsara with a mind that has objects, one gradually stops discrimination and feeling.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde la byis pa nye bar spyod pa zhes pa ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i lhag mthong dang bral bas 'jig rten pa'i bsam @150a * //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'o // de la byis pa nye bar spyod pa zhes pa ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i lhag mthong dang bral bas 'jig rten pa'i bsam @150a * //
translated: This is called the samadhi of non-appearance.

original: gtan dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gtan dang mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: Therein, the conduct of the childish means that, being devoid of vipashyana that realizes suchness, it is similar to the worldly dhyanas.

original: don rab tu 'byed pa'i bsam gtan ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi mtshan mar gzung ba thams cad shes rab kyis rnam par gzhigs nas blo'i ngo na med par byas te /üîΩchos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid kyis don rab tu 'byed pa'i go rims can te /
analyzed: don rab tu 'byed pa'i bsam gtan ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi mtshan mar gzung ba thams cad shes rab kyis rnam par gzhigs nas blo'i ngo na med par byas te / chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid kyis don rab tu 'byed pa'i go rims can te /
translated: The concentration of the thorough differentiation of meaning is the concentration of the bodhisattva who has attained the first stage, who thoroughly differentiates the meaning by the process of the stage of realization of the selflessness of phenomena, having destroyed with wisdom all signs of self and signs of other that are apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: It is the concentration of the appearance of nonappearance, the pristine wisdom of meditative equipoise included in the first, second, and so on stages of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan ni bdag med pa gnyis kyi mtshan mar sgro btags pa yang /üîΩkun du brtags pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan ni bdag med pa gnyis kyi mtshan mar sgro btags pa yang /üîΩkun du brtags pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The concentration focused on suchness is the concentration of the bodhisattva who has attained the sixth stage, who has thoroughly differentiated the meaning by the process of the stage of the perfection of wisdom, having destroyed with wisdom the superimposition of the signs of the two kinds of selflessness.üîΩIt is the concentration of the appearance of nonappearance, the pristine wisdom of meditative equipoise included in the sixth stage of the bodhisattva.

original: de 'dra ba'i rnam par yang mi rtog pa sems kyi chos nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rnam par yang mi rtog pa sems kyi chos nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Such non-conceptuality is subsumed by the concentration of non-appearance, the realization of the mind's reality just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i rnam par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i rnam par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The concentration of the tathagatas is the engagement of the tathagata stage.

original: chos kyi sku'i ye shes sngon du byed pa'i lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ye shes sngon du byed pa'i lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa'am /
translated: It is subsumed by the vajra like concentration that is the path which is preceded by the gnosis of the dharmakaya,

original: yang na chos kyi sku'i ye shes la rgyun gyis 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang na chos kyi sku'i ye shes la rgyun gyis 'jug pa ste /
translated: or else it is the continuous engagement in the gnosis of the dharmakaya.

original: chos kyi sku nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is subsumed by the dharmakaya itself.

original: mtshan nyid gsum gyis bde ba ni zab pa med pa'i bde ba dang / spros pa dang bral ba dang / mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum gyis bde ba ni zab pa med pa'i bde ba dang / spros pa dang bral ba dang / mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: The bliss of the three realities is the bliss of the absence of profundity, the bliss of freedom from elaboration and the bliss of immutability.

original: dang po gnyis kyis ni rim pa bzhin du sgrib pa gnyis bag chags dang bcas te spang bar bstan la /
analyzed: dang po gnyis kyis ni rim pa bzhin du sgrib pa gnyis bag chags dang bcas te spang bar bstan la /
translated: The first two demonstrate the abandonment of the two obscurations together with their habitual tendencies and

original: mi 'gyur bas ni mthar thug pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bas ni mthar thug pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pas nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it is unchanging, it is ultimate and since it is the nature of the dharmadhatu, it is without decline.

original: de 'dra ba'i bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i don du /
translated: In order to attain such concentration,üîΩthose who have attained a little yoga should strive again and again.

original: rnal 'byor cung zad thob pa rnams kyis yang nas yang du brtson par byas na bsam gtan gyi mtshan ma /
analyzed: rnal 'byor cung zad thob pa rnams kyis yang nas yang du brtson par byas na bsam gtan gyi mtshan ma /
translated: The signs of concentration areüîΩthe shapes of the sun and moon,üîΩlight, and lotus-like,

original: nyi ma zla ba'i dbyibs 'dra dang // 'od dang pad ma lta bu dang // ri mo nam mkha'i me 'dra mthong //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba'i dbyibs 'dra dang // 'od dang pad ma lta bu dang // ri mo nam mkha'i me 'dra mthong // zhes pa ste /
translated: lines, and space-like fire.

original: shr'i k'a la tsakr'i 'grel par nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shr'i k'a la tsakr'i 'grel par nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags bstan pa ste /
translated: In the commentary on the ≈örƒÅvakabh≈´mi, the signs of daytime yoga are taught.üîΩOne sees the shapes and colors of the sun and moon in the sky,üîΩappears like the shape and light of a lotus,üîΩsees the form of a fire burning in a cloudless sky,

original: nam mkha' la nyi ma dang zla ba'i dbyibs dang kha dog rnam pa lta bur mthong ba dang / pad mo'i dbyibs dang 'od lta bur snang ba dang / sprin med pa'i nam mkha'i me 'bar ba'i rnam par mthong ba dang / gzhan yang ri mo'i @150b rnam par snang ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la nyi ma dang zla ba'i dbyibs dang kha dog rnam pa lta bur mthong ba dang / pad mo'i dbyibs dang 'od lta bur snang ba dang / sprin med pa'i nam mkha'i me 'bar ba'i rnam par mthong ba dang / gzhan yang ri mo'i @150b rnam par snang ba ste /

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'od chen po //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'od chen po //

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //

analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
translated: The great splendor, the great light,

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: The great fire of wisdom and insight.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar te bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang sbyar te bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is taught in accordance with the above passage.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel par zad par gyi skye mched kyi mtshan ma bshad pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel par zad par gyi skye mched kyi mtshan ma bshad pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be applied to the explanation of the signs of the bases of totality by ƒÄrya Vimuktisena in his commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de la mtshan ma de dag mthong ba'i tshe yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin cing bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma de dag mthong ba'i tshe yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin cing bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: When seeing those signs, if one grasps them as real and becomes conceited with self-pride,

original: mu stegs can gyi lam du khrid par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lam du khrid par byed pa ste /
translated: it leads to the path of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: thar pa las ring du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa las ring du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes far from liberation.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin cing gang zag gi bdag tu rlom pa med pa de ltar na yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul du lhung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin cing gang zag gi bdag tu rlom pa med pa de ltar na yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul du lhung bar byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, when one does not apprehend signs as real and does not falsely project a self of persons, one does not fall into the sphere of experience of ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam dang de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu la spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: One practices the path that has reference points and the result that is similar to it.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i mtshan mar zhen pa las log ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i mtshan mar zhen pa las log ste /
translated: Therefore, one turns away from attachment to signs such as that.

original: de ltar snang ba yang rdzas su ma grub pa'i snang ba sems tsam nyid du shes shing /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba yang rdzas su ma grub pa'i snang ba sems tsam nyid du shes shing /
translated: One understands that appearances are only mind, which is not substantially established.

original: de dang 'dra bar chos thams cad kyang rtogs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar chos thams cad kyang rtogs par gyur pa na /
translated: When one realizes that all phenomena are similar to that,

original: rim gyis snang ba tsam yang gnas gyur te //
analyzed: rim gyis snang ba tsam yang gnas gyur te //
translated: in stages, even mere appearances are transformed.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: When one abides in the samƒÅdhi that is free from appearances, at that time the buddhas empower one.

original: 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: yang dag pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni de la blo gros 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni de la blo gros 'jug pa'o //
translated: Correct engagement is the mind engaging that.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas ni lam gyi bye brag de rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rnam par sbyang bas thob par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas ni lam gyi bye brag de rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rnam par sbyang bas thob par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: This extensively teaches the result of nirvana itself, which is attained by the purification of the tathƒÅgatagarbha of those specific paths.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dod pa'i phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las 'dir ni re zhig mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston te /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dod pa'i phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las 'dir ni re zhig mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston te /
translated: Moreover, it is naturally nirvƒÅ·πáa, and the nirvƒÅ·πáa with and without remainder that is desired by ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and the great nonabiding nirvƒÅ·πáa of the buddhas. Here, for the time being, nonabiding nirvƒÅ·πáa is taught.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid thams cad kyi bag chags kun gzhi dang zhes pa /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid thams cad kyi bag chags kun gzhi dang zhes pa /
translated: Moreover, the habitual tendencies of all aspects of consciousness are the all-base.

original: bag chags nyid kun gzhi ste /
analyzed: bag chags nyid kun gzhi ste /
translated: Habitual tendencies themselves are the all-base.

original: nus pa dang nus pa can tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang nus pa can tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the potential and that which has the potential are not different.

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lta ba'i bag chags zhes pa ni 'jig tshogs la @151a * //
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lta ba'i bag chags zhes pa ni 'jig tshogs la @151a * //
translated: The ‚Äúhabitual propensities of the view‚Äù of the mental faculty and the mental consciousness are the habitual propensities of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩ

original: lta ba la sogs pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa'i bag chags te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe habitual propensities of the view of the mental consciousness‚Äù refers to the habitual propensities of the view of the transitory collection, etc.

original: sa bon gzhan du gyur ces pa la sogs pa sngar bstan no //
analyzed: sa bon gzhan du gyur ces pa la sogs pa sngar bstan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe transformation of the seeds‚Äù has been explained above.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul zhes pa la sogs pas ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul lugs phyin ci ma log pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul zhes pa la sogs pas ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul lugs phyin ci ma log pa /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mode of nirvana‚Äù and so forth refers to the unerring mode of non-abiding nirvana,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ba ste dbyings ye shes dbyer med pa'i chos kyi sku las dbyings kyi cha gtso bor bstan pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas rnams dang nga yis brjod //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ba ste dbyings ye shes dbyer med pa'i chos kyi sku las dbyings kyi cha gtso bor bstan pa'o // sangs rgyas rnams dang nga yis brjod //
translated: which is the emptiness of intrinsic reality, the Dharma Body, which is the inseparability of the ultimate realm and primordial wisdom.

original: ces pa mdo sde 'di dang 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin la sogs par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa mdo sde 'di dang 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin la sogs par gsungs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe buddhas and I have taught‚Äù refers to the teachings in this sutra and in the noble Cloud of Jewels, etc.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba ni yang dag pa ma lags pa'i yongs su rtog pa rab tu zhi ba'i tshig bla dags lags so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba ni yang dag pa ma lags pa'i yongs su rtog pa rab tu zhi ba'i tshig bla dags lags so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúWhat is called ‚ÄònirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äô is a term for the pacification of incorrect conceptualization.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni ye shes kyi cha gtso bor ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni ye shes kyi cha gtso bor ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the passage beginning with ‚Äúit is not permanent‚Äù teaches the aspect of wisdom as primary.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa spangs pas de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin zhes pa ni de dag gi dngos po yod par rtog na /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa spangs pas de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin zhes pa ni de dag gi dngos po yod par rtog na /
translated: Since it abandons the conceptualization of specific and general characteristics, therefore it is not permanent. If one conceptualizes that they exist,

original: de ni rtag tu de nyid kyi rang bzhin la brten cing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu de nyid kyi rang bzhin la brten cing gnas pa ste /
translated: then that is always based on and abides in the nature of just that.

original: med pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas rtag par 'dzin pa'i mthar 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: med pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas rtag par 'dzin pa'i mthar 'gyur ba las //
translated: Since it would not become nonexistent, it would be the extreme of grasping permanence.

original: 'dir ni de ltar ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni de ltar ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Here it is not like that.

original: chad pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is not annihilated. As it is said,

original: 'das pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not past‚Äù and so on.

original: de la 'das pa ni sngar nyid du chos kyi sku'i ye shes mngon du byas shing /
analyzed: de la 'das pa ni sngar nyid du chos kyi sku'i ye shes mngon du byas shing /
translated: Therein, the past is the time when the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya was already manifested.

original: de las gzugs sku gnyis su snang bas sems can gyi don byas nas sprul ba'i sku yul lam dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig tu /
analyzed: de las gzugs sku gnyis su snang bas sems can gyi don byas nas sprul ba'i sku yul lam dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig tu /
translated: From that, the two form bodies appear and benefit sentient beings.üîΩ

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: From that, the two form bodies appear, and having acted for the welfare of sentient beings, the emanation body demonstrates the way of nirvana in some places or at some times.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang rnam par chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang rnam par chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba lta bu'o //
translated: That nirvana is like a death and transmigration that is a discontinuity.

original: da ltar byung ba na di ltar chos kyi sku'i ye shes mngon du byas shing /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na di ltar chos kyi sku'i ye shes mngon du byas shing /
translated: In the present, the wisdom of the dharmakaya is actualized in this way.

original: de las byung ba'i gzugs kyi sku yang /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i gzugs kyi sku yang /
translated: The form body that arises from that

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: appears to turn the wheel of dharma and so on.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The future is self evident.

original: so so rang gis rtogs par byed //
analyzed: so so rang gis rtogs par byed //
translated: It is to be realized by each one for himself.

original: ces pa de rnams kyi ye shes rgyun mi 'chad par gdul bya rnams kyi the tshom sel ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa de rnams kyi ye shes rgyun mi 'chad par gdul bya rnams kyi the tshom sel ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of those buddhas acts without interruption to dispel the doubts of those to be tamed and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir blo gros phyin ci log tu gyur pa gang dag 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas pa'i @151b gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir blo gros phyin ci log tu gyur pa gang dag 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas pa'i @151b gnas skabs sam /
translated: Therefore, those whose intelligence is distorted think that the gnosis of ƒÅryas is either the state of buddhahood or the state of sentient beings.

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su ldog par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su ldog par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Therefore, those whose intelligence is mistaken think that the pristine wisdom of the ƒÅryas ceases at the time of buddhahood or in the expanse of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas shes par bya ba'i yul yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang med pa'i phyir de shes pa'i ye shesüîΩmi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas shes par bya ba'i yul yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang med pa'i phyir de shes pa'i ye shes mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: The reason for that is that since the vajralike meditative stabilization realizes that all phenomena characterized as existent, nonexistent, and so on are emptiness, the object of knowledge does not exist even in the correct relative.üîΩTherefore the wisdom that knows that is untenable.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩ'gro ba'i chos kun rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'gro ba'i chos kun rnam shes kyi //
translated: Also, it is said:üîΩAll phenomena of the world are

original: me yi bud shing yin par 'dod //üîΩde dag ji bzhin rnam 'byed pa'i //
analyzed: me yi bud shing yin par 'dod // de dag ji bzhin rnam 'byed pa'i //
translated: the fuel for the fire of consciousness.üîΩThe fire that differentiates them

original: me yis bsregs nas nyer zhir 'dod //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me yis bsregs nas nyer zhir 'dod //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is extinguished through burning them.

original: de yang dper na shing gnyis drud pa las me byung nas shing de nyid sreg pa ltar /
analyzed: de yang dper na shing gnyis drud pa las me byung nas shing de nyid sreg pa ltar /
translated: For example, fire arises from rubbing two sticks together and then burns up those sticks.

original: gnyen po rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las re zhig chos kyi sku'i ye shes kyi me byung nas des mtshan ma'i chos thams cad bsregs shing mi dmigs pas de la dmigs pa'i ye shes de nyid kyang rgyun ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las re zhig chos kyi sku'i ye shes kyi me byung nas des mtshan ma'i chos thams cad bsregs shing mi dmigs pas de la dmigs pa'i ye shes de nyid kyang rgyun ldog pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the fire of exalted wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya arises from the vajra-like meditative stabilization, which is the antidote. That fire burns up all signified phenomena and, since they are not observed, the continuum of that exalted wisdom that observes them is stopped.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rdo rje lta bu'i sngon rol gyi gnyen po la brten nas rdo rje lta bus bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi mes mtshan ma'i bud shing bsregs nas de'i rjes su ye shes kyi rgyun gzhan 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rdo rje lta bu'i sngon rol gyi gnyen po la brten nas rdo rje lta bus bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi mes mtshan ma'i bud shing bsregs nas de'i rjes su ye shes kyi rgyun gzhan 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: In another way, the fire of exalted wisdom that is included in the vajra-like meditative stabilization burns up the firewood of signs in dependence on the antidote prior to the vajra-like meditative stabilization. After that, there is no arising of another continuum of exalted wisdom.

original: bstan bcos dag las kyang //
analyzed: bstan bcos dag las kyang //
translated: Also, the treatises say:üîΩWhen things and nonthings

original: gang tshe dngos dang dngos med dag / blo yis mdun na mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gang tshe dngos dang dngos med dag / blo yis mdun na mi gnas pa //
translated: are not present before the mind,

original: de tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas //
analyzed: de tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas //
translated: at that time, since there is no other aspect,

original: dmigs pa med par rab tu zhi //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par rab tu zhi //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: it is pacified without observation.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgyun dang ldan par yod na de nyid 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgyun dang ldan par yod na de nyid 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the Buddha‚Äôs gnosis were to exist in a continuous manner, it would follow that it is itself associated with delusion.

original: 'di ltar des rang ngam gzhan gang yang ma rig pa'i shes pa ni mi 'thad la //
analyzed: 'di ltar des rang ngam gzhan gang yang ma rig pa'i shes pa ni mi 'thad la //
translated: For it is untenable that the Buddha‚Äôs gnosis is a cognition that is ignorant of either itself or others.

original: de dag rig par khas len te /
analyzed: de dag rig par khas len te /
translated: And if you accept that he is aware of them,

original: rjes thob kyi ye shes gzugs kyi sku dang / zhing khams kyi rnam par snang ba nyid du khas len na snang ba'i yul de rnams phyi rol gyi dngos por med bzhin du snang ba'i phyir blo 'khrul pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes thob kyi ye shes gzugs kyi sku dang / zhing khams kyi rnam par snang ba nyid du khas len na snang ba'i yul de rnams phyi rol gyi dngos por med bzhin du snang ba'i phyir blo 'khrul pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: then why would it not follow that the mind is deluded, since the appearing objects of the Buddha‚Äôs gnosis of the postmeditation state, the form bodies and the appearances of the pure realms, are perceived as objects that do not exist as external entities?

original: gal te nyes pa der 'gyur du'o zhes te /
analyzed: gal te nyes pa der 'gyur du'o zhes te /
translated: You may respond, ‚ÄúYes, that would be a problem.‚Äù

original: rjes thob kyi ye shes ni khas mi len la /
analyzed: rjes thob kyi ye shes ni khas mi len la /
translated: And if you then say that you do not accept that there is a gnosis of the postmeditation state,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes rang rig pa 'ba' zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes rang rig pa 'ba' zhig go zhe na /
translated: but that there is only a gnosis of meditative equipoise that is reflexive awareness,üîΩwe would respond as follows.

original: de lta na yang rig par bya ba rang gi rang bzhin don dam par med bzhin du rig cing snang bas ci'i phyir 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /üîΩbrtags pa snga @152a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang rig par bya ba rang gi rang bzhin don dam par med bzhin du rig cing snang bas ci'i phyir 'khrul par mi 'gyur te / brtags pa snga @152a * //
translated: In that case, since the nature of the object of cognition does not exist ultimately, why would cognition not be mistaken, since it is cognition and appearance?

original: ma nyid mtshungs so //
analyzed: ma nyid mtshungs so //
translated: The previous analysis is the same.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of a buddha is not tenable.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not logical.

original: de lta na mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes kyis kyang yod med la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas ye shes de'i don dmigs bya'i chos kyi mtshan ma kun rdzob tu yang med pa'i phyir
analyzed: de lta na mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes kyis kyang yod med la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas ye shes de'i don dmigs bya'i chos kyi mtshan ma kun rdzob tu yang med pa'i phyir
translated: In that case, since the wisdom of meditative equipoise included in the path of seeing also realizes that all signs of phenomena such as existence and nonexistence are empty, the signs of phenomena that are the objects of that wisdom do not exist even conventionally.

original: / de dag la dmigs pa'i ye shes gnas skabs de nyid nas rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de dag la dmigs pa'i ye shes gnas skabs de nyid nas rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the wisdom that observes them would be interrupted at that time.

original: gal te mtshan ma'i chos de rnams med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma'i chos de rnams med mod kyi /
translated: If those phenomena that are signs do not exist,

original: mtshan ma med pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba /
translated: the object of wisdom that is the object of individual knowledgeüîΩis not tenable.

original: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don kun rdzob tu gnas pas de nyid rig pa'i ye shes rgyun chad pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i don kun rdzob tu gnas pas de nyid rig pa'i ye shes rgyun chad pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable that the stream of the pristine wisdom of awareness is interrupted because the meaning of the union of awareness and emptiness exists conventionally,

original: de ni phyis kyi gnas skabs cig shes la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phyis kyi gnas skabs cig shes la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would be the same for the later occasion of knowing.

original: gzhan yang rjes thob kyi ye shes la snang ba gzugs kyi sku la sogs pa'i phyi rol dngos por med bzhin du phyi rol gyi dngos por snang ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyor ba na ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes thob kyi ye shes la snang ba gzugs kyi sku la sogs pa'i phyi rol dngos por med bzhin du phyi rol gyi dngos por snang ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyor ba na ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you apply the reason that in the pristine wisdom of postmeditation, external things such as the form body do not exist as things but appear as external things, then this reason would not be established.

original: 'o na ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: Well then, how do they appear?

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po med cing sems nyid de ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po med cing sems nyid de ltar snang ba ste /
translated: External things do not exist and mind itself appears in that way.

original: de yang bden pa'i dngos po'i stong pa nyid du snang zhing rtogs pas shes bya ji ltar yin lugs bzhin du snang ba'i ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bden pa'i dngos po'i stong pa nyid du snang zhing rtogs pas shes bya ji ltar yin lugs bzhin du snang ba'i ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the emptiness of true things appears and is realized, how could it be mistaken to appear in accordance with the way things are?

original: 'dir gal te gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i phyir zhes de dag tsam gtan tshigs su 'god na yang khyab pa ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gal te gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i phyir zhes de dag tsam gtan tshigs su 'god na yang khyab pa ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if it is posited that the mere appearance as form and so on is the reason, then the pervasion is not established.

original: de bzhin du ye shes rang gi bdag nyid don dam par med pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes rang gi bdag nyid don dam par med pa la /
translated: Likewise, if it is applied as a reason that the ultimate nonexistence of the nature of wisdom

original: de las bzlog ste yod par snang ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyor na ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las bzlog ste yod par snang ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyor na ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: is the opposite of that, appearing as existent, then it is not established.

original: don dam pa med par shes shing myong ba tsam ma 'gags pa rig pa dang stong ba zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid du snang zhing shes pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na ni gtan tshigs 'di 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam pa med par shes shing myong ba tsam ma 'gags pa rig pa dang stong ba zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid du snang zhing shes pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na ni gtan tshigs 'di 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is posited as a reason that the mere unceasing experience and cognition of the ultimate nonexistence of the nature of wisdom appears and is cognized as the nature of the union of awareness and emptiness, then this reason is contradictory.

original: shes bya ji ltar yin lugs bzhin du snang ba la /
analyzed: shes bya ji ltar yin lugs bzhin du snang ba la /
translated: It is the mode of being of the object of cognition, appearing as it is.

original: 'khrul pa las bzlog pa'i chos kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa las bzlog pa'i chos kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pervaded by the opposite of delusion.

original: spyir de ltar snang zhing rig pa tsam du gtan tshigs su gtong na yang khyab pa ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: spyir de ltar snang zhing rig pa tsam du gtan tshigs su gtong na yang khyab pa ma grub pa'o //
translated: In general, if you posit mere appearance and mere awareness as the reason, the pervasion is not established.üîΩMoreover, this statement appears to contradict all the sutras and tantras.

original: gzhan yang 'di skad smra ba ni mdo snga @152b dang rgyud sde thams cad dang 'gal bar snang ngo //üîΩde dag ji bzhin rnam 'byed pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di skad smra ba ni mdo snga @152b dang rgyud sde thams cad dang 'gal bar snang ngo // de dag ji bzhin rnam 'byed pa'i //
translated: The meaning of the following is also clear:üîΩBurn them with the fire of wisdom

original: me yis bsregs nas nyer zhir 'dod //
analyzed: me yis bsregs nas nyer zhir 'dod //
translated: and then rest in peace.

original: ces pa'i don yang phyin ci log gi mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba'i don la bzhed par gsal ba nyid pas khungs nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ces pa'i don yang phyin ci log gi mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba'i don la bzhed par gsal ba nyid pas khungs nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: The meaning of this is to pacify the signs of error.

original: yang chos kyi sku ye shes kyi rang bzhin med pa de lta na gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis ni gdul bya'i snang ba tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: yang chos kyi sku ye shes kyi rang bzhin med pa de lta na gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis ni gdul bya'i snang ba tsam yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, if the dharmakaya is not by nature wisdom, then the two form bodies are merely the appearances of those to be tamed and are not the nature of the Buddha.üîΩThis is stated in many sutras such as the Suvarnaprabhasa.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma yin par gser 'od dam pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde du ma las gsungs pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma yin par gser 'od dam pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde du ma las gsungs pas /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to cite this as a source.

original: sangs rgyas la skur ba 'debs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la skur ba 'debs pa /
translated: To say that the dharmakaya is not by nature wisdom is to deprecate the Buddha.

original: dge ba'i lo tog gi ser ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i lo tog gi ser ba /
translated: It is a hail storm for the crop of virtue.

original: legs 'dod rnams kyis rgyang bsrings te spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: legs 'dod rnams kyis rgyang bsrings te spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Those who desire what is good should keep their distance and reject it.

original: gal te sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun dang mi ldan yang ye shes kyi skad cig pa tsam khas len cing /
analyzed: gal te sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun dang mi ldan yang ye shes kyi skad cig pa tsam khas len cing /
translated: If, as has been explained above, you accept that there is a momentary cognition that is not part of a continuum,

original: de nyid kyi bdag po la brten nas gzugs kyi sku gnyis su snang bas sems can gyi don byed pas nyes pa'i go skabs 'di lta bur mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bdag po la brten nas gzugs kyi sku gnyis su snang bas sems can gyi don byed pas nyes pa'i go skabs 'di lta bur mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and that the two form kƒÅyas appear in dependence on that very mind and benefit sentient beings, then this opportunity for error would not arise.

original: de ltar skad cig po de nyid kyang sngar bstan pa ltar 'khrul pas sangs rgyas 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar skad cig po de nyid kyang sngar bstan pa ltar 'khrul pas sangs rgyas 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But, as has been explained above, that very moment would be mistaken, and the buddhas would therefore be mistaken.

original: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, for the same reason,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i gnas skabs sam //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i gnas skabs sam //
translated: at the time of the vajralike samƒÅdhi

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs nyid na yang dmigs par bya ba mtshan ma'i bud shing ba sregs pas de'i rjes su de dag la dmigs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs nyid na yang dmigs par bya ba mtshan ma'i bud shing ba sregs pas de'i rjes su de dag la dmigs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: or even at the time of the path of seeing, it would be untenable for the wisdom that observes the absence of real, discrete entities to arise in the aftermath of the burning away of the firewood of the signs that are the objects of that wisdom.

original: yang de ltar na nyan thos kyi lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad par med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de ltar na nyan thos kyi lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad par med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, in that case, it would be no different from the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äô nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder.

original: gal te de ni sems can gyi don gyi sbyor ba rgyun chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te de ni sems can gyi don gyi sbyor ba rgyun chad pa ma yin la /
translated: The former is not a cessation of the application for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: cig shos ni sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na ye shes med kyang /
analyzed: cig shos ni sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na ye shes med kyang /
translated: The latter is the absence of gnosis at the time of buddhahood.

original: sngar byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyi ye shes dang smon lam la brten nas gzugs sku gnyis su snang zhing sems can gyi don 'byung bas de dag mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyi ye shes dang smon lam la brten nas gzugs sku gnyis su snang zhing sems can gyi don 'byung bas de dag mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: However, they are not the same, because even though the gnosis is absent at the time of buddhahood, the two form kƒÅyas appear based on the gnosis and aspirations of the bodhisattva stage and benefit sentient beings.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dper na nam mkha' lding gi ni //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lding gi ni //
translated: For example, even after the garu·∏ça

original: mchod sdong bsgrubs nas 'das gyur pa //
analyzed: mchod sdong bsgrubs nas 'das gyur pa //
translated: has passed away, having established a pillar,

original: de 'das yun ring lon yang de //
analyzed: de 'das yun ring lon yang de //
translated: for a long time after it has passed

original: dug la sogs pa zhi byed ltar //üîΩbyang chub spyod dang rjes mthun par //üîΩrgyal ba'i mchod sdong bsgrubs pa yang //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las //
analyzed: dug la sogs pa zhi byed ltar // byang chub spyod dang rjes mthun par // rgyal ba'i mchod sdong bsgrubs pa yang // byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las //
translated: it pacifies poison and so on.üîΩIn the same way, even after the bodhisattva

original: 'das kyang don rnams @153a * //
analyzed: 'das kyang don rnams @153a * //
translated: has passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa,üîΩhis benefit to sentient beingsüîΩcontinues for a long time.

original: thams cad byed //
analyzed: thams cad byed //
translated: All of them are done.

original: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: If you say this,

original: de ci 'o thug mngar ba'i ro dang 'brel zhes kyi /
analyzed: de ci 'o thug mngar ba'i ro dang 'brel zhes kyi /
translated: then is it that the water is related to the sweet taste of the porridge?

original: de tsam gyis chu yang de ltar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de tsam gyis chu yang de ltar 'gyur ram /
translated: Or does that alone make the water sweet?

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes la sogs pa yod cing /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes la sogs pa yod cing /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva has wisdom and so forth,

original: de la brten nas sems can gyi don byas kyang ;
analyzed: de la brten nas sems can gyi don byas kyang ;
translated: and on that basis he acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi dgra bcom pa dang mi 'dra ba'i khyad par du 'gyur gyi sangs rgyas kun rdzob tu yang med pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das zhes pa'i lung gi don yang snga ma ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog bzhi pa de nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi dgra bcom pa dang mi 'dra ba'i khyad par du 'gyur gyi sangs rgyas kun rdzob tu yang med pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das zhes pa'i lung gi don yang snga ma ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog bzhi pa de nyid yin gyi /
translated: But that is a difference between the bodhisattva and the arhat, it is not a difference in the qualities of the Buddha, who does not exist even conventionally.

original: ye shes rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the passage, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva attains nirvana,‚Äù is also as stated above, that is, it is not a case of the cessation of the continuum of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang ye shes rgyun chad pa ma yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes rgyun chad pa ma yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag kyang yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are other valid forms of cognition that establish that the continuum of wisdom is not severed.

original: ye shes gang gi rgyun gyi tha mar 'dod pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: ye shes gang gi rgyun gyi tha mar 'dod pa de nyid ni /
translated: The continuum of that very pristine wisdom at the end of the desire realm

original: rigs mthun pa'i ye shes gzhan gyi nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i ye shes gzhan gyi nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: is that which connects to another pristine wisdom of a similar type,

original: 'gal rkyen med la mthun rkyen tshang ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gal rkyen med la mthun rkyen tshang ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: because there is no opposing condition and all the concordant conditions are complete.

original: de la mthun rkyen tshang ba nyid ni /
analyzed: de la mthun rkyen tshang ba nyid ni /
translated: With regard to that, the completeness of the concordant conditions is as follows:

original: de ltar sems can so so'i rgyud la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa 'di nyid gzugs su snang ba dang sgra ru snang ba la sogs pa dang / bde sdug la sogs pa'i khyad par du skye ba ni snga ma'i myong rig las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la ltos kyang /
analyzed: de ltar sems can so so'i rgyud la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa 'di nyid gzugs su snang ba dang sgra ru snang ba la sogs pa dang / bde sdug la sogs pa'i khyad par du skye ba ni snga ma'i myong rig las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la ltos kyang /
translated: The consciousness that is experienced in the continuum of each sentient being in that way arises with the distinctions of appearing as forms, appearing as sounds, and so forth, and as happiness, suffering, and so forth, and it does not depend on any cause other than the experience and awareness of the previous moment.

original: shes pa phyi ma myong rig tsam du skyed pa la ltos te /
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma myong rig tsam du skyed pa la ltos te /
translated: With regard to the production of the mere experience and awareness of the subsequent moment of consciousness,

original: snga ma'i myong rig de nyid rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid du grub la /
analyzed: snga ma'i myong rig de nyid rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid du grub la /
translated: the very experience and awareness of the previous moment is established as being a cause that is not incomplete.

original: de bzhin du ye shes gang gi rgyun gyi tha mar 'dod pa yang myong rig tsam gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes yin pas rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes gang gi rgyun gyi tha mar 'dod pa yang myong rig tsam gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes yin pas rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the end of the continuum of any wisdom is wisdom that has the nature of mere experience and awareness, and thus it is able to produce results that are included in its continuum.

original: 'dir 'gal ba'i rkyen med pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir 'gal ba'i rkyen med pa ni /
translated: Here, there are no conditions that are incompatible with that.

original: gal te ye shes kyi 'gal rkyen gcig srid na de ni phyin ci log nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te ye shes kyi 'gal rkyen gcig srid na de ni phyin ci log nyid yin te /
translated: If there were a single condition that was incompatible with wisdom, that would be mistaken,

original: de yang mi bden pa'i don can glo bur ba nyid yin pas de kho na nyid kyi yul can sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes de ni des bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: de yang mi bden pa'i don can glo bur ba nyid yin pas de kho na nyid kyi yul can sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes de ni des bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: and since that is a temporary phenomenon that does not have a real object, it would be impossible for that to reverse the wisdom that has the nature of the mind that has reality as its object.

original: gzhan yang phyin ci log sa bon dang bcas te spangs pas ye shes dang ldan pa'i rgyud la yang 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyin ci log sa bon dang bcas te spangs pas ye shes dang ldan pa'i rgyud la yang 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable for that which has been abandoned along with its seeds to arise again in a continuum that possesses wisdom.

original: da ltar gyi gnas skabs brgyal ba dang gnyid mthug po la sogs @153b pa'i dus su rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi ngo bo ldog pa ni mig la sogs pa'i mthun rkyen ma tshang ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gnas skabs brgyal ba dang gnyid mthug po la sogs @153b pa'i dus su rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi ngo bo ldog pa ni mig la sogs pa'i mthun rkyen ma tshang ba'am /
translated: The cessation of the six collections of consciousness at the present time, during fainting, deep sleep, and so on, is due to the incompleteness of the favorable conditions of the eyes and so on,

original: gnyid kyis bslad pa dang / gnad mi bzad pa'i gnas su bsnun pa la sogs pa'i 'gal ba'i rkyen gyis ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyis bslad pa dang / gnad mi bzad pa'i gnas su bsnun pa la sogs pa'i 'gal ba'i rkyen gyis ldog pa'o //
translated: or it is due to adverse conditions such as the disturbance of sleep or the piercing of a vital part.

original: gzhan yang bum pa'i skad cig ma gang zhig rang gi rigs phyi ma bskyed pa la rgyu ma tshang ba med par gnas kyang ldog par 'gyur ba ni thob pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i rkyen gyis yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa'i skad cig ma gang zhig rang gi rigs phyi ma bskyed pa la rgyu ma tshang ba med par gnas kyang ldog par 'gyur ba ni thob pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i rkyen gyis yin la /
translated: Moreover, although the vase‚Äôs moment that produces its subsequent type remains without a cause being incomplete, it ceases due to adverse conditions such as the attainment of its end.

original: 'dir ni de 'dra ba'i 'gal rkyen med ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni de 'dra ba'i 'gal rkyen med ces pa'o //
translated: Here, there is no such adverse condition.

original: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i ye shes 'khrul pa yin nam 'khrul pa'i blo mi srid pas lam dang 'bras bu thams cad gtan mi srid par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i ye shes 'khrul pa yin nam 'khrul pa'i blo mi srid pas lam dang 'bras bu thams cad gtan mi srid par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if such a wisdom were mistaken, or if a mistaken mind were impossible, then all paths and fruits would be utterly impossible.

original: de ltar sgrub byed med cing gnod byed yod pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes de ni rgyun chad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub byed med cing gnod byed yod pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes de ni rgyun chad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no proof of that and there is refutation of it, that intuition which is the nature of non-abiding nirvana is not a discontinuity.

original: 'chi ba ni rnam par chad pa'i 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni rnam par chad pa'i 'pho ba'o //
translated: Death is a discontinuous transition.

original: da 'dra ba dang ldan na de nyid da rung skye ba'i rgyud du yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: da 'dra ba dang ldan na de nyid da rung skye ba'i rgyud du yang 'gyur la /
translated: If one were to possess a self like this one, that very self would be the cause of the continuity of rebirth.

original: de ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas /
translated: And that is the root of all suffering,

original: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das zhes pa'o //
translated: so how could there be nirvana?

original: des na rnal 'byor rab tu gyur pa rnams shi 'pho ba dang bral ba 'gro ba rnams kyi skyabs kyi gnas mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor rab tu gyur pa rnams shi 'pho ba dang bral ba 'gro ba rnams kyi skyabs kyi gnas mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the yogis who have become very advanced make manifest the state of refuge for all transmigrators who are free from death and transmigration.

original: de ltar na de kho na nyid du spangs pa dang thob pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa cig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na de kho na nyid du spangs pa dang thob pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa cig yin nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, is one endowed with the qualities of abandonment and attainment in reality?

original: ma yin te thob bya dang spang bya'i chos grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te thob bya dang spang bya'i chos grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the phenomena to be attained and to be abandoned are not established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa thams cad dang bral bas gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa thams cad dang bral bas gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is free from all conceptual elaborations, it is free from identity and difference.

original: gal te de lta na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa nye bar zhi ba med pas /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa nye bar zhi ba med pas /
translated: Even so, since the pacification of unreal imagination does not exist,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: the nirvƒÅ·πáa of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is not nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ltar 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do //
