translated: Some fall to the extreme of superimposition,

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung ste /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung ste /
translated: saying, ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn said such and such,‚Äù and some fall to the extreme of denial.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu don dam pa'i dngos por gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu don dam pa'i dngos por gsungs kyi /
translated: They say that the Buddha taught that causes and effects are ultimate things.

original: sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa med la /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa med la /
translated: He did not teach that they are like illusions.

original: don dam pa'i dngos po yang sngar bstan pa'i tshad mas gnod pas mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos po yang sngar bstan pa'i tshad mas gnod pas mi 'thad cing /
translated: Ultimate things are untenable because they are undermined by the valid knowledge explained earlier.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul du ma yang ma gsungs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyogs nyid bstan par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul du ma yang ma gsungs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyogs nyid bstan par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa'o //
translated: Since he did not teach that they are like illusions, he taught the position that causes and effects do not exist.

original: gzhan yang 'di yod na 'di yod ces pa'i rten 'brel gyi tshig gi don yang mngon sum brjod par byed pa nyid yin pas gdugs dang grib ma ltar dus mnyam pa la 'thad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di yod na 'di yod ces pa'i rten 'brel gyi tshig gi don yang mngon sum brjod par byed pa nyid yin pas gdugs dang grib ma ltar dus mnyam pa la 'thad kyi /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the words ‚Äúif this exists, that occurs‚Äù is that the arising of the effect is expressed as directly perceived. Therefore it is tenable that the cause and effect are simultaneous, like an umbrella and its shade.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba la mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that they arise sequentially.

original: rgyu 'di yod na 'bras bu ma skyes pas 'di zhes pa mi 'thad la /
analyzed: rgyu 'di yod na 'bras bu ma skyes pas 'di zhes pa mi 'thad la /
translated: If this cause exists, the effect has not yet arisen, so it is untenable to say ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu skyes pa na rgyu 'gags pas 'di zhes pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa na rgyu 'gags pas 'di zhes pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If the effect has arisen, the cause has ceased, so it is untenable to say ‚Äúthis.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas say, ‚ÄúThe expression itself is good.‚Äù

original: des na mu stegs byed kyis rnam par brjod pa nyid bzang gi zhes pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyis 'bras bu sngar nas yod pa rgyu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid skye bar 'dod pa la /
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed kyis rnam par brjod pa nyid bzang gi zhes pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyis 'bras bu sngar nas yod pa rgyu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid skye bar 'dod pa la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the effect, which existed previously, becomes the nature of the cause and arises.

original: 'di yod na 'di yod ces pa 'thad kyi khyod phyogs la mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di yod ces pa 'thad kyi khyod phyogs la mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf this exists, that occurs‚Äù is tenable in that context, but it is not tenable in your system.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma lags pa'i rgyus 'bras bu mngon par sgrub ces pa ni gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa de rnams nyid rgyu las ma skyes te rtag tu gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma lags pa'i rgyus 'bras bu mngon par sgrub ces pa ni gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa de rnams nyid rgyu las ma skyes te rtag tu gnas pa yin la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúA cause that is not dependently arisen produces a result‚Äù refers to the assertion that a cause that is not dependently arisen produces a result.

original: de las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan yang 'bras bu rgyu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa sngar nas gnas pa nyid mi gsal ba la gsal bar gyur pa tsam mo zhes khas len pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang tha dad dus mnyam pa la yang rgyu 'bras 'tshol ba nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan yang 'bras bu rgyu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa sngar nas gnas pa nyid mi gsal ba la gsal bar gyur pa tsam mo zhes khas len pa'o // gzhan yang tha dad dus mnyam pa la yang rgyu 'bras 'tshol ba nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: The cause is not produced from other causes, but it is permanent.

original: rgyu dang 'bras @156a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras @156a * //
translated: Moreover, since the cause and result would be simultaneous,

original: bu'i dbye ba nges pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bu'i dbye ba nges pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: it would be untenable for them to be ascertained as distinct.

original: yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyud pa du mar khas len pa ni /
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyud pa du mar khas len pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the assertion that dependent arising is a continuum

original: sngar bstan pa ltar phan tshun ltos pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar phan tshun ltos pas /
translated: is untenable, because, as previously explained, they are mutually dependent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen yang 'dres zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen yang 'dres zhes pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cause and condition are mixed‚Äù means that

original: 'bras bu dang 'dres pa ste de dag nyid kyang 'bras bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'dres pa ste de dag nyid kyang 'bras bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and mixed with the effect, that is, they themselves become the effect.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu yang 'bras bu gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur la /üîΩde la rgyu'i tha snyad rnam par 'jog pa ni de nyid kyi 'bras bu la ltos la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu yang 'bras bu gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur la / de la rgyu'i tha snyad rnam par 'jog pa ni de nyid kyi 'bras bu la ltos la /
translated: Likewise, the effect becomes the cause of another effect.üîΩThe designation of the cause is based on that effect.

original: de 'bras bur grub pa yang rgyu la ltos shing /
analyzed: de 'bras bur grub pa yang rgyu la ltos shing /
translated: The establishment of that as an effect is based on the cause.

original: 'bras bu de yang gzhan gyi rgyur khas len dgos la /
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang gzhan gyi rgyur khas len dgos la /
translated: And that effect must be accepted as the cause of another.

original: de la rgyur tha snyad 'jog pa yang de nyid kyi 'bras bu grub pa la ltos shing /
analyzed: de la rgyur tha snyad 'jog pa yang de nyid kyi 'bras bu grub pa la ltos shing /
translated: The designation of that as a cause is based on the establishment of its effect.

original: de grub pa yang rgyu drug pa la ltos pas phan tshun brten pa thug pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de grub pa yang rgyu drug pa la ltos pas phan tshun brten pa thug pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And the establishment of that is based on the sixth cause. Thus there would be an infinite regress of mutual dependence.

original: de'i phyir 'di yod na 'di yod ces rten 'brel dngos po'i ngo bor brjod pa ni phyir zhing de nyid dgag pa byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yod na 'di yod ces rten 'brel dngos po'i ngo bor brjod pa ni phyir zhing de nyid dgag pa byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement that when this exists, that comes to be, as dependent origination in terms of the nature of things, would be a repetition of the refutation of that.

original: lan gyi don ni kho bo cag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni kun rdzob tu rang gi sems snang ba tsam yin zhing don dam par sems kyi ngo bor grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni kho bo cag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni kun rdzob tu rang gi sems snang ba tsam yin zhing don dam par sems kyi ngo bor grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reply is as follows. Our dependent origination is merely the appearance of one‚Äôs mind on the conventional level. On the ultimate level, it is not established as the entity of the mind.

original: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam sgyu ma lta bu nyid du 'dod pas /üîΩ'di yod pas 'di yod ces brjod kyang rgyu dang byed pa don dam pa'i dngos por smra ba /
analyzed: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam sgyu ma lta bu nyid du 'dod pas / 'di yod pas 'di yod ces brjod kyang rgyu dang byed pa don dam pa'i dngos por smra ba /
translated: We assert that it is mere conditionality, like an illusion.

original: phyi rol pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, although we say that because this exists, that comes to be, we are not the same as the non-Buddhists who propound that causes and actions are ultimate entities.

original: kun rdzob tu gang gi mjug thogs su gang zhig nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ma 'dres pa nyid du snang bas rgyu rkyen 'bras bu dang 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gang gi mjug thogs su gang zhig nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ma 'dres pa nyid du snang bas rgyu rkyen 'bras bu dang 'dres pa ste /
translated: Since the unmixed cause and effect of the conventional level are seen in the sense that something definitely arises in dependence on something else, cause, condition, and effect are not mixed.

original: phan tshun 'tshol ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i skyon yang med de /
analyzed: phan tshun 'tshol ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i skyon yang med de /
translated: There is no fault of their being mutually sought.

original: de'i phyir skur pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skur pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo ;
translated: Therefore, we do not fall to the extreme of nihilism.

original: / don dam par dpyad na de 'dra ba'i nyes pa la sogs pa dang 'brel bas rgyu 'bras yang dag pa'i dngos por khas mi len pa'o /
analyzed: / don dam par dpyad na de 'dra ba'i nyes pa la sogs pa dang 'brel bas rgyu 'bras yang dag pa'i dngos por khas mi len pa'o /
translated: When analyzed in terms of the ultimate, we do not accept cause and effect as real entities because of the faults such as those mentioned above.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis su 'gyur ba ni /üîΩphyi'i don dngos por khas len pa 'am /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis su 'gyur ba ni / phyi'i don dngos por khas len pa 'am /
translated: Thus, the two extremes areüîΩonly possible if one accepts external objects as real entities

original: sems nyid yang dag pa'i dngos por khas len pa la rigs kyi /
analyzed: sems nyid yang dag pa'i dngos por khas len pa la rigs kyi /
translated: or if one accepts mind itself as a real entity.üîΩ  But in my system, they are not

original: nga'i lugs la ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nga'i lugs la ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: possible.

original: blo gros chen pos yang gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don la brtsad pa spang ba ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos yang gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don la brtsad pa spang ba ste /
translated: Again, Mahamati asked, etc.

original: phyi rol pa gang dag sgra dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pas de lta bu'i brjod par yod pas brjod par bya ba'i don kyang yod do //
analyzed: phyi rol pa gang dag sgra dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pas de lta bu'i brjod par yod pas brjod par bya ba'i don kyang yod do //
translated: The non-Buddhists say that since words are used on the basis of the power of real entities, since there are such expressions, the objects of expression also exist.

original: gal te de @156b lta na chu klung gi 'gram na bu ram gyi shing rta brdal ba dag yod do zhes pa don gyis stong pa'i sgra dag dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de @156b lta na chu klung gi 'gram na bu ram gyi shing rta brdal ba dag yod do zhes pa don gyis stong pa'i sgra dag dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then one would observe words that are empty of meaning, such as ‚ÄúThere are sugarcane trees spread out on the bank of the river.‚Äù

original: bden te / de 'dra ba'i ngag gi sgra yul dang dus dang bcas pa brjod pa ni rang gi brjod par bya ba la 'khrul mod kyi /
analyzed: bden te / de 'dra ba'i ngag gi sgra yul dang dus dang bcas pa brjod pa ni rang gi brjod par bya ba la 'khrul mod kyi /
translated: True, but when such speech is uttered with a place and time, it is mistaken with respect to its object of expression.

original: tshig gi rang bzhin gyi sgra yul dang dus kyi khyad par du ma byas pa bum pa zhes brjod bya'i don la mi 'khrul ba ste /
analyzed: tshig gi rang bzhin gyi sgra yul dang dus kyi khyad par du ma byas pa bum pa zhes brjod bya'i don la mi 'khrul ba ste /
translated: But when the sound of the words is not specified by place and time, it is not mistaken with respect to the object of expression.üîΩBecause it is impossible for the object of such words to not exist in any place or time.

original: de 'dra ba'i tshig gi don yul lam dus gang yang rung ba na med pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod pa dgag pa'i don du zhu ba pos gleng bslang ba'o //üîΩbrjod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du grags pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni lus dang ngag gi rig byed 'ga' zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'ga' zhig tu don 'ga' zhig la brdar grags pa de nyid zhing thams cad du mthun par brdar grags pa
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i tshig gi don yul lam dus gang yang rung ba na med pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod pa dgag pa'i don du zhu ba pos gleng bslang ba'o // brjod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du grags pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni lus dang ngag gi rig byed 'ga' zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'ga' zhig tu don 'ga' zhig la brdar grags pa de nyid zhing thams cad du mthun par brdar grags pa
translated: The questioner raises this objection in order to refute that assertion.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not renowned in all buddhafields‚Äù means that the inarticulate sounds of body and speech are renowned as symbols for some objects in some buddhafields, but they are not renowned as symbols in all buddhafields in the same way.

original: brda ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa la ltos nas ji ltar brda byas pa de bzhin du de dag gi don go bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa la ltos nas ji ltar brda byas pa de bzhin du de dag gi don go bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sign is that, in dependence on the wish of the person, one is able to understand the meaning of those signs just as they were made.

original: de la snol zhes pa ni lus ngag gi snol lam zur tsam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la snol zhes pa ni lus ngag gi snol lam zur tsam bstan pa'o //
translated: In that regard, ‚Äúcrossing‚Äù is a crossing or a corner of the body or voice.

original: zhing dran pa ni sems kyi rgyu ba rags pa ste /
analyzed: zhing dran pa ni sems kyi rgyu ba rags pa ste /
translated: The field of memory is the coarse movement of the mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams la des mtshon nas zab mo'i don gzhan ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams la des mtshon nas zab mo'i don gzhan ston pa'o //
translated: The other profound meanings are indicated by that.

original: mig mi 'dzums par bltas pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa la sogs pa thob pa de nyid de thob pa'i brdar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mig mi 'dzums par bltas pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa la sogs pa thob pa de nyid de thob pa'i brdar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By looking without closing the eyes, the patience of nonarising dharmas, and so on, are obtained. That is the sign of obtaining that.

original: don ston byed kyi brda nges pa med pa de ni /
analyzed: don ston byed kyi brda nges pa med pa de ni /
translated: The sign that indicates the meaning is indefinite.

original: 'jig rten 'di nyid na yang snang ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nyid na yang snang ste /
translated: That is also seen in this world.

original: srin bu dang sbrang ma la sogs pa rnams mi rnams la brdar grags pa'i brjod pa med par lus kyi rig byed la sogs pa gzhan gyis phan tshun 'du ba la sogs par rang rang gi don ston pa'i bya ba byed pa'o /
analyzed: srin bu dang sbrang ma la sogs pa rnams mi rnams la brdar grags pa'i brjod pa med par lus kyi rig byed la sogs pa gzhan gyis phan tshun 'du ba la sogs par rang rang gi don ston pa'i bya ba byed pa'o /
translated: Insects, flies, and so forth, without the expressions known to humans, by means of other things such as bodily expressions, perform the function of teaching their own purposes, such as the need to come together.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de nyid rnam grangs gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de nyid rnam grangs gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyas par ston te /
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúThen the bodhisattva,‚Äù the buddha nature is taught extensively by means of other synonyms.

original: dri ba'i don mdo sde 'di dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa sems can thams cad la yod par gsungs pa rtag pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i don gang yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dri ba'i don mdo sde 'di dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa sems can thams cad la yod par gsungs pa rtag pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i don gang yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúIn this s≈´tra and in the Nirvana S≈´tra and so on, the buddha nature is said to be permanent, to have the nature of a self, and so on, and to exist in all sentient beings. What is the meaning of the terms ‚Äòpermanent‚Äô and so on?‚Äù

original: lan gyi don ni byis pa'i skye bo'i sems phyin ci log gi gzung yul ni de ltar snang ba phyin ci log gi blo @157a * //
analyzed: lan gyi don ni byis pa'i skye bo'i sems phyin ci log gi gzung yul ni de ltar snang ba phyin ci log gi blo @157a * //
translated: The meaning of the reply is that the objects of the mistaken mind of childish beings appear in that way to a mistaken mind.

original: nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that the object of the mistaken mind of childish beings is the nature of the mistaken mind itself, which appears in that way.

original: de'i de kho na nyid kyang 'phags pa rnams la snang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid kyang 'phags pa rnams la snang ba ste /
translated: The suchness of that also appears to the ƒÅryas.

original: de rnams la snang ba yang kun rdzob tu blo nyid kyi bdag nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de rnams la snang ba yang kun rdzob tu blo nyid kyi bdag nyid yin zhing /
translated: That which appears to them is also the nature of the mind conventionally.

original: blo yang don dam pa'i dngos pos stong la /
analyzed: blo yang don dam pa'i dngos pos stong la /
translated: The mind is also empty of ultimate entities.

original: de ltar snang zhing myong ba ma 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar snang zhing myong ba ma 'gags pa ste /
translated: That which appears and is experienced in that way is unceasing.

original: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the suchness of the union of awareness and emptiness.

original: de ni de las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Since it does not change into something else, it is also called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams la de las gzhan du snang bas /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams la de las gzhan du snang bas /
translated: Since it appears as something other than that to childish beings and so on,

original: de dag gi blo nor pa phyin ci log ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi blo nor pa phyin ci log ces kyang bya'o //
translated: their mind is also called ‚Äúmistaken‚Äù and ‚Äúerroneous.‚Äù

original: de ltar na phyin ci log gi de bzhin nyid rtag pa dang / de yang ma rtogs na 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na phyin ci log gi de bzhin nyid rtag pa dang / de yang ma rtogs na 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, the suchness of error is permanent, and if it is not realized, it becomes the cause of samsara.

original: phyogs 'ga' rtogs pa'am ji lta ba bzhin bdag nyid thams cad nas rtogs na /
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' rtogs pa'am ji lta ba bzhin bdag nyid thams cad nas rtogs na /
translated: If one realizes it in some way, or if one realizes it in all ways just as it is,

original: ci rigs par byang chub gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rigs zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par byang chub gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rigs zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: it becomes the cause of any of the three enlightenments, and thus it is also called the ‚Äúpotential for nirvana.‚Äù

original: de yang gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur ba ni gnas skabs la dgongs te /üîΩgsungs pa yin no zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de yang gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur ba ni gnas skabs la dgongs te / gsungs pa yin no zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the statement that it becomes the cause of the three is made with reference to the different stages.üîΩThis is taught extensively.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: The meaning of this is explained extensively in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: de la dpe'i don ni /
analyzed: de la dpe'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the example is as follows.

original: mi mkhas pa dag gis smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i dngos por yang dag pa par 'dzin pas nor pa phyin ci log ces kyang bya la /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa dag gis smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i dngos por yang dag pa par 'dzin pas nor pa phyin ci log ces kyang bya la /
translated: Since the unskilled apprehend a mirage and so on as real entities such as water, it is called ‚Äúerror‚Äù or ‚Äúmistakenness.‚Äù

original: yang de ltar snang bde nyid chu la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos pos stong la /
analyzed: yang de ltar snang bde nyid chu la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos pos stong la /
translated: Moreover, that which appears as such is empty of being real water and so on.

original: de ltar snang ba ma 'gags pa zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma tsam du rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba ma 'gags pa zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma tsam du rtogs te /
translated: Thus, the unceasing appearance is realized to be merely an illusion, the union of appearance and emptiness.

original: de ltar rtogs pa ni snang ba de'i de bzhin nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid mi 'gyur ba bzhin du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa ni snang ba de'i de bzhin nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid mi 'gyur ba bzhin du zhes pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is ‚Äújust like the unchanging reality of the suchness of that appearance.‚Äù

original: mig gi skye bu ni mig yor gyi khyad par skyes bur snang ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi skye bu ni mig yor gyi khyad par skyes bur snang ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúperson of the eye‚Äù is the appearance of a person in the particular eye-conjunction.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dpes mtshon pa'i don byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i blo nor pa dang rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas dpes mtshon pa'i don byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i blo nor pa dang rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the deluded mind of childish ordinary beings‚Ä¶‚Äù establishes the meaning illustrated by the example as delusion and permanence.

original: de la nor pa ni 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun par don gcig la 'gal ba'i rnam pa du mar snang bas so ;
analyzed: de la nor pa ni 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun par don gcig la 'gal ba'i rnam pa du mar snang bas so ;
translated: Therein, ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù is the appearance of many contradictory aspects in a single object, in a way that is not in accord with the noble ones.

original: / de'i de bzhin nyid rtag pa ni /
analyzed: / de'i de bzhin nyid rtag pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe suchness of that‚Äù is permanent

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: because it is free from existence and nonexistence.

original: nor pa phyin ci log gi blo de nyid don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub cing /
analyzed: nor pa phyin ci log gi blo de nyid don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub cing /
translated: That deluded, mistaken mind is not established as an ultimate entity.

original: de ltar snang ba tsam ma 'gags pas sngar bstan pa ltar zung du 'jug pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid yin @157b la /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba tsam ma 'gags pas sngar bstan pa ltar zung du 'jug pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid yin @157b la /
translated: Thus, because the mere appearance is not blocked, as previously explained, it is the illusion-like reality of union.

original: de ni de las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag ces pa'o //
translated: Since it does not change into something else, it is called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: de lta na rtag pa'o zhes mi ston par mi rtag par mi byed ces ston ba ci'i phyir zhe na 'dir rtag pa ther zug pa'i dngos por grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na rtag pa'o zhes mi ston par mi rtag par mi byed ces ston ba ci'i phyir zhe na 'dir rtag pa ther zug pa'i dngos por grub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, why is it taught that it is not impermanent, not teaching that it is permanent? Here, it is not that a permanent, eternal thing is established.

original: mi rtag pa'i dngos bo bkag pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid mi 'gyur ba tsam bstan pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i dngos bo bkag pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid mi 'gyur ba tsam bstan pa'i don du yin no //
translated: It is taught that the mere non-change of the illusion-like reality that refutes impermanent things is the meaning of the teaching.

original: ji ltar na zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar gyi gtan tshigs ma grub par brtsad pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar gyi gtan tshigs ma grub par brtsad pa spangs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú How is it?‚Äù and so on rejects the objection that the previous reason is not established.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i rlabs dang gang g'a'i chu la yi dags rnams kyis rnag khrag tu mthong zhing chur mi mthong ba dang / mi la sogs pa rnams kyis chur mthong zhing rnag khrag tu mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i rlabs dang gang g'a'i chu la yi dags rnams kyis rnag khrag tu mthong zhing chur mi mthong ba dang / mi la sogs pa rnams kyis chur mthong zhing rnag khrag tu mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as hungry ghosts see a river as pus and blood and not as water, and humans and so forth see it as water and not as pus and blood,

original: de ltar snang ba ni bden pa'i dngos po spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba ni bden pa'i dngos po spangs pa ste /
translated: so the appearance of things as real entities is refuted.

original: don gcig la 'gal ba du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la 'gal ba du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a single object to have many contradictory aspects.

original: yang rang rang gi shes pa'i don snang zhing don byed pas /
analyzed: yang rang rang gi shes pa'i don snang zhing don byed pas /
translated: Moreover, since the object of one‚Äôs consciousness appears and functions,

original: dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: it is also free from nonexistence.

original: deng de bzhin du byis pa thams cad spyod yul sna tshogs kyi phyir ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: deng de bzhin du byis pa thams cad spyod yul sna tshogs kyi phyir ro zhes pa ste /
translated: In the same way, all childish beings experience a variety of objects.

original: blo dang blo'i yul ji ltar snang zhing myong ba 'di nyid la kha cig gis ni phyi rol rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid du 'dzin la kha cig gis ni rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: blo dang blo'i yul ji ltar snang zhing myong ba 'di nyid la kha cig gis ni phyi rol rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid du 'dzin la kha cig gis ni rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig tu 'dzin cing /
translated: Some apprehend the object of consciousness as being the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles, while others apprehend it as a single coarse whole.

original: 'ga' zhig gis shes pa'i dngos po'i don dam par 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis shes pa'i dngos po'i don dam par 'dzin la /
translated: Some apprehend the ultimate reality of the entity of consciousness,

original: gzhan dag gis dngos po med pa'i snang ba tsam du rtogs pas 'gal ba 'du ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dngos po med pa'i snang ba tsam du rtogs pas 'gal ba 'du ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: while others understand it as a mere appearance of non-entity. Therefore, it is impossible for them to be in conflict.

original: nor pa ni dngos po ma yin la rang rang gi blo'i don de ltar snang zhing myong la /
analyzed: nor pa ni dngos po ma yin la rang rang gi blo'i don de ltar snang zhing myong la /
translated: Error is not an entity, but that object of one's own mind appears and is experienced in that way.

original: de yang kun rdzob tu grub pas dngos po med pa yang ma yin zhes pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar chu de bzhin du snang bas na zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob tu grub pas dngos po med pa yang ma yin zhes pa'o // 'di ltar chu de bzhin du snang bas na zhes pa ni /
translated: Moreover, since it is established conventionally, it is also not a non-entity.

original: 'di lta ste yi dags rnams kyis mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes pa dang sbyar te don ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste yi dags rnams kyis mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes pa dang sbyar te don ni sngar bstan to //
translated: Thus, it appears as water is connected with because it is seen and not seen by hungry ghosts, and the meaning has been explained above.

original: de ltar nor ba ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni skabs kyi don bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar nor ba ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni skabs kyi don bsdus pa ste /
translated: Thus, error... and so on summarizes the topic.

original: phyin ci log rnam par spangs pa ni byis pa ltar dngos po sna tshogs su 'dzin pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam par spangs pa ni byis pa ltar dngos po sna tshogs su 'dzin pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning error means abandoning the apprehension of various entities like a fool.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa ni snang zhing myong ba tsam ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa ni snang zhing myong ba tsam ma 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The avoidance of error is because mere appearance and experience are not blocked.

original: des na ye shes de'i ngo na dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'o //üîΩde ltar gtan tshigs nyid bsgrubs nas skabs kyi bsgrub @158a * //
analyzed: des na ye shes de'i ngo na dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'o // de ltar gtan tshigs nyid bsgrubs nas skabs kyi bsgrub @158a * //
translated: Therefore, in the perspective of that wisdom, entities and non-entities are avoided.

original: bya la sbyor ba ni /üîΩde ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bya la sbyor ba ni / de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having thus established the reason, the author applies it to the point to be proven:

original: nor pa'i de bzhin nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs ba zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: nor pa'i de bzhin nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs ba zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Thus, Mahamati, the suchness of error, which is the characteristic of the union that avoids the two extremes of entity and non-entity,

original: mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa /
translated: is not a different characteristic of signs.

original: nor pa'i chos nyid yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pas rtag pa'o //üîΩblo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: nor pa'i chos nyid yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pas rtag pa'o // blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: The reality of error is not different in terms of place, time, and so forth, and is therefore permanent.üîΩMahamati, etc. explains that meaning extensively.

original: blo gros chen po ji ltar na zhes pa la sogs pas nor pa de kho na nyid du sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ji ltar na zhes pa la sogs pas nor pa de kho na nyid du sgrub pa ste /
translated: Mahamati, etc. proves that error is suchness.

original: snga ma ltar nor pa 'phags pa rnams kyi yul du byas pa ltar /
analyzed: snga ma ltar nor pa 'phags pa rnams kyi yul du byas pa ltar /
translated: If it were the former, it would be the object of the noble ones.

original: de'i chos nyid de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: Its reality is thusness.

original: des na de'i chos nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i de kho na nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i chos nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i de kho na nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the reality of that which is not otherwise.

original: de yang ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gzugs ni de bzhin nyid kyi phyir zab po zhes pa'am /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gzugs ni de bzhin nyid kyi phyir zab po zhes pa'am /
translated: Moreover, it is just as the noble Perfection of Wisdom says, ‚ÄúForm is profound because of thusness.‚ÄùüîΩOr, ‚ÄúJust as the thusness of form is, so is form profound.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs zab po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs zab po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de la phyin ci log gi blo yang mi 'jug ces pa ni byis pa'i skye bo ltar dngos po sna tshogs su min zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi blo yang mi 'jug ces pa ni byis pa'i skye bo ltar dngos po sna tshogs su min zhes pa'o //
translated: There, the statement ‚Äúthe mistaken mind does not engage‚Äù means that it is not like the various things of ordinary beings.

original: de bzhin du snang zhing myong ba tsam la skur pa mi 'debs pas phyin ci ma log pa'i blor yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du snang zhing myong ba tsam la skur pa mi 'debs pas phyin ci ma log pa'i blor yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, since it does not deny mere appearance and experience, it is also not a non-mistaken mind.

original: des na 'phags pa rnams ni nor pa la rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa gyi na'am sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'phags pa rnams ni nor pa la rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa gyi na'am sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the noble ones realize that error and emptiness are united or illusion-like.

original: 'dir gyi na zhes blo'i mdun du byas pa'i mtshan ma de nyid bden nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gyi na zhes blo'i mdun du byas pa'i mtshan ma de nyid bden nam zhe na /
translated: Here, if one asks whether that very sign that is brought to mind is true,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not.

original: de ni byis pa rnams kyis brjod pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas btags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ni byis pa rnams kyis brjod pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas btags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: It is merely a designation that follows after the expressions of the childish.

original: 'di'i don zhib du ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib du ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of this has been explained in detail above.

original: blo gros chen po nor pa de yang zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu'am rigs nyid du ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po nor pa de yang zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu'am rigs nyid du ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, that error is also‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on teaches that it is the cause or lineage of both sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: byis pa'i skye bo'i sems phyin ci log de nyid byis pa rnams kyis phyin ci log sna tshogs su brtags pas 'khor ba nyid mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa ste bdag nyid thams cad phyogs 'ga' zhig nas ji lta ba bzhin rtogs na 'phags pa'i rigs nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo'i sems phyin ci log de nyid byis pa rnams kyis phyin ci log sna tshogs su brtags pas 'khor ba nyid mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa ste bdag nyid thams cad phyogs 'ga' zhig nas ji lta ba bzhin rtogs na 'phags pa'i rigs nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: The minds of childish beings are distorted, and because childish beings imagine various distortions, they create cyclic existence itself.

original: byang chub rnam pa gsum thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub rnam pa gsum thob par byed pa'o //
translated: When one realizes the nature of things just as it is from some perspective, one attains the state of an ƒÅrya and creates the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la @158b mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log de nyid kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag gi bdag med pa mi rtag pa du ma'i dngos por zhen cing /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la @158b mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log de nyid kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag gi bdag med pa mi rtag pa du ma'i dngos por zhen cing /
translated: Those who are attached to the characteristics of universals and particulars, who are attached to the characteristics of universals and particulars of that very distortion, who are attached to the nonexistence of a self of persons, who are attached to impermanence, who are attached to multiplicity,

original: gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas rang nyid 'ba' zhig grol ba don du gnyer bas ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas rang nyid 'ba' zhig grol ba don du gnyer bas ni /
translated: who seek liberation for themselves alone in dependence on the words of others,

original: nyan thos kyi rigs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: will become the ≈õrƒÅvaka type.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud ces pa ni phyin ci log dang de'i snang ba thams cad sems tsam nyid du rtogs shing /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud ces pa ni phyin ci log dang de'i snang ba thams cad sems tsam nyid du rtogs shing /
translated: The line one realizes that all appearances are one's own mind means that one realizes that all mistaken appearances are mind only.

original: sems kyang don dam pa'i dngos po med pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyang don dam pa'i dngos po med pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: One also realizes that the mind is ultimately unreal with nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ji lta ba bzhin bdag nyid thams cad nas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin bdag nyid thams cad nas rtogs pa'o //
translated: One realizes this in all its aspects just as it is.

original: 'khor ba'i theg pa'i rigs thob par byed pa yang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i theg pa'i rigs thob par byed pa yang /
translated: One also attains the lineage of the vehicle of cyclic existence.

original: de kho na nyid la rmongs pa'i ma rig pas phyin ci log pa gang zag gi bdag rtag pa ther zug pa'i dngos por brtags shing /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la rmongs pa'i ma rig pas phyin ci log pa gang zag gi bdag rtag pa ther zug pa'i dngos por brtags shing /
translated: One is mistaken about reality because of the ignorance that is confused about suchness, and one imagines a permanent, stable personal identity.

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba la ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba la ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: One is unmistaken about the relationship between actions and their results.

original: lha dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i don du sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas de dag nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i don du sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas de dag nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One attains the states of gods, Brahma, and so forth by practicing generosity, pleasant speech, and so forth, and by cultivating meditative concentration and the immeasurables.üîΩ üîΩOne attains the lineage of the vehicle of cyclic existence means that one attains the lineage of the vehicle of cyclic existence.

original: lha'i theg dang tshangs pa'i theg pa zhes pa la sogs pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i theg dang tshangs pa'i theg pa zhes pa la sogs pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will teach the Vehicle of the Gods, the Vehicle of Brahma, and so forth.

original: 'ga' zhig gis ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba yang phyin ci log sna tshogs su brtags pas ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba yang phyin ci log sna tshogs su brtags pas ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Some will imagine the connection between action and effect in various distorted ways, and so will go to the lower realms.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas don bsdus pa ste /
translated: The summary is stated beginning with ‚ÄúMahamati, those who have transcended the stage of the two vehicles‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rnam par brtags pa ni de'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ni de'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInvestigated‚Äù means in accordance with their nature.

original: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags gzhan du gyur pas ni chos kyi sku'i ye shes thob par 'gyur la des na de ni mthar thug pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin zhing /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags gzhan du gyur pas ni chos kyi sku'i ye shes thob par 'gyur la des na de ni mthar thug pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin zhing /
translated: By the transformation of the latent tendencies of negative propensities, the wisdom of the dharmakaya is attained. Therefore, in the ultimate sense, the Tathagata lineage is that.

original: de rnams kyis kyang de nyid ji lta bu bzhin du rtogs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang de nyid ji lta bu bzhin du rtogs te /
translated: And they too realize it just as it is.

original: rtogs pa'i don de nyid nor pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don de nyid nor pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That very object of realization is called ‚Äúthe suchness of non-error.‚Äù

original: tshig 'di nyid ces pa'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: tshig 'di nyid ces pa'i tshig gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words ‚Äújust this.‚Äù

original: rtog pa rnams kyis kyang rnam par spangs pa ni phyin ci log gi chos nyid brtag bya'i yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams kyis kyang rnam par spangs pa ni phyin ci log gi chos nyid brtag bya'i yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso abandoned by conceptual thoughts‚Äù means that the reality of error is beyond the object of investigation.

original: smras pa yin no zhes pa ni rtog dang brtag pa spangs zhes pa la sogs pa mdo sde 'di nyid dang / phyogs gzhan yang ngo /
analyzed: smras pa yin no zhes pa ni rtog dang brtag pa spangs zhes pa la sogs pa mdo sde 'di nyid dang / phyogs gzhan yang ngo /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù refers to the avoidance of investigation and investigator, and so on, in this very sutra and in other sutras.

original: mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni dngos por sgro btags pa ste /üîΩde dang mthun par yod @159a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni dngos por sgro btags pa ste / de dang mthun par yod @159a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment to characteristics‚Äù is the superimposition of entities.

original: pa ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: pa ma yin pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not exist in accordance with that‚ÄùüîΩmeans that it does not exist in accordance with the way it is imagined.

original: / de bzhin du 'gyur zhes pa ni de dag gis skye pa don dam pa nyid du brtags pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'gyur zhes pa ni de dag gis skye pa don dam pa nyid du brtags pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be like that‚Äù means that it would be in accordance with the imagination of the ultimate arising of those.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, if that were the case‚Äù and so on.

original: nor ba sgyu ma lta bu yin na sgyu ma ni rkyen las skyes pa don byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: nor ba sgyu ma lta bu yin na sgyu ma ni rkyen las skyes pa don byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: If error were like an illusion, an illusion arises from conditions and has the nature of performing a function.

original: 'di yang nor pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur bas thar pa nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang nor pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur bas thar pa nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, since this error would be the cause of other errors, liberation would not be tenable.

original: lan gyi don ni sgyu ma nyid du rtogs shing /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni sgyu ma nyid du rtogs shing /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúresponse‚Äù is that one realizes illusion itself,

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid du rnam par ma brtags na /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid du rnam par ma brtags na /
translated: and if one does not imagine it to be the identity of a real thing,

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa thob par mi byed de /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa thob par mi byed de /
translated: one does not incur the fault of taking up negative propensities.

original: nyon mongs pa'am de'i bag chags kun nas slong par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'am de'i bag chags kun nas slong par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not arouse afflictions or their latent tendencies.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is said:

original: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po 'ga' //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po 'ga' //
translated: For example, some illusionists

original: sprul pa thar par bya phyir brtson //
analyzed: sprul pa thar par bya phyir brtson //
translated: strive to liberate emanations.

original: gang phyir 'di de mngon shes pas //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di de mngon shes pas //
translated: Because they directly perceive that,

original: de ni sprul la chags pa med //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sprul la chags pa med // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are not attached to emanations.

original: blo gros chen po sgyu ma ni zhes pa la sogs pas dpe'i sgyu ma ni sems dang mi ldan pas de nyid kyang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po sgyu ma ni zhes pa la sogs pas dpe'i sgyu ma ni sems dang mi ldan pas de nyid kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, an illusion‚Äù and so on. The example of an illusion is not endowed with a mind.

original: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyi mthu las byung ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyi mthu las byung ba ma yin zhing /
translated: It does not arise from the power of the latent tendencies of negative propensities,

original: de 'dra ba gzhan yang thob par mi byed pas rtag tu 'khor bar skye ba ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de 'dra ba gzhan yang thob par mi byed pas rtag tu 'khor bar skye ba ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: and it does not cause one to attain anything else like it. Therefore it is not born in sa·πÉsƒÅra forever.

original: 'dir yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here it is the same.

original: de ni blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas nor ba gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de ni blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas nor ba gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ba ni /
translated: That is taught by ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, etc.‚Äù

original: gang ci yang rung mngon par chags pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes ston to //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung mngon par chags pa ma yin no // zhes ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúI do not cling to anything whatsoever.‚Äù

original: nor pa mi mthong ba zhes pa ni byis pas mthong ba dang mthun par mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: nor pa mi mthong ba zhes pa ni byis pas mthong ba dang mthun par mi mthong zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúNot seeing error‚Äù means not seeing in accordance with the way that is seen by the childish.

original: yang dag pa'i dngos por yang 'phags pa'i gnas skabs der mthong ba min no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dngos por yang 'phags pa'i gnas skabs der mthong ba min no //
translated: And also, in the state of the ƒÅryas, it is not that one does not see the real thing.

original: gal te mtshan mar skyer zin na zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar sgyu ma 'am gyi na zhes pa'i mtshan mar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mtshan mar skyer zin na zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar sgyu ma 'am gyi na zhes pa'i mtshan mar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were to arise as a sign‚Äù means that, as previously taught, it is a superimposition as a sign, such as an illusion or a mirage.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i don nyid gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i don nyid gsal bar ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.‚Äù clarifies the meaning of the statement that everything is like an illusion.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa sgyu mar med pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa sgyu mar med pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The illusory elephant, etc. are not nonexistent as illusions.

original: yang dag pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pa dang chos mthun par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pa dang chos mthun par mthong ba'o //
translated: And one sees that they are similar to the real thing in that they do not exist as real things.

original: sgyu ma snga tshogs la mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu lags sam /
analyzed: sgyu ma snga tshogs la mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu lags sam /
translated: Are all phenomena like illusions due to the characteristic of manifest attachment to the former collection of illusions?

original: des te log pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis lags zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: des te log pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis lags zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdue to that‚Äù is due to the characteristic of manifest attachment to error.

original: sgyu ma sna tshogs la dngos po'i @159b bdag nyid yang dag pa ba la sogs par sgro btags pa bzhin du /
analyzed: sgyu ma sna tshogs la dngos po'i @159b bdag nyid yang dag pa ba la sogs par sgro btags pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as various illusions are exaggerated as having the nature of real things and so on,

original: de ltar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin de nyid nas sgyu ma lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin de nyid nas sgyu ma lta bu yin nam /
translated: are those imputed natures like illusions from their own side?

original: 'on te de ltar sgro 'dogs pa phyin ci log gi blo la de ltar snang zhing myong ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las //
analyzed: 'on te de ltar sgro 'dogs pa phyin ci log gi blo la de ltar snang zhing myong ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las //
translated: Or do they appear and are experienced as such to the mistaken mind that exaggerates them in that way, due to the characteristic of the dependent?

original: sgyu ma lta bu lags zhes rtogs pa'o ;üîΩ/ de la phyogs dang po ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu lags zhes rtogs pa'o ; / de la phyogs dang po ni mi 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúlike illusions‚Äù is understood.

original: sgyu ma ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The first position is untenable because illusions are dependently arisen.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa'i kun brtags ni rgyu med par tshad mas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang dag pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa'i kun brtags ni rgyu med par tshad mas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the various imagined characteristics of real things such as form are seen by valid cognition to be causeless.

original: gal te 'dir rgyu yod na de yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dir rgyu yod na de yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a cause here, it would be dependent on another.

original: de la log pa la mngon par chags zhes pa ni de ltar snang zhing myong ba tsam yin gyi don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs par mngon par brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la log pa la mngon par chags zhes pa ni de ltar snang zhing myong ba tsam yin gyi don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs par mngon par brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: As for attachment to the unreal, it is merely the appearance and experience of that, not the imagined appearance of ultimate things and so on.

original: mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words by their characteristics.

original: chags pa dang rjes su mthun par de ltar snang zhing brtags pa la sogs pa'i ldog pa de nyid nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang rjes su mthun par de ltar snang zhing brtags pa la sogs pa'i ldog pa de nyid nas zhes pa'o //
translated: From that very place refers to the cessation of the appearance and imputation of that which accords with attachment.

original: sgyu ma lta bu lags na ni zhes pa ni de ltar bzhed na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu lags na ni zhes pa ni de ltar bzhed na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If it is like an illusion means if it is accepted as such.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis zhes pa la sogs pas don snga ma nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis zhes pa la sogs pas don snga ma nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, by what... and so on elaborates on the previous meaning.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la ni dngos su nyes pa ma brjod kyi /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la ni dngos su nyes pa ma brjod kyi /
translated: In the second case, the fault is not directly stated.

original: sems tsam pa dag de ni dngos po'i ngo bo don dam pa ma yin pas sgyu mar mi 'thad ces don gyis rgol ba'o //
analyzed: sems tsam pa dag de ni dngos po'i ngo bo don dam pa ma yin pas sgyu mar mi 'thad ces don gyis rgol ba'o //
translated: The CittamƒÅtra school argues implicitly that since that nature of things is not ultimate, it is not tenable that it is an illusion.

original: lan gyi don ni phyogs dang po ni khas mi len la /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni phyogs dang po ni khas mi len la /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that the first position is not accepted.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te phyin ci log ni kun rdzob tu myur ba'i glog dang 'dra bar skad cig ma'i bdag nyid snga ma snga ma rnams kyi dbang gis 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te phyin ci log ni kun rdzob tu myur ba'i glog dang 'dra bar skad cig ma'i bdag nyid snga ma snga ma rnams kyi dbang gis 'byung ba yin la /
translated: From the perspective of the second position, error is like a flash of lightning in the relative, arising by the power of the previous instants that are momentary.

original: don dam par de 'dra ba'i ngo bo'i mi 'thad pas tshul de nyid nas sgyu ma la bu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par de 'dra ba'i ngo bo'i mi 'thad pas tshul de nyid nas sgyu ma la bu zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it has such an essence ultimately, from that perspective it is an illusion.

original: glog 'gyu ba skad cig du 'jig pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: glog 'gyu ba skad cig du 'jig pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as lightning is destroyed in many instants,

original: 'du byed rnams kyang zhig par lta ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang zhig par lta ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mthong ba ni /
translated: yogis see conditioned things as destroyed.

original: byis pa rnams la mi snang ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la mi snang ste /
translated: This is not seen by childish beings.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung dang yod pa dmigs pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung dang yod pa dmigs pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obscured by the causes of error, such as the arising of another similar one, the perception of existence, and so on.

original: de bzhin du dngos por snang ba thams cad rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos por snang ba thams cad rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Likewise, all appearances as entities are the apprehended, the general characteristics of one‚Äôs own concepts.

original: de la de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: That is analyzed in that way.
