original: sgyu ma ni rten 'brel yin pas ma skyes par gsungs pa dang 'gal la /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni rten 'brel yin pas ma skyes par gsungs pa dang 'gal la /
translated: Since illusion is a dependent arising, it is contradictory to say that it is unproduced.

original: gzhan yang dngos po ni rgyu med par mi 'thad kyang ma skyes par gsungs pa dang 'gal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po ni rgyu med par mi 'thad kyang ma skyes par gsungs pa dang 'gal zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is contradictory to say that things are not tenable without a cause, and that they are unproduced.

original: lan gyi don ni kun tu skye ba dang skye ba med par snang ba sems tsam du rtogs shing de la phyi rol gyi dngos po med par sngar bstan pa ltar rgyu yod pa dang med pa las mi skye bar mthong bas phyi rol gyi ngo bor ma
analyzed: lan gyi don ni kun tu skye ba dang skye ba med par snang ba sems tsam du rtogs shing de la phyi rol gyi dngos po med par sngar bstan pa ltar rgyu yod pa dang med pa las mi skye bar mthong bas phyi rol gyi ngo bor ma
translated: The meaning of the reply is as follows. The appearance of complete production and non-production is understood to be mind only. As was previously explained, since one sees that external things do not exist, one sees that they are not produced from an existent or non-existent cause. Therefore, they are not produced as external entities.

original: skyes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa yang yin la /
translated: They are also unproduced.

original: rig pa sgyu ma lta bu yin pas 'gal ba med cing /
analyzed: rig pa sgyu ma lta bu yin pas 'gal ba med cing /
translated: Since they are like an awareness that is an illusion, there is no contradiction.

original: don dam par sems nyid rig pa'i skye ba yang mi 'thad la //
analyzed: don dam par sems nyid rig pa'i skye ba yang mi 'thad la //
translated: Ultimately, the production of mind itself, which is awareness, is not tenable.

original: kun rdzob tu skye bar grub pas ma skyes pa dang sgyu ma lta bu la 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu skye bar grub pas ma skyes pa dang sgyu ma lta bu la 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: Since it is established that it is produced conventionally, there is no contradiction between being unproduced and being like an illusion.

original: mu stegs byed kyis 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ni don dam pa pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ni don dam pa pa'o //
translated: The cause and effect asserted by the tƒ´rthikas are ultimate.

original: yang dngos por bstan pa ni kun rdzob pa'i dngos po kun rdzob tu rgyu las skye ba yin pas don dam par ma skyes pa dang 'gal ba med pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: yang dngos por bstan pa ni kun rdzob pa'i dngos po kun rdzob tu rgyu las skye ba yin pas don dam par ma skyes pa dang 'gal ba med pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: Moreover, the teaching of entities is clear in that conventional entities arise from causes conventionally, and there is no contradiction with their not arising ultimately.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa la 'khor ba yongs su bzung ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa la 'khor ba yongs su bzung ba ni /
translated: The purpose of such a teaching is the thorough embrace of cyclic existence.

original: nga'i slob ma rnams zhes pa la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: nga'i slob ma rnams zhes pa la sogs pas ston te /
translated: This is indicated by ‚Äúmy disciples‚Äù and so forth.

original: sems nyid rig pa tsam gyi rgyun dngos por yod cing las dang 'bras bu'i bye brag la la sogs pa bstan pas /üîΩ'ga' zhig ni skye ba gzhan du rang gi sems rgyud sdug bsngal dang 'brel pas 'jigs nas de las ldog pa'i don du zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge ba'am /
analyzed: sems nyid rig pa tsam gyi rgyun dngos por yod cing las dang 'bras bu'i bye brag la la sogs pa bstan pas / 'ga' zhig ni skye ba gzhan du rang gi sems rgyud sdug bsngal dang 'brel pas 'jigs nas de las ldog pa'i don du zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dge ba'am /
translated: Since the continuum of mere awareness, the mind itself, is taught to be an existent entity and the various particulars of karma and its effects are taught,

original: mi g-yo ba'i las sna tshogs gyis lha la sogs pa skye ba'i gnas yongs su 'dzin la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las sna tshogs gyis lha la sogs pa skye ba'i gnas yongs su 'dzin la /
translated: some, fearing that their mind-stream will be connected with suffering in other lives, will turn away from that and thoroughly embrace the abodes of birth as gods and so on through various virtuous contaminated actions or immovable actions.

original: 'ga' zhig ni gzhan sdug bsngal las thar pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni gzhan sdug bsngal las thar pa'i don du /
translated: Some, for the sake of liberating others from suffering,

original: las dang smon lam la sogs pas 'khor bar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: las dang smon lam la sogs pas 'khor bar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It is the grasping of birth in cyclic existence through karma, aspirations, and so on.

original: de'i don du dngos po'i sgra la smos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du dngos po'i sgra la smos pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúentity‚Äù is used in this context to refer to that.

original: yang dag pa'i gnas ji lta ba ni yang dag pa'i gnas lugs ji lta ba @160b ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gnas ji lta ba ni yang dag pa'i gnas lugs ji lta ba @160b ste /
translated: The ‚Äúcorrect reality‚Äù is the correct way of being.

original: de dang mi mthun par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seeing in a way that is contrary to that.

original: bzlog pa ni don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni don dam pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúopposite‚Äù is the apprehension of the nature of ultimate entities and so on.

original: glan pa ni phyin ci log las bzlog nas yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: glan pa ni phyin ci log las bzlog nas yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo turn away‚Äù means to turn away from error and to establish the correct view.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan gsungs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the thus-gone heart‚Äù teaches the reasons for ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, the path that purifies the thus-gone heart.

original: de la rab tu rtogs pa ni de rnams la brten nas dran pa dang shes rab kyi cha ru gtogs pa chos zab mo la bzod pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzungs thob pa ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu rtogs pa ni de rnams la brten nas dran pa dang shes rab kyi cha ru gtogs pa chos zab mo la bzod pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzungs thob pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù is the attainment of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ that serves as the cause for the acceptance of the profound Dharma, which is included in the aspects of mindfulness and wisdom that are based on those.

original: de nyid kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa dang / dngos po mtha'i dmigs pa dang gsum thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa dang / dngos po mtha'i dmigs pa dang gsum thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: That is also the object of observation of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, and the object of observation of the end of entities.

original: rjes su mi 'brang ba ni de rnams la brten nas mtshan ma sna tshogs su mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mi 'brang ba ni de rnams la brten nas mtshan ma sna tshogs su mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Not following is not conceiving the various signs in dependence on those.

original: de las zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par gzhag pa tsam du de rnams kyi bye brag ma 'dres par ston te /
analyzed: de las zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par gzhag pa tsam du de rnams kyi bye brag ma 'dres par ston te /
translated: From that, etc. teaches the unmixed specific characteristics of those, which are merely posited.

original: de la ming gi tshogs ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig mdun du byas te /
analyzed: de la ming gi tshogs ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig mdun du byas te /
translated: Among those, the collection of names is, for example, having placed some entity such as a vase in front of oneself,

original: de nyid tha snyad kyi dus su go bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ni bum pa zhes ming du btags pa dang / de 'dra ba'i rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid tha snyad kyi dus su go bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ni bum pa zhes ming du btags pa dang / de 'dra ba'i rigs can rnams so //
translated: in order to make it understood at the time of convention, it is designated with the name ‚Äúvase‚Äù and those that have a similar type.

original: dngos po zhes pa ni dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: dngos po zhes pa ni dngos po tsam mo //
translated: Entity is mere entity.

original: tshig gi tshogs ni tshig gi don mang po ste /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni tshig gi don mang po ste /
translated: The collection of words is many meanings of words.

original: ming la sogs pa du ma 'dus pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu'i 'jug ldog gi yul ston pa phyogs che ge mo zhig na bum pa yod ces pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa du ma 'dus pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu'i 'jug ldog gi yul ston pa phyogs che ge mo zhig na bum pa yod ces pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The name, etc., are the objects of the engagement and disengagement of the person who seeks the meaning of the collection of many names, etc.

original: don mang po bden pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: don mang po bden pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The many meanings are true in the conventional sense.

original: gdon mi za ba ni tshig gi don de ltar yin gyi gzhan du ma yin zhes the tsom gyi gnas spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ni tshig gi don de ltar yin gyi gzhan du ma yin zhes the tsom gyi gnas spangs pa'o //
translated: The certain is the elimination of the basis of doubt, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the word is just this, not otherwise.‚Äù

original: thug pa ni don de dag tsam du zad pa'o //
analyzed: thug pa ni don de dag tsam du zad pa'o //
translated: The final is the mere exhaustion of those meanings.

original: dmigs pa zhes pa ni tshig dang 'dres par snang ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes pa ni tshig dang 'dres par snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance is the appearance mixed with the word.

original: 'dir tshig gi don la tshig gi tshogs zhes ston pa ni tshig las tha dad pa'i don grub pa med ces rtogs par bya ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don la tshig gi tshogs zhes ston pa ni tshig las tha dad pa'i don grub pa med ces rtogs par bya ba'i don du ste /
translated: Here, the teaching of the collection of words in the meaning of the word is for the purpose of understanding that the established meaning is not different from the word.

original: ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as previously explained.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge go rims su bkod pa'i khyad par gang gis ming dang tshig rnams 'grub par byed cing snang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge go rims su bkod pa'i khyad par gang gis ming dang tshig rnams 'grub par byed cing snang bar byed pa ste /
translated: The collection of letters is the particular arrangement of letters that establishes and makes manifest the names and phrases.

original: yi ge dang mtshan rtags dang / don nges par ston pa'i mtshan ma dang / don dang 'brel bar dmigs pa dang / rang gi don la 'di'o zhes 'dogs pa ste rnam grangs @161a * //
analyzed: yi ge dang mtshan rtags dang / don nges par ston pa'i mtshan ma dang / don dang 'brel bar dmigs pa dang / rang gi don la 'di'o zhes 'dogs pa ste rnam grangs @161a * //
translated: The definition of name is that which is the basis for the expression of meaning.üîΩThe definition of phrase is that which expresses the individual characteristics of the meaning.üîΩThe definition of letter is that which is the basis for the expression of name.üîΩThe definition of sign is that which definitely indicates the meaning.üîΩThe definition of object is that which is observed as being related to the meaning.üîΩThe definition of designation is that which designates its own meaning as this.

original: su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The letters, the signs, the signs that definitely indicate the meaning, the objective reference that is connected with the meaning, and the designation of one's own meaning as this‚Äîthese are included in the enumeration.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas 'chad pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas 'chad pa ste //
translated: Moreover, etc. explains those very things from another point of view.

original: de la tshig thug pa ni yi ge dpag tu med pa du ma 'brel ba gnas thug pa med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la tshig thug pa ni yi ge dpag tu med pa du ma 'brel ba gnas thug pa med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therein, the verbal end is not the endless abode of the connection of many, many, immeasurable letters.

original: cung zad tsam du rgya chad pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad tsam du rgya chad pa'o //
translated: It is the limitation of a mere little.

original: aa dang ha'i bar ni dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi yi ge gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: aa dang ha'i bar ni dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi yi ge gzhan rnams so //
translated: The range between a and ha is the other vowels and consonants.

original: yi ge'i mjug ni dbyangs kyi tha ma /
analyzed: yi ge'i mjug ni dbyangs kyi tha ma /
translated: The end of the letters is the end of the vowels.

original: aa: drag po 'am aa nyid dam yi ge ksha zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aa: drag po 'am aa nyid dam yi ge ksha zhes pa'o //
translated: The a·∏• is the fierce one, or the a itself, or the letter k·π£a.

original: gzhan yang glang po dang rta la sogs pa phung po gzugs can dang 'brel ba rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan yang glang po dang rta la sogs pa phung po gzugs can dang 'brel ba rnams te /
translated: Moreover, the aggregates that are connected with the physical body, such as the elephant and the horse,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i brdar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i brdar gyur ba'o //
translated: are the symbols of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: sa la 'gro ba rnams zhes pa ni res 'ga' mkha' la rgyu ba bya'i skye gnas rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: sa la 'gro ba rnams zhes pa ni res 'ga' mkha' la rgyu ba bya'i skye gnas rnams kyang ste /
translated: Those who move on the earth are those who are born from eggs, and sometimes those who move in the sky.

original: de rnams kyang phal cher sa la 'gro bas so //üîΩyang ming bzhi'i phung po ni ming gis brjod pa 'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyang phal cher sa la 'gro bas so // yang ming bzhi'i phung po ni ming gis brjod pa 'am /
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who move on the earth‚Äù because they mostly move on the earth.

original: ming ltar thogs pa med pa'i phyir ming ngo //
analyzed: ming ltar thogs pa med pa'i phyir ming ngo //
translated: The four name aggregates are called ‚Äúname‚Äù because they are expressed by name or because they are unobstructing like name.

original: yi ge'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis snang ba byed ces pa ni de las yi ge spyi'i rnam par snang bar 'byung zhing de las don go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yi ge'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis snang ba byed ces pa ni de las yi ge spyi'i rnam par snang bar 'byung zhing de las don go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The appearance of the characteristics of letters is the appearance of the general form of letters, and from that, meaning is understood.

original: dngos su yi ge rang gi mtshan nyid ni don rjod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su yi ge rang gi mtshan nyid ni don rjod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The actual characteristics of letters do not express meaning,

original: skabs gzhan du shes par zad do //
analyzed: skabs gzhan du shes par zad do //
translated: but this is understood in other contexts.

original: de lta na phung po gzugs can dang 'brel ba rnams kyang ming gis brjod par bya zhing yi ge'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis snang bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na phung po gzugs can dang 'brel ba rnams kyang ming gis brjod par bya zhing yi ge'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis snang bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the form aggregates and those related to the form aggregates are also expressed by name, but they are not expressed by the characteristics of letters.

original: de ltar bden mod kyi de ni rgyu ba rags pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi de ni rgyu ba rags pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This is true, but they are not expressed by the characteristics of letters because they are coarse movements.

original: ming la sogs pas ma mtshon kyang blun po rnams kyis rtogs par 'gyur bas de dag tsam la dgongs te de ltar ma gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la khyod kyis 'dris par bya zhes pa'i don ni thog mar zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan nyid du aa la sogs pa'i yi ge re re 'am /
analyzed: ming la sogs pas ma mtshon kyang blun po rnams kyis rtogs par 'gyur bas de dag tsam la dgongs te de ltar ma gsungs pa'o // de la khyod kyis 'dris par bya zhes pa'i don ni thog mar zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan nyid du aa la sogs pa'i yi ge re re 'am /
translated: Although not indicated by names and so on, the foolish will understand.

original: du ma 'dus pa ste ming dang tshig gi bdag nyid aa pa ra tsa na zhes pa la sogs pa dbyibs su bris pa'i yi ge la sems 'dris par bya ba ste /
analyzed: du ma 'dus pa ste ming dang tshig gi bdag nyid aa pa ra tsa na zhes pa la sogs pa dbyibs su bris pa'i yi ge la sems 'dris par bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúyou should become familiar with it‚Äù is that at first, as the cause of ≈õamatha, you should become familiar with the mind on a single letter such as a or on many letters combined, such as aparacita, which are the nature of names and phrases and are written in the shape of letters.üîΩFurthermore, it is as stated in the following:

original: de yang / dmigs pa la ni sems gtad nas //
analyzed: de yang / dmigs pa la ni sems gtad nas //
translated: Having directed the mind to the object of meditation,

original: de rgyun rnam par g-yeng mi bya //
analyzed: de rgyun rnam par g-yeng mi bya //
translated: do not be distracted from its continuity.

original: rnam g-yeng myur du shes byas nas //
analyzed: rnam g-yeng myur du shes byas nas //
translated: Quickly recognize distraction,

original: de la slar yang glan par bya //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: de la slar yang glan par bya // zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: and again turn the mind back to the object.

original: de ltar dmigs pa brtan par gyur pa dang spro ba dang bsdu ba la bslab par bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa brtan par gyur pa dang spro ba dang bsdu ba la bslab par bya zhing /
translated: In this way, when the object of meditation is stable, you should train in expanding and gathering.

original: brjod pa'i yi ge la yang bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i yi ge la yang bslab par bya'o //
translated: You should also train in the letters of the alphabet.

original: de rnams @161b la rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams @161b la rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: The attainment of one-pointed concentration on those is the attainment of the object of observation of serenity, the non-conceptual image.

original: de nas aa la sogs pa'i don skye ba med pa la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas aa la sogs pa'i don skye ba med pa la bslab par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should train in the meaning of the letters such as ‚Äúa‚Äù and so forth, which is non-production.

original: de dag nyid sngar thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyis spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa'i don dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid sngar thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyis spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa'i don dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should also apply those to the meaning that was previously understood in a general way through the wisdom of hearing and contemplation.

original: de ltar skye ba med pa'i don la rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med pa'i don la rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, one-pointedness with respect to the meaning of non-production is also the attainment of the object of observation of the culmination of things.

original: de'i sngon rol du don de nyid spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gi dmigs pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sngon rol du don de nyid spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gi dmigs pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: Prior to that, the understanding of that meaning in a general way is the attainment of the object of observation of insight, the conceptual image.

original: de ltar dmigs pa gsum thob pa nyid gong nas gong du bsgoms pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyangs bar gyur pa na dgos pa yongs su 'grub pa'i dmigs pa thob cing /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa gsum thob pa nyid gong nas gong du bsgoms pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyangs bar gyur pa na dgos pa yongs su 'grub pa'i dmigs pa thob cing /
translated: Thus, by cultivating the three objects of meditation that have been attained, when the essence of the tathƒÅgata is purified, one attains the object of meditation for accomplishing the purpose,

original: chos kyi sku'i ye shes mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ye shes mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: and one realizes the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs kyi tshogs bstan pa las /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs kyi tshogs bstan pa las /
translated: Thus, in the teaching of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of the perfection of wisdom of the noble ones,

original: aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúA is the gateway of all phenomena because it is non-arisen.

original: ra zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ra zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Ra is the gateway of all phenomena because it is free from dust.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: And in other sources,

original: aa ni yi ge kun gyi mchog / ces pa la sogs pa dang / yi ge drug po rdo rje'i sgra //
analyzed: aa ni yi ge kun gyi mchog / ces pa la sogs pa dang / yi ge drug po rdo rje'i sgra //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúA is the supreme of all letters‚Äù and so forth, and ‚ÄúThe sound of the six syllables is the vajra sound,

original: 'jam dbyangs chen po sgra chen po //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dbyangs chen po sgra chen po // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the great Ma√±jugho·π£a, the great sound.‚Äù

original: 'di'i don zhib tu ni bla ma'i kha las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib tu ni bla ma'i kha las shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood in detail from the guru‚Äôs instruction.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang po'i las kyi sar gnas gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang po'i las kyi sar gnas gang //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides on the stage of the beginner,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas sangs rgyas byang chub mchog zhugs pa //üîΩslob ma bzang po bla ma gus ldan de dag gis //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas sangs rgyas byang chub mchog zhugs pa // slob ma bzang po bla ma gus ldan de dag gis //
translated: With superior intention, enters the supreme enlightenment of the Buddha.üîΩThose good students who are respectful to the guru

original: bla ma mkhas pa rnams la rtag tu brten par bya //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma mkhas pa rnams la rtag tu brten par bya // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Always rely on the wise gurus.

original: 'di rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang /
translated: And so on.

original: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: yi ge med par ji ltar gsungs //
translated: How are these taught in the non-syllabic?

original: ci yis rnam par mi rtog 'gyur //
analyzed: ci yis rnam par mi rtog 'gyur //
translated: By what does one become non-conceptual?

original: zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied as the answer to the question.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas mi mkhas pa gang dag sngar yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa ni g-yang sa'i gnas kyi mtha' nyid du gsungs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas mi mkhas pa gang dag sngar yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa ni g-yang sa'i gnas kyi mtha' nyid du gsungs pa la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, the unwise ones who superimpose with a conceptual mind that conceives of the signs of existence, nonexistence, and so on, are said to be in a place of an abyss.

original: gzhan du khyad par gyi gzhi 'ga' zhig khas blangs nas de nyid yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos gang gis bsdus pa khyad par de rnams gang yin zhes dris pa'i dus su /
analyzed: gzhan du khyad par gyi gzhi 'ga' zhig khas blangs nas de nyid yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos gang gis bsdus pa khyad par de rnams gang yin zhes dris pa'i dus su /
translated: Otherwise, if one accepts some basis of distinction, and when asked, ‚ÄúWhat are those distinctions that are included by the attributes of existence, nonexistence, and so on?‚Äù

original: de dag ni lung bstan par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni lung bstan par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: one should not propound them,

original: mtha' nyid du 'gyur ba'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: mtha' nyid du 'gyur ba'o zhes zer te /
translated: because that would be an extreme.

original: de yang bdag nyid rigs pa mi shes pas gang yang rung ba cig tu lung bstan @162a * //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid rigs pa mi shes pas gang yang rung ba cig tu lung bstan @162a * //
translated: Moreover, because one does not know the reasoning, one propounds something,

original: pa na pha rol mkhas pas skyon brjod kyis dogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa na pha rol mkhas pas skyon brjod kyis dogs pa'o //
translated: and then one fears that the opponent will state a fault.

original: de 'dra ba dgag par bya ba'i don du lung bstan par bya ba'i dbye ba nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dgag par bya ba'i don du lung bstan par bya ba'i dbye ba nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: That is stated as a division of what should be propounded in order to refute such.

original: de la lta ba'i mtshan nyid ni de rnams kyi mtshan mar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba'i mtshan nyid ni de rnams kyi mtshan mar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The definition of view is the superimposition of signs of those.

original: mtha' gnyis kyi tshul ni snga ma ltar khyad par gang yang rung ba cig tu lung bstan par 'os pas 'ga' zhig ni mthar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis kyi tshul ni snga ma ltar khyad par gang yang rung ba cig tu lung bstan par 'os pas 'ga' zhig ni mthar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The mode of the two extremes is that, as before, one should not propound anything as some basis of distinction, because one should not propound anything.

original: mi bden pa'i don sgro 'dogs pa 'ga' zhig ni mthar 'gyur ba'i tshul lugs phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don sgro 'dogs pa 'ga' zhig ni mthar 'gyur ba'i tshul lugs phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Some false things are the unmistaken way of being of what is impermanent.

original: de nyid dris pa na mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa dang dpe dang gtan tshigs la sogs pa shes byed kyi rgyu dang / spyir don ji lta ba bzhin 'byed pa'i blo med pas pha rol gyis nyes pa brjod pas 'jigs pas don 'di ni dri bar mi 'os shing /
analyzed: de nyid dris pa na mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa dang dpe dang gtan tshigs la sogs pa shes byed kyi rgyu dang / spyir don ji lta ba bzhin 'byed pa'i blo med pas pha rol gyis nyes pa brjod pas 'jigs pas don 'di ni dri bar mi 'os shing /
translated: When asked about that, they say that it is not appropriate to ask about this matter because they do not have the causes of knowledge, such as direct perception, and they fear being accused of faults by others due to not having the intelligence to discern the meaning as it is in general.

original: de nyid kyis lan gyi bye brag 'ga' zhig kyang lung bstan par 'os pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis lan gyi bye brag 'ga' zhig kyang lung bstan par 'os pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And they say that it is not appropriate to prophesy some particular answer to that.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i gzhi 'ga' zhig khas blangs nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i gzhi 'ga' zhig khas blangs nas /
translated: In the passage beginning with ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù having accepted that there is some basis that appears as form and so on,

original: de dag nyid mi rtag pa dang gcig pa 'am tha dad pa gang rung gis bsdus pas /
analyzed: de dag nyid mi rtag pa dang gcig pa 'am tha dad pa gang rung gis bsdus pas /
translated: they say that those are subsumed either by impermanence or by sameness or by difference.

original: de dag gang yin zhes dris pa dang gang yang rung ba cig tu lung bstan par 'os pa las de ltar mi ston cing bstan par 'os pa ma yin zhes de 'dra ba'i grub mtha' rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang yin zhes dris pa dang gang yang rung ba cig tu lung bstan par 'os pa las de ltar mi ston cing bstan par 'os pa ma yin zhes de 'dra ba'i grub mtha' rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: When asked, What are they? he does not teach anything that is suitable to be taught, but rather posits a philosophical position that is not suitable to be taught, such as, It is not like that.

original: 'du byed ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: The formations are cyclic existence.

original: mtshan las zhes pa ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan las zhes pa ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics are the defining characteristics.

original: yon tan ni 'o thug gi mngar ba dang / dung gi dkar po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni 'o thug gi mngar ba dang / dung gi dkar po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities are, for example, the sweetness of milk and the whiteness of a conch.

original: mthong ba ni mthong ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mthong ba'i yul lo //
translated: The visible is the object of seeing.

original: rnal 'byor can ni zhi gnas sam de dang ldan pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can ni zhi gnas sam de dang ldan pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The yogin is one who has tranquility or is endowed with it.

original: lung bstan pa rnams zhes pa ni snga ma ltar bstan par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa rnams zhes pa ni snga ma ltar bstan par 'os pa'o //
translated: The teachings are, as before, what is suitable to be taught.

original: lung ma bstan pa'o zhes pa ni de ltar ma bstan cing /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa'o zhes pa ni de ltar ma bstan cing /
translated: The untaught is what is not taught in that way.

original: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes mi mkhas pa dag zer ba'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes mi mkhas pa dag zer ba'o //
translated: The unwise say, The BhagavƒÅn said that it is not suitable to be taught.

original: skyes bu zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid sun 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid sun 'byin pa ste /
translated: The refutation of that is stated by person, etc.

original: de'i don yang ji ltar nyan pa po'i sems can rnams blo dang mi ldan pas khyad par 'ga' zhig lung bstan pa na skrag par 'gyur bas skrag pa'i gnas de nyid spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i don yang ji ltar nyan pa po'i sems can rnams blo dang mi ldan pas khyad par 'ga' zhig lung bstan pa na skrag par 'gyur bas skrag pa'i gnas de nyid spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Since sentient beings who are listeners are not endowed with intelligence, when they are taught some distinctions, they become frightened.

original: gang zag gi khyad par de la lung du mi bstan par 'os pa rnams lung du mi ston to zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gang zag gi khyad par de la lung du mi bstan par 'os pa rnams lung du mi ston to zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata said that those who are suitable to be taught the distinctions of persons should not be taught.

original: skyes bu gti mug de dag ni rnam pa thams cad du lung ma bstan cing bstan par mi 'os pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so zhes log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug de dag ni rnam pa thams cad du lung ma bstan cing bstan par mi 'os pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so zhes log par rtog pa'o //
translated: But those who are confused think, ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata said that those who are not suitable to be taught should not be taught at all.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni mu stegs @162b byed de ltar 'dod pa'i lta ba ngan pa gzhig pa'i phyir /üîΩde dag lung bstan par bya ba nyid du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni mu stegs @162b byed de ltar 'dod pa'i lta ba ngan pa gzhig pa'i phyir / de dag lung bstan par bya ba nyid du gsungs kyi /
translated: The TathƒÅgata said that those who are not suitable to be taught are those who have the bad views of the tƒ´rthikas who assert that way.üîΩHe said that they should be taught.

original: mi bya ba nyid du ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: mi bya ba nyid du ni ma bshad do //
translated: But he did not say that they should not be taught.

original: 'di rnams kyi gzhung gi don ni cung zad dkrugs te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gzhung gi don ni cung zad dkrugs te shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of their texts should be understood after a little analysis.

original: mu stegs byed kyi lta ba ngan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi lta ba ngan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bad view of the tƒ´rthikas?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the tƒ´rthikas say‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gcer bu pa rnams /üîΩ'du ba dang ni rgyas pa dang // srog ni lus kyi tshad can te //
analyzed: gcer bu pa rnams / 'du ba dang ni rgyas pa dang // srog ni lus kyi tshad can te //
translated: The NirgranthasüîΩsay that ‚Äúthe body is the same size as the life force,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa smra ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa smra ste /
translated: which is the cause of growth and increase.‚Äù

original: de'i don ni srog ni rtag pa gcig pu la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa lus kyi tshad dang mnyam pa lus la gnas so zhes 'dod la /
analyzed: de'i don ni srog ni rtag pa gcig pu la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa lus kyi tshad dang mnyam pa lus la gnas so zhes 'dod la /
translated: The meaning of that is asserted to be that the life force, which has the qualities of being permanent, singular, and so on, is the same size as the body and abides in the body.

original: de lta na lus dang srog gcig gam tha dad ces dris pa na /
analyzed: de lta na lus dang srog gcig gam tha dad ces dris pa na /
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúAre the body and the life force the same or different?‚ÄùüîΩif they accept that they are the same, they fear the fault that just as the body is impermanent, the life force would also be impermanent, and if they accept that they are different, they fear the fault that it would be perceived as such.

original: gal te gcig par khas blangs na lus mi rtag pa bzhin du srog kyang mi rtag par 'gyur zhes pa'i nyes pa dang / tha dad na yang de ltar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas de dag gang du yang lung bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes de 'dra ba'i don khas len pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gcig par khas blangs na lus mi rtag pa bzhin du srog kyang mi rtag par 'gyur zhes pa'i nyes pa dang / tha dad na yang de ltar dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas de dag gang du yang lung bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes de 'dra ba'i don khas len pa'o //
translated: Thus they accept that such a meaning is not to be declared as either one or the other.

original: de la sogs pa gzhan yang grangs can pa rnams rang bzhin dang gnas skabs gcig pa dang tha dad pa gang du yang lung bstan par mi 'os pa'i don khas len pa dang / bye brag pa rnams rdul phra rab dang des brtsams pa'i rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig pa dang tha dad par lung bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa gzhan yang grangs can pa rnams rang bzhin dang gnas skabs gcig pa dang tha dad pa gang du yang lung bstan par mi 'os pa'i don khas len pa dang / bye brag pa rnams rdul phra rab dang des brtsams pa'i rags pa yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig pa dang tha dad par lung bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that it is not suitable to declare whether the subtle particle and the coarse substance that is composed of it are the same or different.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de dag las bzlog pas /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de dag las bzlog pas /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, my teaching is the opposite of that.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis phyogs gsal bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis phyogs gsal bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata himself clarified that position.

original: de'i don yang mu stegs pa rnams rgyu dang rigs pa la kun tu rmongs pas 'gal ba'i don khas blangs pa na khyad par de dag tu lung bstan pa la /
analyzed: de'i don yang mu stegs pa rnams rgyu dang rigs pa la kun tu rmongs pas 'gal ba'i don khas blangs pa na khyad par de dag tu lung bstan pa la /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows. When tƒ´rthikas accept a meaning that is contradictory because they are confused about causes and reasoning, they are declared to be in those categories.

original: rigs pa'i gnod pa 'jug pas des 'jigs nas lung mi ston pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs pa'i gnod pa 'jug pas des 'jigs nas lung mi ston pa yin la /
translated: Since the fault of reasoning is incurred, they are afraid of that and do not declare [their position].

original: nga'i gsung rab kyi nges pa'i don gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa'i don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba la ni rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: nga'i gsung rab kyi nges pa'i don gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa'i don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba la ni rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'jug ste /
translated: In my scriptures, the ultimate reality, the nondual, reflexive awareness, is free from the elaborations of entities and so on. Conceptualization does not engage it

original: brtag bya'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag bya'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is beyond the domain of investigation.

original: de 'dra ba de dag la gzhag par bya ba nyid du sgro btags pa'i don lta ga la yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba de dag la gzhag par bya ba nyid du sgro btags pa'i don lta ga la yod ces pa'o //
translated: How could it be that such a thing is reified as something to be posited?

original: gzhan yang dngos po'i phyogs khas len pa rnams la ni gcig tu yod dam du mar yod ces pa la sogs pa khyad par gang dag gis bsdus pa'i khyad par gyi chos gang yin zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po'i phyogs khas len pa rnams la ni gcig tu yod dam du mar yod ces pa la sogs pa khyad par gang dag gis bsdus pa'i khyad par gyi chos gang yin zhes dris pa na /
translated: Moreover, for those who accept the position of entities, when asked, ‚ÄúIs it unitary or is it manifold?‚Äù and so on, whatever specific attributes are included,

original: gang du lung bstan kyang nyes pa dang 'brel bas de ltar bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du lung bstan kyang nyes pa dang 'brel bas de ltar bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: whatever specific phenomena are asked about, the answer will be related to a fault. Therefore, it is not to be taught in that way.

original: @163a * // 'di ni gzhag par bya'o zhes don phyin ci log du brtags pa yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: @163a * // 'di ni gzhag par bya'o zhes don phyin ci log du brtags pa yod ces pa'o //
translated: How could it be that there is a misapprehension of the meaning, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is to be posited‚Äù?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi don nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi don nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù explains the above point in more detail.

original: ngas dus gzhan du bstan par bya zhes pa ni gdul bya'i khyad par gang las sngar bstan par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyang gdul bya de nyid phyis dbang po yongs su smin pa na bstan par bya zhing /
analyzed: ngas dus gzhan du bstan par bya zhes pa ni gdul bya'i khyad par gang las sngar bstan par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyang gdul bya de nyid phyis dbang po yongs su smin pa na bstan par bya zhing /
translated: As for the line ‚ÄúI will teach it at another time,‚Äù the point is that the teachings that are not to be given to certain types of disciples will be taught to those same disciples later on when their faculties have matured.

original: gzhan yang gdul bya'i khyad par gzhan rnams la ni dus de nyid kyi tshe yang bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul bya'i khyad par gzhan rnams la ni dus de nyid kyi tshe yang bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: And the teachings that are to be given to other types of disciples will be given at that very time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar snang zhing myong ba'i chos kun rdzob du khas blangs pa 'di rnams ni de kho na nyid du skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par de dag tsam gyis bsdus shing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar snang zhing myong ba'i chos kun rdzob du khas blangs pa 'di rnams ni de kho na nyid du skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par de dag tsam gyis bsdus shing /
translated: For this reason, all the phenomena that appear and are experienced, which are accepted as being conventional realities, are subsumed within the categories of ‚Äúarisen‚Äù and ‚Äúun-arisen,‚Äù ‚Äúexistent‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-existent,‚Äù and so on.

original: phung po gzhan mi 'thad pas de 'dra ba'i khyad par dris pa'am /
analyzed: phung po gzhan mi 'thad pas de 'dra ba'i khyad par dris pa'am /
translated: Since it is not tenable to have any other categories, the question is asked in this way.

original: ma dris kyang rung ste gdul bya'i the tshom bcad pa'i don du 'di rnams ni don dam par ma skyes shing ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes rang bzhin stong pa nyid du lung bstan par 'os shing de ltar bstan pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: ma dris kyang rung ste gdul bya'i the tshom bcad pa'i don du 'di rnams ni don dam par ma skyes shing ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes rang bzhin stong pa nyid du lung bstan par 'os shing de ltar bstan pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: Whether or not they ask, in order to eliminate the doubts of disciples, it is appropriate to declare that these things are ultimately unarisen and essenceless, that is, that they are empty of essence.

original: chos de rnams khyad par de dag gis bsdus pa dang / skye ba dang dngos po la sogs pa'i phyogs la gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de rnams khyad par de dag gis bsdus pa dang / skye ba dang dngos po la sogs pa'i phyogs la gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is how they are taught, because those phenomena are included within those distinctions and because there is a valid cognition that refutes the position that they are arisen and are entities.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: dgag pa bkag pa bsgrub pa yin //
analyzed: dgag pa bkag pa bsgrub pa yin //
translated: the refutation of a refutation would be an affirmation.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa sngar rgyas par bstan zin no //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa sngar rgyas par bstan zin no //
translated: And so forth. These errors have been explained at length above.

original: bya ba dang byed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: Action and agent are cause and effect.

original: de ltar na sngar mtha' gnyis dgag pa gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sngar mtha' gnyis dgag pa gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: In that case, it contradicts the earlier statement that refutes the two extremes.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It does not.

original: de ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i mtha' nyid bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i mtha' nyid bkag pa yin la /
translated: That is because it refutes the extreme of superimposition, which is the superimposition of the conceptual thought that things exist, do not exist, and so forth.

original: 'dir ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin bstan pas 'gal ba med de rgyas par sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa la sogs pa chos rnams kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin bstan pas 'gal ba med de rgyas par sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, however, there is no contradiction in teaching the reality of phenomena, such as their non-arisenness by nature, just as it is, because, as was extensively taught above, it is not the case that the ultimate is not taught at all.

original: des na rab tu mi gnas par smra ba'i ming la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis ji ltar bstan pa ni phyin ci log nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na rab tu mi gnas par smra ba'i ming la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis ji ltar bstan pa ni phyin ci log nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who are attached to the name of the proponents of non-abiding should understand that the teaching is just the opposite.

original: chos thams cad mi rtag ces pa ni kun rdzob pa'i don lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi rtag ces pa ni kun rdzob pa'i don lung bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement that all phenomena are impermanent is a prediction of the meaning of the conventional.

original: mtshan nyid skye ba mi skye ba //
analyzed: mtshan nyid skye ba mi skye ba //
translated: The characteristic of arising is non-arising.

original: zhes pa ni skye bar snang ba kun rdzob pa 'di nyid don dam par mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni skye bar snang ba kun rdzob pa 'di nyid don dam par mi skye ba ste /
translated: This conventional appearance of arising is ultimately non-arising.

original: mi skye ba'i chos nyid de nyid 'gyur ba med pas rtag ces pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos nyid de nyid 'gyur ba med pas rtag ces pa'o //
translated: That very reality of non-arising is permanent because it is unchanging.

original: tshig gi don gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gi don gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the other words is exhausted.

original: de la mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa ni pha rol po'i dri ba mang po la tshig gcig gis lan 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa ni pha rol po'i dri ba mang po la tshig gcig gis lan 'debs pa ste /
translated: Regarding that, a single reply is to answer many questions of the opponent with a single statement.

original: kha cig 'di skad du /
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad du /
translated: Some say this:

original: skye ba thams cad gdon mi za bar 'gag par 'gyur ba yin nam @163b dkon mchog gsum bsod nams kyi zhing gshin pa yin nam zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa la /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad gdon mi za bar 'gag par 'gyur ba yin nam @163b dkon mchog gsum bsod nams kyi zhing gshin pa yin nam zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa la /
translated: Are all births without exception certain to cease? Are the Three Jewels a fertile field of merit? and so on.

original: de ltar yin no zhes lung bstan pa lta bu'o //üîΩrnam par phye nas lung bstan pa ni kha cig 'di skad du /üîΩci 'gags pa thams cad yang skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ltar yin no zhes lung bstan pa lta bu'o // rnam par phye nas lung bstan pa ni kha cig 'di skad du / ci 'gags pa thams cad yang skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: The Buddha replied, It is so!üîΩ The Buddha's reply is called differentiated when someone asks, Do all things that have ceased arise again?

original: dkon mchog gsum gcig kho nar zad dam zhes dris pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gcig kho nar zad dam zhes dris pa la sogs pa la /
translated: Are the Three Jewels exhausted? and so on.

original: don 'di ni de ltar ma nges te /üîΩ'gags pa rnams kyi rgyun slar skye ba yang yod de /
analyzed: don 'di ni de ltar ma nges te / 'gags pa rnams kyi rgyun slar skye ba yang yod de /
translated: The Buddha replied, This matter is not definite.

original: byis pa rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: There are continuities of things that have ceased that arise again, like the appropriated aggregates of ordinary beings.

original: mi skye ba yang yod de dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no //üîΩdkon mchog gsum gcig pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mi skye ba yang yod de dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no //üîΩdkon mchog gsum gcig pa yang yod de /
translated: There are continuities of things that have ceased that do not arise again, like the final aggregates of arhats.üîΩThere are continuities of things that have ceased that arise again and do not arise again, like the aggregates of those between death and rebirth.üîΩThere are continuities of things that have ceased that neither arise again nor do not arise again, like the aggregates of buddhas and so on.

original: 'gog pa'i chos mthar thug pa dang ; sangs rgyas dkon mchog gam lam gyi chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos mthar thug pa dang ; sangs rgyas dkon mchog gam lam gyi chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog lta bu'o //
translated: The ultimate truth of cessation and the jewel of the Buddha or the jewel of the Dharma of the path and the jewel of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: tha dad pa yang yod de sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang yod de sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is also a difference, like the Buddha, the Sa·πÖgha, and so on.

original: dris nas lung ston pa ni ji ltar kha cig 'di skad du /
analyzed: dris nas lung ston pa ni ji ltar kha cig 'di skad du /
translated: Answering by asking a question is like when someone asks,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu mchog yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu mchog yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúAre the ten bodhisattva stages supreme?‚Äù

original: 'on te ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa la khyod gang la ltos te 'dri zhes slar pha ral dris nas ci rigs par lung ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa la khyod gang la ltos te 'dri zhes slar pha ral dris nas ci rigs par lung ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: or ‚ÄúAre they not?‚Äù and so on. In response, one asks back, ‚ÄúWhat are you considering when you ask?‚Äù and then one gives an answer as appropriate.

original: cang mi smra bar bzhag pas lung bstan pa ni ji skad du kha cig bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ci dge ba zhig gam 'on te mi dge ba zhig ces 'dri ba dang / mo gsham gyi bu mdog dkar ba zhig gam 'on te gnag pa zhig ces 'dri ba la sogs pa la cang mi smra bar bzhag pas lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: cang mi smra bar bzhag pas lung bstan pa ni ji skad du kha cig bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ci dge ba zhig gam 'on te mi dge ba zhig ces 'dri ba dang / mo gsham gyi bu mdog dkar ba zhig gam 'on te gnag pa zhig ces 'dri ba la sogs pa la cang mi smra bar bzhag pas lung bstan pa ste /
translated: The answer by remaining silent is like the following: When someone asks, ‚ÄúIs the thing called ‚Äòself‚Äô virtuous or nonvirtuous?‚Äù or ‚ÄúIs the son of a barren woman white or black?‚Äù and so on, the answer is by remaining silent.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like what is said in the commentary to the noble Buddha‚Äôs Stages of Practicing the Way of Bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan yang rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this should be understood in detail from the treatise Stages of Practicing the Way of Yogic Deeds and the commentary to the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: gal te ci yang mi smra bar bzhag pas lung bstan pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te ci yang mi smra bar bzhag pas lung bstan pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the answer is by remaining silent, how could it be an answer?

original: gzhan yang de lta na sngar rnam pa thams cad du gzhag par bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta na sngar rnam pa thams cad du gzhag par bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable to remain silent in all cases.

original: gang zag gi khyad par 'ga' zhig la re zhig la bzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gi khyad par 'ga' zhig la re zhig la bzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: It is said that it is merely posited for some special individuals for a while.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: de 'dra ba'i dri ba la mi smra bar bzhag pa nyid kyis gzhi ma grub pa la khyad par gyi dpyad pa mi 'jug ces de 'dra ba'i chos can ma grub pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur bas cang mi smra ba nyid lung ston par 'gyur ba ste
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dri ba la mi smra bar bzhag pa nyid kyis gzhi ma grub pa la khyad par gyi dpyad pa mi 'jug ces de 'dra ba'i chos can ma grub pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur bas cang mi smra ba nyid lung ston par 'gyur ba ste
translated: By remaining silent in response to such a question, the one who asks will understand that the subject matter is not established, and so remaining silent is itself a response.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it says,

original: 'phags pa li tstsha b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'phags pa 'jam @164a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa li tstsha b'i dri ma med par grags pa la 'phags pa 'jam @164a * //
translated: the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ asked the noble Licchavi Vimalakƒ´rti,

original: dpal gyis rigs kyi bu bdag cag gis ni rang rang gi rtogs pa brjod zin gyis /
analyzed: dpal gyis rigs kyi bu bdag cag gis ni rang rang gi rtogs pa brjod zin gyis /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of good family, we have each spoken of our own realizations.üîΩNow you, too, should be confident in teaching the door of the Dharma of nonduality.‚Äù

original: khyed kyang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan pa la spobs par mdzod cig ces dris pa dang / dge bsnyen chen pos de kho na nyid kyi don sgra'i brjod du med pa nyid du rtogs shing /
analyzed: khyed kyang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan pa la spobs par mdzod cig ces dris pa dang / dge bsnyen chen pos de kho na nyid kyi don sgra'i brjod du med pa nyid du rtogs shing /
translated: The great upƒÅsaka realized that the meaning of thatness is inexpressible in words.

original: gzhan la yang bstan par bya ba'i don du cang mi smra bar bzhugs pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis kyang de bzhin du rtogs nas rigs kyi bu legs so legs so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang bstan par bya ba'i don du cang mi smra bar bzhugs pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis kyang de bzhin du rtogs nas rigs kyi bu legs so legs so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And Manjushri, having understood it in the same way, said, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, excellent, excellent!‚Äù

original: de ltar bzhag pa nyid kyis don ston par 'gyur bas rnam pa thams cad du bstan par bya ba ma yin zhing bzhag pa med do zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhag pa nyid kyis don ston par 'gyur bas rnam pa thams cad du bstan par bya ba ma yin zhing bzhag pa med do zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: Since the meaning is taught by that very placement, it is not to be taught in all aspects, and there is no contradiction with the statement, ‚ÄúThere is no placement.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gang dag rnam par brtsad pa'i tshul gyis dri ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag rnam par brtsad pa'i tshul gyis dri ba la /
translated: Furthermore, when asked a question in the manner of a debate,

original: de lta na rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa yang mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa yang mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'o //
translated: to answer, ‚ÄúIn that case, it would be the same for your own tenets,‚Äù is a categorical answer.

original: 'dir mu stegs byed kyi smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir mu stegs byed kyi smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the non-Buddhist‚Äôs assertion?

original: yod dang med las zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yod dang med las zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom existence and nonexistence‚Äù and so on.

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na yang //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na yang //
translated: Even when analyzed by the mind,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyis 'dod pa dngos po'i phyogs thams cad 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyis 'dod pa dngos po'i phyogs thams cad 'gog pa ste /
translated: Thus, all the positions of others are refuted.

original: ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed pa blos gzhigs na dngos por grub pa'i rang bzhin bden pa med cing /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed pa blos gzhigs na dngos por grub pa'i rang bzhin bden pa med cing /
translated: When one analyzes with the mind, the nature of things that are established as real does not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang med ces pas te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang med ces pas te /
translated: Nor does an essence exist.

original: med pa la sogs pa'i chos su sgro btags pa'i mtshan ma'i ngo bo yang med ces pa'o //
analyzed: med pa la sogs pa'i chos su sgro btags pa'i mtshan ma'i ngo bo yang med ces pa'o //
translated: Nor does the essence of a sign that is imputed as a quality such as nonexistence exist.üîΩThen, the bodhisattva‚Ä¶

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang / gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag gi khyad par rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang / gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag gi khyad par rgyas par ston te /
translated: This passage extensively teaches the path that purifies the essence of the tathƒÅgatas and the distinctions of the persons who abide in the temporary results.

original: 'di yang / bcings pa su lags gang gis dgrol //
analyzed: 'di yang / bcings pa su lags gang gis dgrol //
translated: This is also applied as the answer to the questions, ‚ÄúWho is bound? By what are they bound?‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang / srid gsum choms gnas pa de su //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang / srid gsum choms gnas pa de su // zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and ‚ÄúWho is it that abides in the destruction of the three existences?‚Äù

original: 'gro ba ni gang zag gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni gang zag gi khyad par ro //
translated: Migrators are the distinctions of persons.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa ni de'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //üîΩthabs kyi mtshan nyid ni de rnams nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa ni de'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'o // thabs kyi mtshan nyid ni de rnams nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The stream-enterer is one who is situated in that fruit.üîΩThe characteristic of the means is that they lead to the attainment of those fruits.

original: yang de la brten nas theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang de la brten nas theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Or else, the characteristic of the means is that, in dependence on them, one realizes the Great Vehicle.

original: de mngon par rtogs pas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi sgrib pa gnyis rnam par sbyong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon par rtogs pas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi sgrib pa gnyis rnam par sbyong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And, by realizing that, one purifies the two obscurations of oneself and others, and so forth.

original: 'gro ba la 'dod pa bzhin du longs spyod pa ni sems can rnams la dbang bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la 'dod pa bzhin du longs spyod pa ni sems can rnams la dbang bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The enjoyment of beings as they wish is the mastery over sentient beings.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras @164b bu la gnas pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug rgyun chags su 'byung ba las thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs yin
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras @164b bu la gnas pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug rgyun chags su 'byung ba las thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs yin
translated: Among those, the one situated in the fruit of stream-enterer, from the perspective of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, is the state in which all of the sixteen moments of knowledge that are included in the path of seeing have arisen in continuity and are completely perfected.

original: la / skad cig bco lnga pa man chod ni 'bras bu de la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: la / skad cig bco lnga pa man chod ni 'bras bu de la zhugs pa'o //
translated: And, up to the fifteenth moment, one is engaged in that fruit.

original: ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: The sixteen moments of the path of seeing are the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, and the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid du mngon sum du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid du mngon sum du rtogs pa ste /
translated: These are the direct realizations of the truth of suffering as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, and as selfless.

original: rnam pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: They are to be applied in order to the four aspects.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Similarly, there are four aspects, such as the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to origin and so on.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyis rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyis rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These are to be applied in order to the four aspects of the truth of origin as cause, origin, strong generation, and condition.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa bzhi ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid du rtogs pa bzhi dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa bzhi ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid du rtogs pa bzhi dang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the four such as perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation are applied to the four realizations that the truth of cessation is cessation, peace, sublime, and definite release.

original: yang lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa bzhi ni lam gyi bden pa la lam nyid dang / rigs pa dang / bsgrubs pa dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa bzhi ni lam gyi bden pa la lam nyid dang / rigs pa dang / bsgrubs pa dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: Again, the four such as perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of path are applied to the four realizations that the truth of path is the path, appropriateness, achievement, and definite release.

original: rnam pa bzhi dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: They are applied in order to the four aspects and in order.üîΩOr, in one aspect, they are applied to the four aspects such as impermanence in the desire realm level of the truth of suffering.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i tshul du rtogs pas khams der gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i bar chad
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i tshul du rtogs pas khams der gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i bar chad
translated: By realizing the desire realm level of the truth of suffering in the manner of the four aspects such as impermanence, one abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in that realm.

original: med pa'i lam ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa yin la /
analyzed: med pa'i lam ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa yin la /
translated: The path of noninterruption that abandons the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering of the desire realm is perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de spangs pa'i rnam grol gyi lam ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i rnam grol gyi lam ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: The liberated path that abandons them is subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la snga ma ltar rtogs pas de dag gis bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shesüîΩpa'i bzod pa yin la /
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la snga ma ltar rtogs pas de dag gis bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa yin la /
translated: The path of noninterruption that abandons the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering subsumed by the two higher realms is perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de rnams spangs pa'i rnam grol gyi lam ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du kun 'byung la chos @165a * //
analyzed: de rnams spangs pa'i rnam grol gyi lam ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o // de bzhin du kun 'byung la chos @165a * //
