translated: One understands the reality of suffering.üîΩOne understands

original: / de la 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ma rtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par the tshom za ba dang / nyer len gyi phung po lnga 'bras bur gyur pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang /
analyzed: / de la 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ma rtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par the tshom za ba dang / nyer len gyi phung po lnga 'bras bur gyur pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang /
translated: In the desire realm, there are five aspects of ignorance with regard to the truth of suffering: ignorance of impermanence, suffering, and so forth; doubt about impermanence and so forth; and the view of the perishing aggregates, which is the grasping at the five appropriated aggregates as the self and entities connected to the self.

original: bdag de nyid rtag pa dang tshang pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa med do zhes log par lta bas te /
analyzed: bdag de nyid rtag pa dang tshang pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa med do zhes log par lta bas te /
translated: There is also the grasping at the two extremes of permanence and annihilation with regard to the self and the view that the truth of suffering does not exist.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dngos su log par zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dngos su log par zhugs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, these five aspects are directly involved in the perversion of the truth of suffering.

original: lta ba de dag la rjes su chags pa'i 'dod chags dang ; des sems khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / de dag la mchog dang gtso bo la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba de dag la rjes su chags pa'i 'dod chags dang ; des sems khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / de dag la mchog dang gtso bo la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: There is also attachment to those views, pride in them, and the grasping at them as being supreme, foremost, and so forth.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / lta ba dman pa des yongs su zin pa'i log pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la mchog dang gtso bo la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / lta ba dman pa des yongs su zin pa'i log pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la mchog dang gtso bo la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: and 4) holding the view of the transitory collection as supreme.üîΩThe four that are wrongly engaged due to being wrongly engaged are:üîΩ1) holding a view as supreme,üîΩ2) holding a discipline and ritual as supreme, which is fully embraced by that inferior view,üîΩ3) holding that view as supreme,üîΩand 4) holding the view of the transitory collection as supreme.üîΩThe four that are wrongly engaged due to being wrongly engaged are:

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhi ni log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhi ni log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: 1) holding a view as supreme,

original: de ltar chags shing mchog tu bzung ba'i yul la gzhan gyi nyes pa brjod pa na de la kun nas mnar sems pa'i khong khro ni log par zhugs pa'i dbang gis log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chags shing mchog tu bzung ba'i yul la gzhan gyi nyes pa brjod pa na de la kun nas mnar sems pa'i khong khro ni log par zhugs pa'i dbang gis log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: 2) holding a discipline and ritual as supreme, which is fully embraced by that inferior view,üîΩ3) holding that view as supreme,üîΩand 4) holding the view of the transitory collection as supreme.üîΩThe four that are wrongly engaged due to being wrongly engaged are:üîΩ1) holding a view as supreme,üîΩ2) holding a discipline and ritual as supreme, which is fully embraced by that inferior view,üîΩ3) holding that view as supreme,üîΩand 4) holding the view of the transitory collection as supreme.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung gi bden pa rgyur gyur pa'i @165b phung po lnga la rgyu dang kun 'byung ba la sogs par ma rtogs pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / bdag de nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung gi bden pa rgyur gyur pa'i @165b phung po lnga la rgyu dang kun 'byung ba la sogs par ma rtogs pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / bdag de nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The four that are wrongly engaged due to being wrongly engaged are:üîΩ1) holding a view as supreme,üîΩ2) holding a discipline and ritual as supreme, which is fully embraced by that inferior view,üîΩ3) holding that view as supreme,üîΩand 4) holding the view of the transitory collection as supreme.üîΩThe four that are wrongly engaged due to being wrongly engaged are:üîΩ1) holding a view as supreme,üîΩ2) holding a discipline and ritual as supreme, which is fully

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa de 'dra ba med ces dngos su log par zhugs pa lnga dang / lta ba de dag la rjes su chags pa dang / de dag gis sems khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / snga ma ltar mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa de 'dra ba med ces dngos su log par zhugs pa lnga dang / lta ba de dag la rjes su chags pa dang / de dag gis sems khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / snga ma ltar mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Attachment to those views, pride that inflates the mind through those views and the two types of clinging to those views as supreme, as before, are the five that engage in error through attachment.

original: de ltar bzhi ni log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi ni log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Thus four are error that engages in error.

original: log par zhugs pa'i dbang gis log par zhugs pa yang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa'i dbang gis log par zhugs pa yang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Error that engages in error through the power of error should be understood as before.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The truths of cessation and path should be applied in the same way.

original: gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phung po lnga la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin pa la /
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phung po lnga la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin pa la /
translated: If the afflicted view of the self is the apprehension of the five aggregates as the self and mine,

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni phung po nye bar zhi ba tsam yin pas de la log par zhugs pa nyid du mi 'thad cing de nyid kyis mthar 'dzin pa yang mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni phung po nye bar zhi ba tsam yin pas de la log par zhugs pa nyid du mi 'thad cing de nyid kyis mthar 'dzin pa yang mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: it is untenable that it engages cessation because the truth of cessation is the mere pacification of the aggregates and it is also untenable that it engages the extreme of superimposition.

original: de ltar bden mod kyi 'dir 'gog pa ni phung po nye bar zhi ba tsam gyi med par dgag pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi 'dir 'gog pa ni phung po nye bar zhi ba tsam gyi med par dgag pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: nonexistent, a nonimplicative negation, the pacification of the aggregates.üîΩHowever, since it is a state of mind free from defilements, it is tenable thatüîΩthere is the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and that there is the grasping of

original: 'on kyang dri ma dang bral ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs yin pas de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / bdag de nyid rtag pa dang chang pa'i mthar 'dzin pa 'thad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dri ma dang bral ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs yin pas de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / bdag de nyid rtag pa dang chang pa'i mthar 'dzin pa 'thad do //
translated: the permanence and annihilation of that self.

original: yang nyan thos sde pa 'ga' zhig gis med par dgag pa tsam la 'gog par 'dod pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: yang nyan thos sde pa 'ga' zhig gis med par dgag pa tsam la 'gog par 'dod pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Some ≈õrƒÅvakas maintain that mere nonimplicative negation is cessation.üîΩIn the Compendium of Ascertainments, it is not said that these two views

original: bsdu ba rnam par gtan la dbab pa las lta ba gnyis po de dag 'gog pa la log par zhugs pa nyid du ma gsungs so //üîΩgzhan yang de nyid las lta ba gnyis po de dag sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la /
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam par gtan la dbab pa las lta ba gnyis po de dag 'gog pa la log par zhugs pa nyid du ma gsungs so // gzhan yang de nyid las lta ba gnyis po de dag sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la /
translated: are errors with regard to cessation.üîΩMoreover, in that text, it is not said that these two views are errors with

original: log par zhugs pa nyid du ma gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa nyid du ma gsungs pa yang /
translated: regard to the truths of suffering and of the origin.üîΩIn that text, the truth of suffering is said to be the birth of sentient beings

original: der sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni sems can skye ba dang skye ba'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: der sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni sems can skye ba dang skye ba'i gnas yin la /
translated: and the places of their birth.

original: kun 'byung ni las dang nyon mongs pa nyid du rnam par bzhag pas de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bla ma dag 'chad do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni las dang nyon mongs pa nyid du rnam par bzhag pas de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bla ma dag 'chad do //
translated: those who attain nirvana without application,üîΩthose who proceed to the formless realm andüîΩthose who obtain nirvana through limited or unlimited discriminating three knowledges.

original: snga ma ltar bstan pa ni chos mngon pa kun las bsdus pa las /
analyzed: snga ma ltar bstan pa ni chos mngon pa kun las bsdus pa las /
translated: The first four are classified by the four results of stream entry and so on.üîΩThe fifth is classified by the three knowledges.üîΩThe sixth is classified by the three times.üîΩThe seventh is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa phung po'i rgyun la bzhag pa'i dus su de ltar 'thad pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa phung po'i rgyun la bzhag pa'i dus su de ltar 'thad pas so //
translated: The eighth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe ninth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe tenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe eleventh is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twelfth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe thirteenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams na bcu tshan bzhir 'gyur la /üîΩkhams gong ma gnyis na khong khro ba med pas bden pa re re la rnam @166a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams na bcu tshan bzhir 'gyur la / khams gong ma gnyis na khong khro ba med pas bden pa re re la rnam @166a * //
translated: The fourteenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe fifteenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe sixteenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe seventeenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe eighteenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.

original: pa dgu dgur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pa dgu dgur shes par bya'o //
translated: The nineteenth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twentieth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-first is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-second is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-third is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-fourth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-fifth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-sixth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.

original: de ltar na sum cu rtsa drug pa phrag gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na sum cu rtsa drug pa phrag gnyis te /
translated: The twenty-seventh is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe twenty-eighth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.

original: thams cad bsdoms pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya dang bcu gnyis su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad bsdoms pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya dang bcu gnyis su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The twenty-ninth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe thirtieth is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe thirty-first is classified by the three times and the three knowledges.üîΩThe thirty

original: gal te de ltar na de rnams mtha' dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa nyid 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de rnams mtha' dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa nyid 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, then would not all of them be stream-enterers by abandoning all of those?

original: mdo sde 'di dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why does this sutra and the Perfection of Wisdom state that one is a stream-enterer by abandoning three fetters?

original: 'di mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i gtso bos bsdus pa ni gsum po 'di rnams yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'di mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i gtso bos bsdus pa ni gsum po 'di rnams yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is stated in order to indicate that these three are the principal fetters to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ji ltar na gtso bo nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gtso bo nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they become principal?üîΩBecause the view of the transitory collection delights in the five aggregates that are the basis of suffering, one does not transcend suffering.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi gnas la mngon par dga' bas sdug bsngal las mi 'phags pa dang / gzhan yang de ni lta ba dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi gnas la mngon par dga' bas sdug bsngal las mi 'phags pa dang / gzhan yang de ni lta ba dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is the root of all afflicted views and afflictions.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas ni sdug bsngal las cung zad 'phags kyang log pa'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas ni sdug bsngal las cung zad 'phags kyang log pa'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Through holding discipline and ritual to be paramount, one is slightly elevated from suffering, but it becomes the cause for definite non-release through a false path.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas zin pa'i log pa'i brtul zhugs pa la sogs pa la mchog tu 'dzin cing nan tan du bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas zin pa'i log pa'i brtul zhugs pa la sogs pa la mchog tu 'dzin cing nan tan du bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one holds and assiduously practices wrong ritual and so on, which is seized by a false view.

original: the tshom gyis ni yang dag pa'i lam la the tshom za bas lam des nges par mi 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //üîΩgzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni /
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni yang dag pa'i lam la the tshom za bas lam des nges par mi 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas so // gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni /
translated: Through doubt, one doubts the correct path, and it becomes the cause for definite non-release through that path.

original: shes bya'i yul phung po lnga la phyin ci log par sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: shes bya'i yul phung po lnga la phyin ci log par sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Moreover, the view of the transitory collection is the cause of superimposition in regard to the five aggregates, which are the objects of knowledge.

original: gnyis pa ni lta ba gsum yang dag pa ma yin pa la yang dag pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang ; the tshom ni gnyen po la log par sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lta ba gsum yang dag pa ma yin pa la yang dag pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang ; the tshom ni gnyen po la log par sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las gsungs so //
translated: The second is the cause of the three views, because they are the cause of superimposing the quality of reality on what is not real, and doubt is the cause of superimposing the opposite of the antidote.

original: de la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dbye ba la khyad par can ma yin pa ni snga ma de nyid tsam ste /
analyzed: de la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dbye ba la khyad par can ma yin pa ni snga ma de nyid tsam ste /
translated: The result of stream entry is classified as two types: not distinguished and distinguished.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi rgyun la zhugs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi rgyun la zhugs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The first is simply the former, because one who has entered the stream of the path to nirvana is called a stream enterer.

original: 'bras bu khyad par can ni 'dir rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par can ni 'dir rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The distinguished result is threefold.

original: dbang po tha mar gyur ba ni de ltar thogs na 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du tshe'i srid pa lan bdun blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba ste rang gi sdug bsngal mthar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po tha mar gyur ba ni de ltar thogs na 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du tshe'i srid pa lan bdun blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba ste rang gi sdug bsngal mthar byed pa'o //
translated: One who has the least of the three faculties takes seven existences and attains nirvana in the desire realm among gods and humans.

original: de'i don @166b yang dang por mi'i rten lta bu gcig la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas /
analyzed: de'i don @166b yang dang por mi'i rten lta bu gcig la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: First, having obtained the result of stream entry in a human life,

original: de nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i ris drug du tshe'i srid pa lan drug blangs nas /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i ris drug du tshe'i srid pa lan drug blangs nas /
translated: one takes rebirth in the six classes of desire realm gods six times.

original: yang dang po'i rten mi'i srid ba de nyid du skye ba blangs te /
analyzed: yang dang po'i rten mi'i srid ba de nyid du skye ba blangs te /
translated: Then, one takes rebirth in the very first life, the human life.

original: rten de nyid la khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rten de nyid la khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: In that very life, having abandoned all the afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation, one manifests the result of an arhat.

original: de bzhin du lha'i ris drug po gang yang rung ba'i rten la dang por rgyun du zhugs pa thob nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i ris drug po gang yang rung ba'i rten la dang por rgyun du zhugs pa thob nas /
translated: Similarly, having first obtained the result of stream entry in any of the six classes of gods,

original: de nas de las gnas gzhan drug tu skye ba blangs te /
analyzed: de nas de las gnas gzhan drug tu skye ba blangs te /
translated: one takes rebirth in the other six abodes.

original: yang dang po de nyid du skye ba nas gnyen po rdo rje lta bu mngon du bya ste /
analyzed: yang dang po de nyid du skye ba nas gnyen po rdo rje lta bu mngon du bya ste /
translated: Then, having taken rebirth in the very first life, one manifests the antidote that is like a vajra

original: khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad spong ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad spong ba'o //
translated: and abandons all the afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de lta na skye ba bdun phrag du ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na skye ba bdun phrag du ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, he would take birth for many sevenfold sets of lives.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error because

original: de ni gang zag du ma'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni gang zag du ma'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: that is from the perspective of many persons.

original: gang zag gcig gi dbang du byas na skye ba lan bdun las mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag gcig gi dbang du byas na skye ba lan bdun las mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the perspective of one person, he does not take more than seven rebirths.

original: de la 'dir khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rim gyis spong ba'i dbang du byas nas dang por 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po nas 'bring gi chen po'i bar du spangs pa
analyzed: de la 'dir khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rim gyis spong ba'i dbang du byas nas dang por 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po nas 'bring gi chen po'i bar du spangs pa
translated: Here, from the perspective of the gradual abandonment of afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the three realms, the first is the abandonment of the great of the great affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the desire realm down to the great of the medium.

original: ni mi dang lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las bshad de /
analyzed: ni mi dang lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o zhes chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag las bshad de /
translated: This is birth from family to family of humans and gods, as explained in the treatises on the Abhidharma.

original: de lta na yang 'dir skye ba lan bdun gyi bar la ci rigs par de rnams spangs nas bdun gyi tha mar gyur pa la snga ma ltar gnyen po mngon du byas te mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir skye ba lan bdun gyi bar la ci rigs par de rnams spangs nas bdun gyi tha mar gyur pa la snga ma ltar gnyen po mngon du byas te mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: However, in this case, having relinquished those in any way up to seven times, at the end of the seventh, one attains nirvana by manifesting the antidote as before.

original: bar ma dang mchog kyang tshul de nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma dang mchog kyang tshul de nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The medium and supreme should be understood in the same way.

original: gal te de ltar na gang zag de nyid la lan cig phyir 'od ba la sogs pa'i spangs pa dang thob pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i dbye bar mi 'thad do zhe na /üîΩskyon med de /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gang zag de nyid la lan cig phyir 'od ba la sogs pa'i spangs pa dang thob pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i dbye bar mi 'thad do zhe na / skyon med de /
translated: If that is so, then it is untenable that the qualities of abandoning and obtaining once return and so on are complete in that person, because they are classified as stream enterers.

original: dang por rgyun du zhugs par rtogs pa'i tshe de nyid las ma 'phos pas de rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i dbye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang por rgyun du zhugs par rtogs pa'i tshe de nyid las ma 'phos pas de rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i dbye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: There is no error because when the first stage of stream enterer is realized, it is taught that those qualities are classified as stream enterer because they do not transcend that stage.

original: yang gal te tshe'i srid pa bdun ba'am /
analyzed: yang gal te tshe'i srid pa bdun ba'am /
translated: If one asks, how many existences does one take in the case of the seven existences?

original: lnga pa la sogs pa'i bar la snga ma ltar nyon mongs pa gsum pa'am bzhi pa'i bar du spangs nas de nas spang bya'i nyon mongs pa gzhan ma spangs par tshe 'phos par gyur nas nyon mongs pa lnga pa spong ba la zhugs nas brgyad pa man chad
analyzed: lnga pa la sogs pa'i bar la snga ma ltar nyon mongs pa gsum pa'am bzhi pa'i bar du spangs nas de nas spang bya'i nyon mongs pa gzhan ma spangs par tshe 'phos par gyur nas nyon mongs pa lnga pa spong ba la zhugs nas brgyad pa man chad
translated: Those who abandon the fifth stage and so on, who abandon up to three or four afflictions in the first absorption and then die without abandoning any other afflictions to be abandoned, enter the path abandoning the fifth stage and so on and then die.

original: spangs pa de dag ni 'phags pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba ste /üîΩspang bya'i @167a * //
analyzed: spangs pa de dag ni 'phags pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba ste / spang bya'i @167a * //
translated: Those who abandon up to the eighth stage are ƒÅryas who are once returners.

original: lhag ma lus pas de nas tshe 'phos nas 'dod khams kyi lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba lan re len pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma lus pas de nas tshe 'phos nas 'dod khams kyi lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba lan re len pa'o //
translated: They are called once returners because they take rebirth only once more in the desire realm among gods and humans due to the remaining afflictions to be abandoned.

original: de lta na yang gang rung cig tu lan cig las mi skye bas lan cig phyir 'od ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang rung cig tu lan cig las mi skye bas lan cig phyir 'od ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called once returners because they are born only once more in any one realm.

original: de ltar skye ba gnyis kyi tha ma la gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba gnyis kyi tha ma la gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: In this way, they attain nirvana by manifesting the antidote to the afflictions in their final birth.

original: yang gal te de nyid spang bya'i lhag ma ma spangs par tshe mi 'phos te /
analyzed: yang gal te de nyid spang bya'i lhag ma ma spangs par tshe mi 'phos te /
translated: If they do not die without abandoning the remaining afflictions to be abandoned,

original: de nas dgu pa spong ba'i lam la zhugs pa nas lan ji srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa brgyad pa spang ba'i bar ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dgu pa spong ba'i lam la zhugs pa nas lan ji srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa brgyad pa spang ba'i bar ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Then, from the time of entering the path of abandoning up to the eighth affliction of the summit of existence to be abandoned by the path of meditation, one is called a once returner.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi kun du sbyor ba spangs pas der skye ba mi len pa'o //üîΩde nyid kyi rten la gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba yang yod la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi kun du sbyor ba spangs pas der skye ba mi len pa'o // de nyid kyi rten la gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba yang yod la /
translated: Because one abandons the fetters of the desire realm, one does not take birth there.üîΩSome attain nirvana in this life by manifesting the antidote to that.üîΩAlso, if one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.

original: yang de la spang bya'i lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa las par gyur pa na tshe 'phos shing de nyid nas de'i gnyen po bsgoms pas de yang spangs par gyur ba na dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //üîΩyang gal te /üîΩsa dgu la ni chen po yi //
analyzed: yang de la spang bya'i lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa las par gyur pa na tshe 'phos shing de nyid nas de'i gnyen po bsgoms pas de yang spangs par gyur ba na dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o // yang gal te / sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
translated: If one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.

original: chen po la sogs dri ma rnams //
analyzed: chen po la sogs dri ma rnams //
translated: If one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.üîΩIf one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned, one is called an arhat.

original: gnyen po chung ngu'i chung du la //üîΩsogs pa'i lam ni dag par 'dod //
analyzed: gnyen po chung ngu'i chung du la //üîΩsogs pa'i lam ni dag par 'dod //
translated: If one is born in the summit of existence and abandons the ninth affliction of the summit of existence, the remaining object to be abandoned,

original: zhes gsungs pa dang mthun par khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams cig char spong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang mthun par khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams cig char spong ba ste /
translated: In accordance with that sutra, the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the three realms are simultaneously abandoned.

original: khams gsum du gtogs pa'i bden pa'i bzhi'i chos bsgoms pas chos nyid la log par zhugs pa'i khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams snga ma ltar rnam par phye nas rim gyis spong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum du gtogs pa'i bden pa'i bzhi'i chos bsgoms pas chos nyid la log par zhugs pa'i khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams snga ma ltar rnam par phye nas rim gyis spong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The afflictions of the three realms that wrongly engage their objects are not serially abandoned by meditating on the four truths belonging to the three realms, having previously classified them.

original: de rnams gcig tu bsdoms shing de yang chen po dang 'bring dang chung du rnam pa gsum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de rnams gcig tu bsdoms shing de yang chen po dang 'bring dang chung du rnam pa gsum du 'gyur la /
translated: They are combined into one and that is divided into three types: great, medium and small.

original: de rnams re re yang chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring la sogs pa gsum gsum du phye bas dgur 'gyur ba'o //üîΩde nas dang po chen po'i chung ngu 'am /
analyzed: de rnams re re yang chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring la sogs pa gsum gsum du phye bas dgur 'gyur ba'o // de nas dang po chen po'i chung ngu 'am /
translated: Each of those is divided into three types: great-great, great-medium and so on, making nine.

original: 'bring gi chen po'i bar rnam pa bzhi skye ba bdun gyi bar la ci rigs par spangs nas snga ma ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po'i bar rnam pa bzhi skye ba bdun gyi bar la ci rigs par spangs nas snga ma ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
translated: Then, having abandoned four types, such as small-great or medium-great, in any order, for up to seven existences, one attains nirvana as before.

original: gsum dang lnga'i bar la de rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: gsum dang lnga'i bar la de rnams spangs nas /
translated: are called ‚Äúthose who go to the upper realms.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚Äù

original: tshe'i tha ma de nyid la gnyen po mngon du byas te mya ngan las 'da' ba 'am /üîΩdang po'i tshe gcig po de nyid la gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: tshe'i tha ma de nyid la gnyen po mngon du byas te mya ngan las 'da' ba 'am / dang po'i tshe gcig po de nyid la gnyen po mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚Äù

original: yang tshe de 'am tshe'i tha ma de rnams la gnyen po ma rdzogs shing /
analyzed: yang tshe de 'am tshe'i tha ma de rnams la gnyen po ma rdzogs shing /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs @167b pa 'bring gi 'bring po la sogs pa las par gyur pa na de nyid tshe 'phos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs @167b pa 'bring gi 'bring po la sogs pa las par gyur pa na de nyid tshe 'phos te /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after deathüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after death

original: chung ngu'i 'bring gi bar spangs par gyur pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring gi bar spangs par gyur pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: are called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the next lifeüîΩare called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana in the next life.‚ÄùüîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state after death

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: are called ‚Äúthose

original: yang de nyid la spang bya'i lhag ma ma spangs par tshe 'phos nas 'phos pa'i rten de la dgu pa spong ba'i lam la zhugs shing de spangs bar gyur pa na khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa cig char spangs bas gsum char phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yang de nyid la spang bya'i lhag ma ma spangs par tshe 'phos nas 'phos pa'i rten de la dgu pa spong ba'i lam la zhugs shing de spangs bar gyur pa na khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa cig char spangs bas gsum char phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Again, if one who has not abandoned the remaining objects to be abandoned in the desire realm dies and is reborn in the desire realm, one enters the ninth stage, the path abandoning that stage, and when one abandons that stage, one is a nonreturner who simultaneously abandons all three realms.

original: de nyid ni dgra bcom pa yang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de nyid ni dgra bcom pa yang yin mod kyi /
translated: That person is also an arhat,

original: re zhig phung po'i lhag ma yod pa de srid du phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: re zhig phung po'i lhag ma yod pa de srid du phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya la /
translated: but as long as the remaining aggregates exist, he is called a nonreturner.

original: de nyid spangs par gyur pa lhag ma med pa ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid spangs par gyur pa lhag ma med pa ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When he abandons that stage, he is called an arhat who has no remaining aggregates.

original: de la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: de la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: There are sixteen types of affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yang bsgom pa'i lam ni bden pa rnam par ma phye ba de rnams kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yin pas de spang bar bya ba yang chos can bden pa la log par zhugs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos nyid la
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yang bsgom pa'i lam ni bden pa rnam par ma phye ba de rnams kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yin pas de spang bar bya ba yang chos can bden pa la log par zhugs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos nyid la
translated: The reason is that the path of meditation focuses on suchness, the reality of those that are not differentiated in terms of the four truths. Therefore, the object to be abandoned is not a real subject that engages the four truths, but rather

original: log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: it is an engagement with reality that is erroneous.

original: de'i phyir de la ni snga ma ltar bden pa la brten pa'i dbye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ni snga ma ltar bden pa la brten pa'i dbye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it is differentiated in terms of the four truths, as in the previous case.

original: gzhan yang log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang rnam pa bzhi ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang rnam pa bzhi ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin te ;
translated: Moreover, wrong view, clinging to those as paramount, clinging to rules and ritual as paramount, and doubt are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing alone,

original: / de rnams ni nyon mongs pa kun du brtags pa 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de rnams ni nyon mongs pa kun du brtags pa 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are solely afflicted objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de rnams las ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa drug dang / khams gong ma gnyis na khong khro ba ma gtogs pa rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de rnams las ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa drug dang / khams gong ma gnyis na khong khro ba ma gtogs pa rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur la /
translated: Except for those, in the desire realm there are six afflictions such as attachment, and in the two higher realms there are five each, except for anger.

original: de ltar na thams cad bsdoms pas bcu drug nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad bsdoms pas bcu drug nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, when all are combined, there are sixteen.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams kyi spang bar bya ba'i gtso bo gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams kyi spang bar bya ba'i gtso bo gsungs pa ste /
translated: The principal ones to be abandoned are stated by ‚Äúgreat mind‚Äù and so on.

original: kun nas sbyor zhes pa ni srid pa dang skyes bur kun du sbyor ba 'am /
analyzed: kun nas sbyor zhes pa ni srid pa dang skyes bur kun du sbyor ba 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúBond‚Äù means the bond of existence and the bond of person.

original: yang sdug bsngal dang kun nas sbyor ba zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal dang kun nas sbyor ba zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Or it is also explained as the bond of suffering.

original: chen po dang bar ma dang chung du ni sngar bstan pa'i gang zag tha ma ni dbang po rtul zhing 'bras bu ma thob pa'i dus na nyon mongs de rnams shas che ba'o //
analyzed: chen po dang bar ma dang chung du ni sngar bstan pa'i gang zag tha ma ni dbang po rtul zhing 'bras bu ma thob pa'i dus na nyon mongs de rnams shas che ba'o //
translated: The great, medium, and small are as follows: The final person taught above has dull faculties and when the result is not obtained, those afflictions are predominant.

original: 'bring ni dbang po dang nyon mongs pa 'bring du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni dbang po dang nyon mongs pa 'bring du gyur pa'o //
translated: The medium has medium faculties and afflictions.

original: mchog ni dbang po rno zhing nyon mongs pa chung ba'o //üîΩsnyems pa ni bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa de rnams @168a * //
analyzed: mchog ni dbang po rno zhing nyon mongs pa chung ba'o // snyems pa ni bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa de rnams @168a * //
translated: The best are those with sharp faculties and little defilement.

original: la gnas pas sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: la gnas pas sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Conceit is the inflation of the mind of those who are superior, due to their dwelling on their own superiority.

original: bye brag gis gong nas gong du zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni snga ma ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i bye brag gis gong nas gong du lan cig phyir 'ong ba nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag gis gong nas gong du zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni snga ma ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i bye brag gis gong nas gong du lan cig phyir 'ong ba nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with ‚Äúby the distinction of higher and higher‚Äù is that, by the distinction of abandoning the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, one becomes a once-returner, and so on, up to an arhat.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúthere‚Äù explains that the afflicted view of the self is said to be of two types, by the distinction of being abandoned by the path of seeing and by the path of cultivation.

original: de la yongs su brtags pa ni thog ma med pa nas phyin ci log gi sa bon bsags pa dang 'phral du mi dge ba'i grogs po dang 'grogs shing /
analyzed: de la yongs su brtags pa ni thog ma med pa nas phyin ci log gi sa bon bsags pa dang 'phral du mi dge ba'i grogs po dang 'grogs shing /
translated: Among them, the imagined is the accumulation of the seeds of error since beginningless time, and the immediate association with non-virtuous friends.

original: phyin ci log gi bstan bcos mnyan pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis byung bdag rig pa'i bdag nyid dang / rtag pa dang gcig pu la sogs pa'i khyad par du sgro 'dogs shing /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi bstan bcos mnyan pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis byung bdag rig pa'i bdag nyid dang / rtag pa dang gcig pu la sogs pa'i khyad par du sgro 'dogs shing /
translated: The imaginary self is that which arises from the conditions of listening to treatises that are erroneous, and so forth, and is imagined to have the nature of self-awareness, and to have the attributes of being permanent, unitary, and so forth.

original: bdag gi ba yang de nyid kyis longs spyad par bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ba yang de nyid kyis longs spyad par bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The self's possessions are also imagined to have the attributes of being enjoyed by that self, and so forth.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni de 'dra ba'i khyad par sgro 'dogs pa med pa phyin ci log gi sa bon bsags pa tsam las byung ba grub pa'i mtha'i ma bsgyur ba'i sems can thams cad la thun mong du yod pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni de 'dra ba'i khyad par sgro 'dogs pa med pa phyin ci log gi sa bon bsags pa tsam las byung ba grub pa'i mtha'i ma bsgyur ba'i sems can thams cad la thun mong du yod pa'o //
translated: The innate is that which arises from the mere accumulation of the seeds of error, without the superimposition of such attributes, and is common to all sentient beings who have not studied philosophical systems.

original: de las dang po'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de las dang po'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The first of these is discussed in the following.

original: dpe nye bar 'god ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe nye bar 'god ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The analogy is presented in the line beginning The other-dependent is like an illusion.

original: de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa ni /üîΩ'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa ni /üîΩ'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained in detail.üîΩThe line beginning It is like this explains the analogy.

original: de rnams kyi don ni ji ltar snang ba rig pa sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa las byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni ji ltar snang ba rig pa sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa las byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: The childish conceive of the nature of the imagined, which is the entity of the accumulation of subtle particles of external objects,

original: rdzas gcig gi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: rdzas gcig gi bdag nyid dam /
translated: or the identity of a single substance,üîΩor the essence of mind, ultimate reality, and so on.

original: sems kyi ngo bo don dam pa la sogs par kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen cing rtog pa ltar phung po lnga ru snang ba sems nyid sgyu ma lta bu la yang sngar bstan pa ltar bdag dang bdag gi dngos por rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo don dam pa la sogs par kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen cing rtog pa ltar phung po lnga ru snang ba sems nyid sgyu ma lta bu la yang sngar bstan pa ltar bdag dang bdag gi dngos por rtog pa'o //
translated: As was previously explained, the five aggregates, which appear as the illusion-like mind itself, are also conceived of as the entities of self and entities connected to the self.

original: de la yod pa yang ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'i don de rnams kyi mtshan mar brtags pa med pa'am /
analyzed: de la yod pa yang ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'i don de rnams kyi mtshan mar brtags pa med pa'am /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù and so on is that those signs are not imagined or,

original: yang na rtog mkhan gyi blo'i ngo na med pa yang ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rtog mkhan gyi blo'i ngo na med pa yang ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: alternatively, they do not exist from the perspective of the mind that conceives of them.

original: de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i kun brtags pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes pa ni des thob pa mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i kun brtags pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes pa ni des thob pa mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The imagined view of the transitory collection of the stream-enterers is that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni /üîΩde yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩgang zag la bdag med pa bden pa bzhi chos bcu drug gi rnam par rtog pas bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i ye shes kyis spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni / de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / gang zag la bdag med pa bden pa bzhi chos bcu drug gi rnam par rtog pas bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i ye shes kyis spangs pa'o //
translated: That is clarified in the following.

original: lhan cig @168b skyes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhan cig @168b skyes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: The innate is that which is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de yang 'dir gnyen po'i sgo nas mtshon te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir gnyen po'i sgo nas mtshon te bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, here it is taught by way of illustration through the antidotes.

original: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi lus mnyam pa nyid ces pa la sogs pas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rten bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po rnams sems tsam du mnyam zhing /
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi lus mnyam pa nyid ces pa la sogs pas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rten bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i phung po rnams sems tsam du mnyam zhing /
translated: In that regard, the equality of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô bodies and so on indicates that the aggregates included within one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua, which are the basis of the view of the transitory collection, are equal in being mere mind.

original: sems kyang don dam par stong pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ming bzhi'i phung po dang / gzugs su snang ba tsam gyi gzugs te phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyud skye ba rgyun chags su 'byung ba dang / khyad par du 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams phan tshun du rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes pa spyir ming dang gzugs kyang phan tshun rten dang brten par gyur pa dang /üîΩgzugs dang ro la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: sems kyang don dam par stong pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ming bzhi'i phung po dang / gzugs su snang ba tsam gyi gzugs te phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyud skye ba rgyun chags su 'byung ba dang / khyad par du 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams phan tshun du rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes pa spyir ming dang gzugs kyang phan tshun rten dang brten par gyur pa dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'am /
translated: In general, name and form are mutually supportive andüîΩform and taste and so on or the elements are mutually supportive as cause and effect because they are dependent origination.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir don dam par 'byung ba med pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir don dam par 'byung ba med pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are said to be ultimately empty of the elements.

original: de'i don yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar snang ba ni de ltar snang ba las gzhan ma skyes pa rtag pa'i dngos por yod pa ni mi 'thad la snang ba dang mthun par rgyu las skye ba'i dngos po yang dag par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i don yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar snang ba ni de ltar snang ba las gzhan ma skyes pa rtag pa'i dngos por yod pa ni mi 'thad la snang ba dang mthun par rgyu las skye ba'i dngos po yang dag par mi 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: It is not tenable that what appears as dependent origination is a permanent thing that is not produced from other than that appearance.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that things are produced from causes in accordance with appearance because, as previously explained, it is untenable that an existent, nonexistent, and so on effect is produced.

original: des na 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni dngos po'i phyogs rtag pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa bkag la /
analyzed: des na 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni dngos po'i phyogs rtag pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa bkag la /
translated: Therefore here the reason of dependent origination refutes the position of things as having an essence of permanence.üîΩThe reasonings of existence and nonexistence, arising and ceasing, and so on refute the position of things as having an essence of impermanence.

original: de las gzhan mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni yod med skye 'gag la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis bkag pas gtan tshigs de rnams ni dngos po'i mtha' gzhan bkag pas mthar thug pa'i don la stong pa nyid sgyu ma lta bur gtan la 'bebsüîΩpa'o // de skad du yang /
analyzed: de las gzhan mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni yod med skye 'gag la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis bkag pas gtan tshigs de rnams ni dngos po'i mtha' gzhan bkag pas mthar thug pa'i don la stong pa nyid sgyu ma lta bur gtan la 'bebsüîΩpa'o // de skad du yang /
translated: Therefore those reasonings ascertain the ultimate meaning of emptiness as illusionlike through refuting other extremes of things.

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: Whatever is arisen from conditions is not arisen.

original: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
translated: Whatever depends on conditions is explained to be empty.

original: ces pa la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang gsungs so //
translated: And so on. This is also stated in other s≈´tras.

original: phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin de ltar yin pa la nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pas yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su lta ba mthong ba ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rtag pa du ma'i bdag nyid du yod la /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin de ltar yin pa la nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pas yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su lta ba mthong ba ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rtag pa du ma'i bdag nyid du yod la /
translated: The nature of the aggregates is like this. ≈örƒÅvakas who have entered the stream see the view of the positions of existence and nonexistence. Dependent origination exists as a permanent multiplicity.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rang bzhin du med do zhes de 'dra ba'i phyogs su rtogs shing goms pa'i stobs kyis sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rang bzhin du med do zhes de 'dra ba'i phyogs su rtogs shing goms pa'i stobs kyis sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa na /
translated: It does not exist as the nature of self and mine. Through the power of realizing and cultivating such positions, when the perfection of meditation is complete,

original: de 'dra ba @169a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ba @169a * //
translated: they abandon such positions.

original: spangs shing de nyid kyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan rnams kyang spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spangs shing de nyid kyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan rnams kyang spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Through that meditation, they abandon the other afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation and become arhats.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos dbang po rnon po rnams kyis chos kyi bdag med ba rtogs par slob dpon bha byas bshad de /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos dbang po rnon po rnams kyis chos kyi bdag med ba rtogs par slob dpon bha byas bshad de /
translated: In another way, the master Bhavaviveka explains that sharp-facultied sravakas realize the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs na sngar gyi don phyin ci ma log pa de nyid rgyun du zhugs pa dbang pa rnon po rnams kyis rig pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du yod cing don dam pa'i dngos por med do zhes zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu'i phyogsüîΩsu lta zhing /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs na sngar gyi don phyin ci ma log pa de nyid rgyun du zhugs pa dbang pa rnon po rnams kyis rig pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du yod cing don dam pa'i dngos por med do zhes zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu'i phyogs su lta zhing /
translated: If you follow him, the previously explained unmistaken meaning is that sharp-facultied stream enterers see that the self of the illusion-like knowledge is existent and that the ultimate thing is not existent.

original: mthong ngo zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //üîΩde ltar bshad pa 'di ni mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no // de ltar bshad pa 'di ni mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: They look in the direction of the illusion-like union.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
translated: This explanation is not incorrect because the noble Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslabs shing /üîΩrgyun tu zhugs pa rnams kyang byung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslabs shing / rgyun tu zhugs pa rnams kyang byung ngo //
translated: Those who have trained in this profound perfection of wisdomüîΩhave become stream enterers.üîΩThey will become stream enterers.

original: 'byung ngo // 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa nas dgra bcom pa rnams byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa nas dgra bcom pa rnams byung ngo //
translated: They have become arhats.

original: 'byung ngo 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'byung ngo 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: The statement will arise, is arising and so on, and also:

original: nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: Those who wish to train in the Sravakabhumi

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid mnyan par bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid mnyan par bya /
translated: should listen to this very profound perfection of wisdom,

original: gzung bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: should take it up, and so on.

original: gal te de lta na byang chub sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur gyi nyan thos su mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na byang chub sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur gyi nyan thos su mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then one would become a bodhisattva, but it is not tenable that one would become a sravaka.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: byams pa dang snying rje shas chung bas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa med de /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje shas chung bas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa med de /
translated: they do not generate the thought of highest enlightenment due to their small amount of love and compassion,

original: dman pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they generate the thought of the inferior vehicle.

original: 'di'i don zhib du ni dbu ma snang ba'i rnam par bshad pa de kho na nyid kyi sgron ma las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib du ni dbu ma snang ba'i rnam par bshad pa de kho na nyid kyi sgron ma las shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood in detail from the Alokamala, the commentary on the Madhyamakaloka.

original: de bas na zhes pa la sogs pas lta ba de ni lta ba dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas de spangs par gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na zhes pa la sogs pas lta ba de ni lta ba dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas de spangs par gyur na /
translated: Therefore, since that view is the root of all views and afflictions, when it is abandoned,

original: de rnams thams cad mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: all of them do not arise.

original: khong du chud pa thob pa de ni bden pa bzhi'i don thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa thob pa de ni bden pa bzhi'i don thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: That attainment of understanding is the realization of the meaning of the four truths through the wisdom of hearing and contemplating.

original: shin tu mthong ba ni goms pas mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba ni goms pas mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Seeing well is the actualization of familiarization.

original: lta ba gnyis ni bdag dang bdag gi ba gnyis su rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba gnyis ni bdag dang bdag gi ba gnyis su rtogs pa ste /
translated: The two views are the realizations of self and mine.

original: de rnams spangs pas bden pa bzhis bsdus pa'i chos rnams la the tshom med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams spangs pas bden pa bzhis bsdus pa'i chos rnams la the tshom med par 'gyur te /
translated: Since those are abandoned, one becomes free of doubt with respect to the phenomena subsumed by the four truths.

original: de'i phyir seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa ston pa gzhan rnams la 'di rnams ni phyin ci log gi dri ma dag pa'am ma dag pa zhes @169b rtogs pa'i sgo nas de rnams la brten par bya ba'i 'du shes mi 'byung
analyzed: de'i phyir seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa ston pa gzhan rnams la 'di rnams ni phyin ci log gi dri ma dag pa'am ma dag pa zhes @169b rtogs pa'i sgo nas de rnams la brten par bya ba'i 'du shes mi 'byung
translated: Therefore, with respect to other teachers such as Si·πÉha, HƒÅrita, and Vasu‚Äôs Heart, one does not give rise to the idea of relying on them through the realization that they are either pure or impure of the stains of error.

original: ba'o // de skad du yang /
analyzed: ba'o // de skad du yang /
translated: So it is said:üîΩThe monk does not rely on others,

original: dge sbyong dag dang bram ze gzhan la brten mi byed //
analyzed: dge sbyong dag dang bram ze gzhan la brten mi byed //
translated: on other ascetics or brahmans.üîΩOr again:

original: zhes pa'am / rang gi sa la dogs med rtag tu ri rab 'dra //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'am / rang gi sa la dogs med rtag tu ri rab 'dra // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Like Mount Meru, he is always unshaken in his own ground.

original: rgyal ba'i yum bar ma dang rgyas pa las kyang /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum bar ma dang rgyas pa las kyang /
translated: And in the middle and extensive versions of the Mother of Conquerors,üîΩit says:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa ni rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa ni rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stream enterer, who is abiding in the ground of the stream enterer, is without doubt and hesitation about his own ground.

original: de ltar na the tshom yang gnyen po'i sgo nas mtshon te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na the tshom yang gnyen po'i sgo nas mtshon te bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, doubt is also illustrated and taught by way of its antidote.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mi snyems pa'i rgyu mtshan ni phyi rol pa rnams kyi tshul khrims dang dka' thub me lnga bsten pa dang mdung rtse la mchong ba dang / chu bo 'dus pa'i mtshams su lus 'dor ba la sogs pa dang / log pa'i brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa khyi dang rma bya'i brtul zhugs la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mi snyems pa'i rgyu mtshan ni phyi rol pa rnams kyi tshul khrims dang dka' thub me lnga bsten pa dang mdung rtse la mchong ba dang / chu bo 'dus pa'i mtshams su lus 'dor ba la sogs pa dang / log pa'i brtul zhugs kyi spyod pa khyi dang rma bya'i brtul zhugs la sogs pa dang /
translated: The reason for not being proud of discipline and ritual is that he sees that the discipline and austerities of non Buddhists, such as the five fires, jumping over swords, casting off the body at the confluence of three rivers and so on, and the conduct of perverse ritual, such as the dog and peacock practices,

original: srog gi mchod sbyin la sogs pa ni skye ba 'di dang gzhan du sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i gnas nyid du rab tu mthong ba dang / de las gzhan pa yang dag pa'i tshul khrims kyis kyang mi snyems pa ste bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi mchod sbyin la sogs pa ni skye ba 'di dang gzhan du sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i gnas nyid du rab tu mthong ba dang / de las gzhan pa yang dag pa'i tshul khrims kyis kyang mi snyems pa ste bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the sacrifice of life and so on are the very basis for the occurrence of suffering in this and other lives and he is not proud of even correct discipline because he realizes selflessness.

original: mi 'gyur bdag gis zhes pa ni las sogs par byed pa'i bdag rtag pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gyur bdag gis zhes pa ni las sogs par byed pa'i bdag rtag pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The unchanging self is the permanent self that performs the action.

original: las kyi 'bras bu so so'i skye bo'i longs spyod dang bsam gtan la sogs pa'i bde ba 'dod pa rnams bde ba de rnams dang ldan pa'i lha dang mir skye ba don du gnyer te /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu so so'i skye bo'i longs spyod dang bsam gtan la sogs pa'i bde ba 'dod pa rnams bde ba de rnams dang ldan pa'i lha dang mir skye ba don du gnyer te /
translated: Those who desire the results of karma, the enjoyments of ordinary beings, the happiness of the meditative concentrations, and so forth, strive for rebirth as a god or human endowed with those happinesses.

original: de dag thob par byed pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dang bdag cag ldan no zhes snyems shing nga rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag thob par byed pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa dang bdag cag ldan no zhes snyems shing nga rgyal ba'o //
translated: They are conceited and proud, thinking, ‚ÄúWe are endowed with ethics and so forth that will bring about those rebirths.‚Äù

original: des mi snyems so zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams de ltar mi snyems pa'o //üîΩgzhan du bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni srid pa'i longs spyod pa la sogs pa las gzhan du so so rang gis rig pa'i khyad par chos kyi sku'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i don du sdod cing don dam par de rnams su mngon par
analyzed: des mi snyems so zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams de ltar mi snyems pa'o // gzhan du bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni srid pa'i longs spyod pa la sogs pa las gzhan du so so rang gis rig pa'i khyad par chos kyi sku'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i don du sdod cing don dam par de rnams su mngon par
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are not conceited‚Äù refers to the fact that the ƒÅryas are not conceited in that way.

original: zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the other passage beginning ‚ÄúI will attain‚Äù is that, apart from the enjoyments of cyclic existence and so forth, one should remain in order to attain the special wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya, which is to be realized by each one for himself or herself. Ultimately, one should not cling to those rebirths.

original: tshul khrims kyi yan lag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni snga ma de nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yan lag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni snga ma de nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe branches of ethics‚Äù explains the same point as the previous passage.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams spangs pa'i ban yon gsungs so //üîΩblo gros chen pos gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni rgyun du zhugs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na 'dod chags gang spangs pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams spangs pa'i ban yon gsungs so // blo gros chen pos gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni rgyun du zhugs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na 'dod chags gang spangs pa nyid ston te /
translated: The line MahƒÅmati... and so forth explains the benefits of abandoning those.üîΩThe line MahƒÅmati said... and so forth teaches what desire is abandoned at the stage of being a stream enterer.

original: yul la lus kyi dbang po'i 'dod chags @170a * //
analyzed: yul la lus kyi dbang po'i 'dod chags @170a * //
translated: The line Desire is the attachment of the sense organ to objects teaches the definition of desire.
